Reviews.Title: “EPITOME OF LUXURY!!!”
Reviews.Author: Connie W
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights at the beginning and end of our Grand Canyon adventure! This place was great. The rooms are HUGE and luxurious!! The Irish pub in the hotel is the BEST place to eat if you want typical Irish pub fare. We went here two out of the three nights. The cafe is GREAT for breakfast and far more reasonable that the other restaurant in the hotel. The pool was somewhere I could have hung out all day if I had the chance and they have a menu there where you can order food if you want to spend the afternoon. The only thing I didn't like was the $10 charge for internet - its a bit ridiculous considering the price you are paying for a room. Other than that though, I would highly recommend this place. We didn't want to stay on the strip as we were travelling with our son. We had a car but they have a shuttle that you can take to and from the strip. I would love to go back to this hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Best Pedicure Ever”
Reviews.Author: ilse7
Reviews.Content: This place would have gotten a 5 star from me, based solely on the pedicure that I received at the spa, but my hotel room smelled like smoke (even though we requested a non-smoking room), so they only get a 4 star.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel with house keeping problems.”
Reviews.Author: Qualityforme
Reviews.Content: My wife and I go to this resort hotel every Spring to celebrate our wedding anniversary. We have always loved it. The rooms are fantastic, luxurious bedding and towels. Rooms are large, elevators fast. Just really classy overall. The grounds are beautiful and the pool area is fantastic. We just returned home yesterday and thought I ought to make a couple of observations. We stayed in the Palms Tower on the fourth floor, mountain view. As soon as we went to our room upon arrival, we were surprised at how badly the hallways need a good vacuuming. There are bits of towel or rag shreds dotting the carpets everywhere...I mean everywhere! To the house keeping managers, I urge you to buy a good vacuum cleaner and use it everyday! We found a hook assembly to a woman's underwear on the floor just outside our door. Come on. This is a JW Marriott resort, please do not act like a dirty, cheap motel! Clean it right every day, please. We also noticed that plastic drinking cups, beer cans and trash overflow the tops of cigarette sand recepticles throughout the grounds, never to be picked up. Even litter dots the grounds, ignored by hotel staff. We stayed three nights, and the litter and garbage problem remained untouched the entire time we were there. This negative aspect of our stay was kind of icky. It was as if the hotel was trying to cut costs by not picking up litter, emptying cigarette disposal stands, and by not vacuuming floors. Normally, such neglect tells the customer the hotel is in financial stress. Our first night was filled with loud, boisterous young teen girls running and yelling up and down the halls of the 4th floor in Palm Towers. They were removing "Do Not Disturb" signs, which we couldn't have known. Next morning, early Sunday AM, housekeeping is trying to get into our room and ruined things for us. Thanks! I called the front desk with a very gentle, kind request if they might have someone come encourage the rowdy girls to tone it down. I was told "no", that the hotel does not do that sort of thing. HUH??? Maybe we stayed at this Marriott Resort Hotel while staff was having attitude issues and needed a hug? It was quite odd. The pool area has a large swimming pool and two adjacent hot tubs on opposite sides of the huge pool. One hot tub was sort of disgusting with greenish, filmy water. I hope they remedy that before we return in a couple of months. The hotel staff are generally very friendly, informed and helpful. The staff at the pool area are really stellar and deserve highest praise from Marriott corporate managers! They could not have been more kind, thoughtful and cheerful. This hotel has free parking everywhere, and no resort amenities fees....a big plus!!! Thank you Marriott. We love this property and can't wait to get back there again. I only hope they can improve their program for keeping the hallways and grounds picked up, tidy and enjoyable. Maybe they ought to consider hiring a real professional in this department. Bottom line: JW Marriott Resorts have a reputation for being among the finest in the world, but this past weekend this property fell down a bit. I am hopeful this will be resolved and not this way again when we return in coming months.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Experience”
Reviews.Author: SnowHillPond
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the JW for a couple of nights in March 2012 on a business trip. Here are my notes: 1. Room: I had a suite in the Palm Tower. It was very nice with a walk-in closet, extremely huge bathroom suite, a half-bath, two TVs, and two balconies. The suite was bigger than my first apartment out of college. One complaint: my room was about 1/4 mile from the check-in desk. It's a long way to carry a bag. 2. Location: The resort is considerably away from the Strip and so almost all of our activites were confined to the resort. Great view of the mountains. The resort has a ton of restaurants, a spa, golf, etc. 3. Meeting Facilities: The meeting rooms and banquet facilities were very adequate. The meeting rooms were great. We had some meals catered. Breakfast was fine (scrambled eggs, croissants, fresh fruit, etc.). Lunch was fine as well. No complaints. 4. Casino: Lots of slots, a betting parlor, basic table games (black jack, roulette, craps, etc.) No poker room. 5. Restaurants: We ate at the Irish Pub for lunch and Spiedini, Italian fare, for dinner. I had the fish and chips at the Pub. The chips were excellent and the fish was a little dry. I had the fish stew at Spiedini, it was salty. 6. Staff: Professional and courteous.

Reviews.Title: “Birthday Retreat”
Reviews.Author: Gail H
Reviews.Content: This spa resort is absolutely beautiful and the service was impeccable. This was a birthday get away for me and I fully enjoyed every minute of it. The staff and the facility was very clean and complimentary to my every needs. The suites are very tastefully decorated with great amenities. The location was in a lovely area not too close to the Las Vegas Strip I would definitely stay at this resort again.

Reviews.Title: “Best Birthday Getaway”
Reviews.Author: DRDU
Reviews.Content: My wife and I shared our birthdays and treated ourselves to a wonderful evening of fun and pleasure. Though we are locals and have stayed at other Strip hotels before, this hotel actually won hands down overall. We arrived earlyfor check-in where the valet told us to find out which building we would be in. It wasn't the spa tower which is where we wanted to be since the spa and Ceres restaurant was located in here. It was the Palm tower on the first floor which we had to drive to. We had second thoughts but when we checked out the room and patio view of the water ponds, it was perfect. A simple walk through the hotel restaurants and stores got us to our couples massage reservations. It was well worth the package price of $329 that also included an excellent breakfast buffet. Our dinner at Ceres was perfect. A simple menu with wine pairing that they suggest, followed by a surprise birthday dessert dish, made the whole dinner worthwhile. Our waitress, who is from Bosnia, gave us the best service of all time. Ceres is a romantic type restaurant you have to go to and the prices are very reasonable. The room we stayed in was a junior suite which was rather large and the jacuzzi tub made for a roomy bubble bath for two. The tv speaker inside the bathroom was a neat feature. There was a second bathroom at the front door entry along with the bar area that had a frig. And how can I not forget the complimentary champagne and chocolate covered strawberries that the concierge sent us!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: blitz12
Reviews.Content: Great Property. Close to several fun resturants, etc. Off the strip, in a fun location. Great pools, hot tubs, etc. The room was good. Bathroom was big and spacious, great soaking tub. Spa and Fitness center is awesome. Spend some time relaxing and enjoying the Fitness Center and locker room. Great place to relax. The grounds are well groomed and well taken care of. Beautiful resort. Rooms are good but not fantastic, nothing special. Customer service was OK, not that great for a JW resort. You will like your stay if you want to get away from the strip and relax.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay at JW Marriot”
Reviews.Author: Randy C
Reviews.Content: Great time as usual overall. Bath Robes wonderful, but I did have to ask for them from the front desk. Checked got a room with double bed, asked for a king and got it the next day. Wonderful view of TPC Golf Course across the way. In room jacuzzi, pick up some bath oil and have some fun, very relaxing, would have been better if they had a tv in bathroom while relaxing in jacuzzi, but still great. Bed very comfortable. This hotel is about 20 minutes from the strip, but very close to three golf courses, and close enough to a few others. Very good hotel to kick back in while in Las Vegas. We landed in Las Vegas, got a rental car and went to Lawreys House of Prime Rib, this made the whole trip. If you like prime rib you will find Lawreys exquisite, with excellent service. We had Prime Rib again at the casino, which is on the Marriott property, but not part of the hotel. The Prime Rib was the worst and toughest Prime Rib I've ever had, I would not even taken this to my dog, yes it was that bad, and I don't complain. The Casino was fun and had some really fun blackjack games, no fun when you loose, we lost and it was fun. The Weekend breakfast buffet just down from the Concierge desk was fantastic. I will stay here again, but will not eat in the cafe.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, off the Strip Property”
Reviews.Author: delmov
Reviews.Content: The valet service was wonderful. There are two front desks and the one is not always staffed. The rooms are a nice size about 500 square feet. The property is connect to a small casino. There is a fun Irish Pub.

Reviews.Title: “Off-Strip Down Time”
Reviews.Author: DesertOwl
Reviews.Content: My second trip to this off strip property in Las Vegas, both stays were up to par for the JW Marriott resort standards. I did not have to wait in a very long at reception, check-in was quick and easy and the staff was helpful and friendly. My standard room was comfortable, spacious and very clean. Spa tub, huge marble bathroom and a foyer which had an interior door so that you could shut out hallway noise/voices. Awesome feature. I was on the 6th floor in the Palms tower which I highly recommed as it is very quiet - if that's what you're looking for in a Vegas experience. I went for a spa weekend and I did not hear one single person on both sides of my room or in the hallway. There are so so food choices from sushi, Italian, pub or buffet to choose from since you are far from the strip. There is a casino which gets quite a few locals. Slots were progressive and I was "up" quite a bit! The only aspect of this hotel is that you do have to pay to get there from the airport if you don't rent a car. The private town car arranged with the hotel is the best and less expensive option at $45. The hotel grounds are peaceful as there are waterfalls and koi ponds surrounding the entire property. It a great place to stay if you want a low key Vegas experience.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the room!”
Reviews.Author: SanFranShopper
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay here after having stayed on the strip for 2 nights. I was happy to get away from the strip to a more relaxed atmosphere. The service was ok. The room was fantastic! We loved the view. We loved the large room. The bedding was amazing. The french doors that lead to the balcony were beautiful. We loved the surround sound in the bathroom. We loved the jacuzzi tub. We thought the decorations were very classy and we very much enjoyed our stay here. It was a beautiful resort and it was only a very short drive to Red Rock Canyon (which was AMAZING!). If you're coming to Vegas to party on the strip then this might not be the hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “Nice But Not Impressive - No shuttle from airport”
Reviews.Author: IV_BOYS
Reviews.Content: Overall the resort was a nice hotel and the landscaping around the hotel and in the courtyards was beautiful but I felt that the interior was dated. In addition I didn't feel they had enough staff working in the restaurants or casino to accommodate the guests. There is also no shuttle from the airport to the resort and you'll pay about $50-$60 for a cab ride. If your planning on going to the strip be very careful of the hotel's shuttle schedule as It doesn't run continuously and you may find yourself stuck on the strip! The casino is virtually all smoking except for a small area in the middle of the non-smoking area. I live in a state that does not allow smoking indoors so I was shocked to walk into a cloud of smoke upon arrival.

Reviews.Title: “Off strip resort with a Tuscan villa feel”
Reviews.Author: SnyderFlyer
Reviews.Content: I really enjoy the Marriott brand and this JW Marriott is a prime example why. Located in Summerlin, about 20 miles off 'the Strip', this resort boasts all of the Vegas amenities without the craziness of the Strip. Rooms are generously proportioned as are the bathrooms and walkin closets. Service is always excellent ( I stay here every 2 weeks ). The casino is smaller but adequate, and there are plenty of excellent onsite restaurants to satisfy culinary curiosity. I love the way the resort is designed with water features and pathways throughout the property.

Reviews.Title: “New Management & Changing”
Reviews.Author: CBUS2SD
Reviews.Content: I was a huge fan of this JW. The previous management team was awesome for the guest. It appears they are under new management with more of a Casino culture vs. a traditional JW culture. The front desk management team needs immediate improvement. Sorry to loose them as one of my choices, many good memories at this JW. Wish them the best. A huge a Marriott fan. Moved to the Renaissance near the Convention Center and very happy!!

Reviews.Title: “Always excellent”
Reviews.Author: lib88
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here a number of times of the years and this is my favorite hotel in Vegas. I am not a big fan of the casinos. The smoke and the constant assault from the noise is too much. The JW has a casino but it is small in comparison to the strip and the clientele is older. This makes this hotel great for families with kids that are not interested in the skin the strip offers. There are plenty of restaurants within a mile of the hotel and the rooms are always clean and spacious.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Las Vegas Experience with the Las Vegas Sleaze”
Reviews.Author: Bigredmachine
Reviews.Content: The Marriott is located in Summerland, about 20 minutes from the strip and is the perfect home base for a Las Vegas vacation. Summerland is a nice clean, upscale suburb in the western part of the Vegas valley and is a haven from the bombardment of Las Vegas Strip Sleaze. Typical of Marriott, the hotel is very clean and staff pleasant and efficient. We stayed the week between Christmas and New Years and the hotel was extremely quite. Maybe this is why we were upgraded to a larger room then we had booked. Our room also came with a free buffet breakfast which was excellent. The food choices were not expansive, but all items were very fresh, high quality and cook perfectly. There are excellent gold courses in the area and the staff was very helpful arranging rounds, as well as show tickets. They also suggested local excursions to Red Rock Canyon.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Gem of an Oasis”
Reviews.Author: Mary M
Reviews.Content: This resort is a welcome change to the non-stop hotels and casinos on the Las Vegas Strip, but a quick cab ride away if you want to spend time at different casinos or shows. The resort area is fantastic with a world-class fitness facility. The casino was super-clean and nicely arranged. The grounds are beautiful with meditation gardens and benches tucked in here and there. We had a 1 bedroom suite that was absolutely spectacular and overlooked the morning sunrise and mountains. Will definitely stay here again...

Reviews.Title: “Away from strip, close to golf, nice for families”
Reviews.Author: pickyreno
Reviews.Content: As a platinum marriott member who has stayed over 200 nights at marriotts last year, this one is very typical of Marriott golf resorts. The rooms are larger with older style decore to appeal to golfers. Angel park is across the street and you can play at the Las Vegas TPC, not the Summerlin TPC. The hotel provides a shuttle to Angle park. I have stayed here many times to keep my kids away from the strip, it is a wonderful location for golf and plenty of room for the kids to run. Our last stay was in the main Spa tower ground floor with large patio that was great for the kids to run. My favorite stay is actually in the annex palm tower across the other end of the Rampart casino, with a room overlooking the man made creek water element. The service could improve at the reception desk, as staff appeared distant and unwelcoming compared to past stays. The main hotel has a nice weekend breakfast buffet. Being platinum only gets me free internet, check in points, use of spa...no breakfast. The rooms need a high end tech panel, this was disappointing. Great golf and relaxing stay.

Reviews.Title: “You know what your going to get with JW Marriott”
Reviews.Author: TravelagentDerek
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the JW Marriott Las Vegas. We requested a balcony room with a view of the golf course, which was granted. As always easy check in, good food in the Rampart Buffet, Irish pub is great for some late food and drink with live music. We had a problem with the hot water valve sticking open on the bathtub on our first night, we called the front desk and a gentleman from the engineering department showed up right away to fix it. The only thing I fear is that the carpet and furniture in some of the rooms are starting to look a little worn, I hope this property is able to keep up with referbs. Don't hesitate to stay at this property for a relaxing Vegas getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but not Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: Davidwatts
Reviews.Content: Large resort property, which includes a golf course (I don’t play, so no evaluation of the course), large outdoor pool, well equipped fitness center, very nice spa, casino and 10 or so separate establishments serving food and/or drinks. Rooms are large, especially the bathrooms, which have separate showers and bathtubs and an enclosed toilet room. Rooms feature walk-in closets; are quite comfortable and well furnished. (NOTE: The large fitness center fee is $25 for non-elite Marriott Rewards members; there is also a small, but adequate, free fitness room). Location is in Summerlin, 20 minutes or so west of the strip and about 20 minutes from the airport; a good location if one desires to avoid the crowds and congestion on the strip. The Red Rocks and SunCoast Casinos are nearby if you are in need of additional variety. Service is good, but frankly seemed a beat slow. JW Marriott is Marriott’s premier brand; consequently service should be exceptional. BOTTOM LINE: Good choice for relaxation, nicer than the SunCoast Casino, on par with the Red Rocks. Recommend a comparison of all three prior to booking.

Reviews.Title: “Not the JW I was expecting....”
Reviews.Author: AZPILOT
Reviews.Content: This was my first/last stay at this JW. The hotel is awesome from the outside, but it seems to be below the JW cut in my opinion. The service was okay, nothing special. Where things really went downhill was the casino that divides the two hotels. I wasn't aware there were two separate / separated hotels. The main hotel looks very nice, I was in the annex. Not sure if it was just my room, but had to wait a long time for hot water and environment only ran when I was in the room. It is motion activated. In order to get to the front desk or the actual property with the concierge lounge, you have to walk through the active casino. It is smokey. The restaurants adjoin the casino, they were smokey. The food was marginal at the two I tried, they comped my dinner at the Irish pub because it was had been sitting so long before they served it. Entree was still near frozen. If you want the full monte Las Vegas feel of a smokey casino, marginal food and the like - then this may be your JW. It was not mine.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Resort in Beautiful, Upscale Summerlin”
Reviews.Author: OahuHawaii
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here several times and always are eager to return. It is located off the strip in Summerlin...a quick 10 minutes away. They try to give us our favorite room when possible. Parking is free with valet. Check-in has always been easy and efficient. Concierge has been helpful and the same woman has been there for years. The hotel rooms are very large...with the bathrooms HUGE. Bathroom has a very large soaking tub, long vanity w/2 sinks, separate shower room and commode room. Shower has both reg. shower and overhead rain head. Marble is everywhere. Thick towels. There is a refrgerator in the room and a ceiling fan. The bed and pillows are very comfy. It feels very clean between the sheets! There is a view of the strip at night with the pretty lights. The pool is a favorite of ours. Plenty of seating with tables and umbrellas. The grounds are mature and very private. Alot of grass. Outside restaurant by pool has great sandwiches and salads. We always have lunch there. Service is friendly, not necessarily fast. Mostly couples or families. Quiet atmosphere...great for relaxing and getting that fabulous desert sun. Hotel houses The Rampart Casino, which is fun to loose your money at. Alot of locals. Fair drink service. Pretty smokey. Good restuarants, especially JC Wooloughan's...the Irish Pub. They have the best fried cod and service is always nice. We go there evertime. We like this resort VERY much and I think you will too.

Reviews.Title: “Great Off Strip Hotel”
Reviews.Author: warrdogg
Reviews.Content: I've been staying at the JW Marriott for 3 years now. It's a great place if you want to get away from the typical Strip crowds. If you are staying here I would recommend a rental car, as you are 20 or so minutes drive away from the Strip. The hotel provides a shuttle service to the Strip, have never used it. The hotel and grounds are beautiful and well maintained. Check-in is usually fast and there's almost never a line up. All the staff that I have encountered, from the front desk, doormen, servers have been attentive and professional. The rooms are spacious and clean. The bathrooms are fitted with 2 sinks in marble countertops and have huge tubs and a separate shower. The rooms I have stayed in have balconies with French doors. The room is equipped an LCD TV, chairs, desk, and that amazing Marriott bed. In the summer months the pool is one of the best I have ever used. I enjoyed the salt water instead of the chorine. Too bad it's not heated for when I stay in December. I have tried the breakfast buffet at Ceres. It's usually a pretty good buffet, albeit a little more expensive than most. The dining room is very beautiful. I went into the spa facility to look around, but have not able to use it yet. The place looked clean and the treatments were reasonably priced. I plan on using it in future visits. I do like to gamble, so having the Rampart casino attached is a bonus. I find the casino to be less crowded than most, but it's awfully smoky. If you like to play craps, as I do, it's hard to beat the 100X odds.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, very good service”
Reviews.Author: chicagowl
Reviews.Content: Was here for a conference. The rooms are huge and very clean and comfortable. The beds are comfortable but the pillows are so small that it was hard to sleep comfortably. Every staff person was very friendly and accommodating. The hotel caters to conference and over 65 crowd so I would not stay here if you don't fit into one of those categories. There are plenty of restaurants and a small casino on site (all seemed rather quiet). Iris about a $45 ride from the hotel to the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Fitness center, expensive”
Reviews.Author: G M
Reviews.Content: Just as an FYI. The fitness center is very good. But it costs just over $20.00 to use.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Relax outside of Vegas”
Reviews.Author: alaskareed
Reviews.Content: This JW Marriott is the best place off the strip, if you have a car you can run in to see shows and the night life along the strip. There is a casino on the grounds plus a good spa and golfing. The hotel is a 6 story 2 building resort. Try to stay in the spa tower

Reviews.Title: “The best place to stay off the Strip”
Reviews.Author: AA75
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel several times and I fall in love with it more and more. Everyone here is always very nice and helpful. The valet is very efficient, the food (there are several restaurants) is great and the grounds of the hotel are just gorgeous. It may be an "older" hotel but the rooms are always clean. The casino is usually filler with the local older crowd and I have never seen it really busy. Its close to the higway and is about 20-25 mi from the airport. The area is very nice, with a gold course and a shopping center close by. For snacks and water I like to stop by the Whole Foods which is only a couple of minutes away.

Reviews.Title: “Going downhill fast!”
Reviews.Author: Phun-seekers
Reviews.Content: Used to be a great property. I have stayed here about 15-20 times. Service is AWFUL. Not the typical Marriott experience. Great location near Whole Foods, The Cheesecake Factory, BJ's, etc. Also, convenient to Red Rock casino. Nice to avoid the chaos of The Strip..20 minutes away. Large rooms, nice pool a very quiet property. Service is so bad it trumps all that is good with the property. Stay elsewhere!

Reviews.Title: “JW Marriot Vegas- Nice place (for some)”
Reviews.Author: mleafs
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a seminar- a 24 hour stay. I had read reviews beforehand, and found the critic reviews to be slanted. First off- a disclaimer, if you want action and the heat of the strip, no need to read further. The resort is located 20 minutes from the strip, near Red Rock Canyon. I have been to Vegas probably 40 times since the 80's, and personally I found the JW Marriott a nice change. The lobby is very nice, I was able to have an hour and a half conversation on a Sat night with an old friend in an almost semi private location. I loved the fact that you can get to room in 2 minutes, unlike the typical Vegas Casino which you have to walk a mile. I booked a room a week in advance on their website (got a $15 discount), and asked for an upgrade to a room with a balcony which was honored. The rooms are great, very big and had a walk in closet. The bathroom came with a large bathtub with jets, and a huge shower with a rainbow shower head. The comfort of the bed was so-so. The balcony had a view of the golf course. The grounds were excellent, the casino was a short walk from the hotel rooms. The casino has 5 restaurants. For dinner we tried the old school steak house restaurant, food was pretty good and fairly priced. The casino was a pretty dead scene for a Sat night. The following is what I didn't like: If you are flying in and have no transportation- you will get bored, you can always go to the Red Rock Casino about 2 miles away. The crowd is 50 years and older, and probably children in the warmer months. Food options for Lunch is lame. If you want a relaxing time, with out the "distractions" of the strip, the JW Marriott is for you.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the rainhead shower and shower set up”
Reviews.Author: travelinlight58
Reviews.Content: A really great hotel off the beaten path on Vegas. Great views of the mountains and wildlife. Pool was nice. I really liked the rainhead shower and the whole shower set up. Really nice.

Reviews.Title: “1 of my favorite JW's - off strip, no smoke, nice suites, incredible service”
Reviews.Author: DougUtah
Reviews.Content: For some this is an ideal property off strip. Staying enough in Las Vegas on stip, this is an off strip oasis in a terrific location. Golf, restaurants and shopping are in close proximity. As a Marriott Platinum I am often upgraded and always remembered as a welcome back guest. Valet is especially convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Its the right place to relax”
Reviews.Author: Pravesh_11
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well located, you can feel at home with the kind of service they provide, 24 hrs restaurant is open with hot & delicious food on buffet.The rooms,beds,bathroom are very well designed, but the rooms are bit expensive as per location.

Reviews.Title: “for work, not fun”
Reviews.Author: KatieDavis
Reviews.Content: This place is okay for a work event, but not a social or vacation trip. You're out in suburbia. The hotel is big, the pool is small and the casino is tiny. Pool towels a joke. The rooms are big and nice, the bathroom is FANTASTIC (hence my 4 versus 3 star rating). Being that this hotel is more expensive than rooms on the strip, I can't understand why we paid to stay here vs the strip or elsewhere in Vegas off the strip. I was there for a work event as we booked out the whole hotel. I would not choose it on my own. The reason I'm writing this review though is b/c since it is off the strip, you have to think of transportation options from the airport to the hotel. Taxi would be worst option as a private car (if you book ahead) would cost you the same and then you wouldn't have to wait in the airport taxi line. The best and most fun deal though is to just rent a shuttle! If you do this through the concierge, you can book a full shuttle (it fit 20 of us!) for $136. That was a deal and kinda fun to book a bus for all back to the airport. Wish we knew of this for the way to the hotel as well. The website doesn't mention it as the web mentions the car company for private drivers but not this stellar shuttle deal. Anyways... hotel rooms are good. Casino, location, pool were not. Stay here again? hope not.

Reviews.Title: “Price quoted not honored.”
Reviews.Author: dustyo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the resort for one night. We were on a road trip to Idaho. We are Marriott club members and have stayed at the resort several times and just love it. This time I called about a month before our planned visit. I was quoted a senior rate of $161. That is a bit more than I would normally pay but love the resort, pool, casino and buffet. About two weeks before our trip I received an email, from Marriott, with a price of $143.75. I immediately called the number in the email and was told that the price would be honored. I wrote down the date called and person's name that I spoke to. Long story short, when we checked in the price was not honored. I made a complaint again before we left but still nothing. We were even more upset that we couldn't even use the pool because there were thunder storms. :( I have no complaints about the resort. The rooms are lovely. The grounds are beautiful. The buffet is very good and reasonably priced. We will be shopping around for another place to stay on our next visit to Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “okay for a convention”
Reviews.Author: gsoncnative
Reviews.Content: My husband and I attended a convention here after spending 2 days at the Trump las vegas. The hotel seemed quite new and the rooms were very nice. Bedding was comfortable, but our air never worked quite well enough at night.I've always believed hotels cut the air at night to save money. The bathrooms are great- very large with double sinks and rain shower.Also a super large tub. The pool is very pretty with lots of chairs and umbrellas. Also 2 hot tubs.My biggest complaint is the staff. Our maid was very nice, but others I dealt with seemed too busy to be bothered.There is a pretty large cassino, and the resort is way too large, so it is pretty impersonal.I much preferred the Trump.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing customer service”
Reviews.Author: myopinionz
Reviews.Content: When you first walk into the lobby they have iced water with lemons for you. This is a great touch since it is in the middle of the desert after all. We checked in on a Friday night and the front desk was fairly busy at the time of our arrival. The check in process was smooth and we were assisted in a very timely manner. The suite was amazing, but a little worn/outdated. It was very comfortable and quiet. We had a large patio that was by the waterfall/pond so the sounds of that was really relaxing as well. The only thing negative to say about this experience is that the patio could have been swept, but it is autumn so things are falling rapidly. I am in Vegas monthly and this is the 1st, but not the last, time that I have stayed at this resort. You do not feel like you are in Vegas at all! You get away from everything here.

Reviews.Title: “Don't expect Platinum perks.....”
Reviews.Author: anonymous316
Reviews.Content: I was very dissapointed at the lack of perks that I have grown accustomed to as a platinum member at this hotel. The biggest dissapointment was when they lied to me at check in. I asked for a room with a view of the mountains which most rooms have, and was told they were sold out and could not upgrade me. We preceded to walk to a couple of the restauants and bars and there was no one around?? Starting asking the help where is everyone and they told us it was only 50% occupied- which is what I suspected but not sure why the front desk told us they were sold out. They gave us a room in the middle of a soccer team and there were doors slamming and loud talk that woke us up the first night.Then we asked again for an upgrade and cut our touring short to get back and move rooms, and although the second room was bigger it had no view, so was not worth making the change. Also, some of the basic services that you get from ALL other Marriotts did not seem to apply here....no newspaper in the morning, not greated as a platinum member....just a mention that they had my elite status on file, and no special check in for platinum members. All and all the people at the front desk did not seem to care, but the rest of the staff at the pool and restaurant did seem friendly. Also, if you plan on going the end of October, be aware that they take in many teams, so the place has tons of kids, and although well behaved overall, the hallways, restaurants and pool felt like Orlando. I came here from the Cosmpolitan on the strip where they treated me great as a platinum member and was hoping for a quiet place to chill but would have preferred to have extended my stay at the Cosmopolitan where their service was so much better than the JW.

Reviews.Title: “Ho Hum - Not a Vegas Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nulles
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this property because we were having a convention. A $60,00 cab ride (one way) from the airport. Old and very tired hotel. Air conditioning did not work, room temp stuck at 75 degrees for 3 nights. The ceiling fan helped, but it was still hot. Stayed in the Palm Court Suites, 6th Floor. Ginormous room, with old furniture, old carpets, and old drapes. Room has a very small step out balcony. There was an plastic bag of trash the maid left sitting outside the balcony door for the entire visit. The guests here are the blue hairs, some families with little kids screaming around. Casino is boring and not sure if guest are napping or playing the slots. The food is average at best. One bright spot was a Starbucks on the food court level. I would never come to Vegas and stay off the strip. No point, The only reason you stay here is if you have no choice. They offer great rates for conventions and we are all stuck here wandering around the half empty property. Ho -hum, let's hope there isn't another convention in my future!

Reviews.Title: “Service-oriented resort”
Reviews.Author: Oakland_Dude
Reviews.Content: Located some distance from the Strip, this JW Marriott facility offers comfortable rooms and a high level of service. A recent three-day stay offered an opportunity to enjoy the grounds and explore local restaurants; a casino in the hotel, although small by Vegas standards, offered many gaming options. Be aware that taxi fare from McCarran International Airport is expensive; taxis or limos can easily be shared if traveling with a group. Some furniture is a bit tired, but overall room accommodations were very good.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Property for a Get Away”
Reviews.Author: CTYankee143
Reviews.Content: Came for a conference at this property and was delighted with the facility. Room was spacious, clean and decorated with an upscaled feel to it. The resort has many amenities. The pool was beautiful and well cared for. The many restaurants all had great service and excellent food. Even the banquet food was top notch. I was really impressed with this resort for a conference stay and/or a personal get away.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Location”
Reviews.Author: TheQueGuy
Reviews.Content: I visited this location for a meeting event that was held near the strip so the purpose of the trip was business but the purpose of the stay was leisure because I stayed there for the weekend prior to my business meeting and then relocated down to the Bellagio on the strip. I completely loved this location. I am a Platinum Member for ten consecutive years so I know a lot about Marriott's. The biggest thing I will say about this place is that it has incredible ambiance and fantastic golfing. I was fortunate to stay in a upgraded junior suite which consisted of an extremely comfortable bed, large bathroom with a whirlpool tub, separate stand up shower, his and her sinks as well as a big walk-in closet in addition to a living room area. The only downside to the big room is that there was only one large flat screen television in the bedroom and living room area so you could only watch the television at one room at a time and in order to do so I had to swivel the television 180 degrees in order to watch it in the room of my choice. Amenities here are great. The views from my room are spectacular. I also got a chance to visit the spa a few times there and take advantage of their steam room and sauna. Very nice and relaxing there so I found myself spending a significant portion of time there during the visit. The gym is nice as well with a great view of one of the several outdoor pools. Speaking of pools, they have one of the most incredible views of a huge fish pond that included "oversized goldfish" and several pools. I was slightly inconvenienced on one day because there was a wedding that held on the property so I had to walk around that but I dont consider that a bad thing per se considering that it was for a special occasion for some lucky couple. The even bigger thing to think about here is the fact that the couple thought so highly of the location's ambiance that they chose to get married there considering "Vegas weddings" are not exactly a novelty. Apparently weddings are pretty commonplace there but again, it was definitely nice enough to be married there. Proximity to strip and area attractions is very good. Just a few minutes away to golf which I was able to play a around of. The Vegas strip is about a 15-20 minute drive away. There is always plenty of taxicab availability to take you there or to the airport as well. Service was exceptional. From the front desk staff to the concierge to the spa staff and room cleaning, everyone there was a delight to assist. I rated this hotel a four star stars largely because of a experience I had with the shower which at one point backed up and started to emit whatever the hell was in the drain up in towards the shower (not a pleasant experience) so I complained about that and the front desk did compensate my room charges for my breakfast very quickly for that. So overall, I'd definitely recommend this as a place to visit and stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to relax, enjoy and have fun!!!”
Reviews.Author: jakenjod
Reviews.Content: After my training ended on Friday in Vegas, my man and I moved to a hotel in Summerlin, NV called the JW Marriott. I HIGHLY recommend this place to anyone who is looking to go to Vegas but doesn't like the glitz and glam of the strip and wants something a little more laid back, low key and even a little romantic. ♥ They have jacuzzi tubs in every room, beautiful balconies with French doors that open up to beautiful views of the Red Rock canyon area and they have a casino on site. The rooms are very spacious and the bathrooms are wonderful!! I just wish we could stay longer. The casino has great music at night and we had a blast. Can't wait to come back!! The ONLY thing I can say a little negative is that there are some parts of the hotel that need updating but honestly the grounds area and surrounding views are to die for that you forget about the flowered out-dated rugs and the gold accents. :) Thanks JW Marriott!

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a 'quiet' Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: BobbyGolfs
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay. It was my first time in Vegas, and while I was there for business, i managed to sit near the pool with my laptop and enjoyed the gorgeous weather. I also squeezed in a round of golf at TPC/Las Vegas which is a 5 minute ride from the front door (by the way, incredible views from TPC and so I'd recommend the golf course as well). The JW is about a 25 minute ride from the airport past the Strip and Downtown but both are easily accessible from the hotel by cab. Nice rooms, good restaurants (I ate at two of them), great location and a laid back casino with a very helpful staff. Overall, reasonably priced for what we got. Without a doubt, I'd stay again. About the only criticism was that the casino got smokey, but i guess that's not too surprising for LV.

Reviews.Title: “Not a great experience”
Reviews.Author: jkinney4
Reviews.Content: Had to stay at this hotel for a group function. The room is average with extremely uncomfortable beds. Front desk was not helpful just abrasive and rude. Everyone said the hotel would be nice but I have stayed at much nicer hotels in Vegas. Plus I could have gotten more bang for the buck on the strip or anywhere else in town. The shower head made noise when you turned it on. You could even hear others taking a shower. Plus the rate & fees were increased at checkout. Also they charged for a water that I didn't even use.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing stay off the strip”
Reviews.Author: jjcopeland
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the JW Marriott for 2 nights before I stayed on the strip for a week. The room was very spacious and the bathroom even more so. The pool area reminded me of being in the Caribbean. The atmosphere and decor of the poll area made you feel as if you were nowhere near civilization. The hotel has a casino and many restaurants on site. This is the best Marriott I have ever stayed at.

Reviews.Title: “Nice environment”
Reviews.Author: IvyNg
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel. European touch in the indoor, Hawaii atmosphere at the outdoor. The rooms are big, and comfortable. The in-room jacuzzi is huge. It's far from strip though. But I like it, because it is quiter where it is located. The casino is a little out-fashiosed. But if you do not care about gambling or show, it's good. There is no complimentary water in the room. In the hot dessert like this, it's important to BYOW.

Reviews.Title: “Very spacious rooms”
Reviews.Author: travelresearcher22
Reviews.Content: I was recently at this location for a conference and I was most impressed by the size of the rooms. I was upgraded to a one bedroom suite and it had 3 bathrooms!!! I am not sure what 2 people are supposed to do with 3 separate bathrooms but it was fun to have none the less. The double jacuzzi tub was so big that when you filled it up and got inside you actually floated! The hotel rooms are very quiet. I never heard anything from any room around or below us. I would very much recommend this hotel for a luxurious relaxing vacation off the strip. The service was fantastic at this hotel. Most of the times I was interacting with the banquet staff but the speed in which they addressed our concerns or needs was remarkable. I did not get any opportunity to really use the pool or spa but they looked very inviting. All and all, I would come back to this location for a conference. It is clean, very nice rooms, great service and well worth the price we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Great off strip property”
Reviews.Author: gerbsWestVirginia
Reviews.Content: Staff is fantastic, several food choices none outstanding but solid. Great pool and spa, salon and so forth. Connected to a small casino that is mostly for locals. TPC golf courses and Angel Fire courses are right here. PGA tourney coming up this week. Great upscale, quite and 20 minutes to the strip. Hotel has shuttle to the strip. Check out the patio rooms for a couple more bucks. You must use a taxi to and from airport but can be scheduled through the hotel. Hertz on site. I really like this place as I work near-by and stay here 6-8 weeks per year.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Los Gatos, CA - Northern California - Bay Area
Reviews.Title: “Nice Resort & Spa - Non-Smoking facility except the Casino”
Reviews.Author: afgam
Reviews.Content: We stayed overnight at the Spa Tower at the JW Marriott in Las Vegas. It is located off of Summerlin Parkway and it took us 25 minutes to get there from the airport. We took the long way around and enjoyed a non-congested drive. Our check-in was quiet and quick. The room was big including the two sink bathroom with gigantic whirlpool tub. I noticed other noise when the other rooms used their whirlpool tub at midnight. There was a flatscreen tv. Our room faced the bocce ball and horseshoe court. No balcony. There was a safe and fridge and not microwave. We were on the 6th floor. We visited the Casino which reminded me of walking back in time. Lots of people smoking. I rarely saw and hip young people. There were high rollers. The restaurant downstairs for breakfast was quick and the service was nice. Just remember, it's Vegas and some things happen that one would never expect to see. Overall, we would visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but not a happening place”
Reviews.Author: RainCityGal425
Reviews.Content: This JW is perfectly nice, but it looks like it needs to be spiced up. There were only 2 other couples in the Ceres restaurant for dinner, and the place is huge. Even the casino was not jumping. We did have an excellent lunch in the Irish Pub, good burger and pastrami sandwich. The room was very nice, huge bath with a jetted tub. Shower with two heads, the overhead one which dripped cold water even though it was turned off, rather unpleasant. Even though the room was over the entry area (4th floor) it was pretty quiet. Also a little heavy on the extra charges, $25 to use the fitness center in the spa (there is a free one too) and $30/person for the shuttle to the airport. As others have mentioned this hotel is not on the strip, and I would be bored staying there for more than one night.

Reviews.Title: “Staycation At The JW”
Reviews.Author: MaryAnn050
Reviews.Content: WOW!!! I have been out to the JW many times for lunch, dinner, meetings, etc. What a difference experience to be a guest at this Fabulous hotel. The grounds are absolutely beautiful for a lovely walk anytime of day or night. The rooms are lovely with great views of the lovely trees and landscaping. The pool area is lovely with plenty room for all to enjoy themselves. The staff throughout the property is very service oriented and delightful. They go out of their way to see if they can be helpful to you in any way during your stay. It has one of the very best Spas in town. The services and providers were just wonderful and their products are excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite Marriott”
Reviews.Author: SLC-MLBF
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at most all of the Marriotts in Las Vegas and this by far is the favorite. The pool is wondeful. It has a shallow area that is great for infants and toddlers. It is about 12 miles off the strip west of town but it is very quiet. If you want to visit a casino it is a short walk to the Rampart or drive to the Suncoast . There are plenty of dining options as well. Great resort!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: CherylCDW
Reviews.Content: Stayed for the weekend while attending a wedding. Very nice hotel and excellent value with breakfast included each day. The room was larger than most and the hotel staff were very attentive.The $100 credit at the end of our stay made this a very attractive offer. Would recommend this hotel if you are looking for an upscale hotel that is peaceful for Las Vegas, maybe not the place if you are looking for the exciting nightlife Las Vegas has to offer. Small complaint about hotel maid service and noisy air conditioner.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel....peace and quiet”
Reviews.Author: celepore
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, extremely friendly staff especially the bellmen. Peaceful and quiet off the strip but only an easy 15 minute drive to downtown and the strip. Two adults and one child received free breakfast buffet each day and a $50 resort credit each day. Had a nice lunch by the pool and would book at this hotel on my next stay.

Reviews.Title: “SENIOR CITIZEN RESORT”
Reviews.Author: alitalia
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is BAD and I made a big mistake. Check-In - BAD not offered bell man assistance Room- Palm Court Like walking 2 foot ball fields to get to from Valet Parking Service - Paid for breakfast and arrived 12 min late and was denied given foam dishes to pickup left offer buffet scraps like a DOG - I am PLATINUM Check- out- My Rate came with a 50.00 per Day credit not given I had to ask for it and was CREDITED not done as check out as miss Rude FRONT DESK MANAGER stated OVER ALL this place is out to RIP YOU OFFFFFFF. MANAGEMENT- I called and spoke with HOTEL MANAGER whom said he would return my call never DID so keep away

Reviews.Title: “Just Right for a Week Off”
Reviews.Author: Tom B
Reviews.Content: My wife and I needed some time away-time to kick back by the pool, soak up the leisure and read some good books. JW Marriott Las Vegas fit the bill. The rates were reasonable, the room and bed comfortable, the grounds and pool attractive and well maintained. Most importantly, the staff was attentive and responsive. Since we are not gamblers or show goers, we enjoyed this resort because it was an oasis of calm in a city known for frenetic activity.

Reviews.Title: “Love Dining at Ceres”
Reviews.Author: JMDAXP
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I try to dine at Ceres every couple of months. The waterfall's outside are amazing to enjoy while dining and the staff is always top notch! Definently one of the most beautiful hotel / properties in Las Vegas! I recommend this property all the time and will continue to do so!

Reviews.Title: “WOW!! Did this place surprise we”
Reviews.Author: A V
Reviews.Content: Amazing rooms, landscaping, pool and the most friendly and helpful staff of any staff in the last year. A definite return next time in Las Vegas. I will need to figure out a better way to navigate airport and strip. MGM hotel group need to take a lesson Pool staff and landscaping staff always working. Amazing JW Marriott value so book your room as early as possible.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Stay, Nearly Excellent”
Reviews.Author: CJASH
Reviews.Content: My husband, daughter, and I stayed at the JW Marriott Las Vegas for one week, August 13-20. It is a beautiful property with lovely grounds, very calm and peaceful, and an excellent alternative to hotels on the strip. Our room was very nice, with a walk-in closet separating the bedroom area from the bathroom. The bedroom had a ceiling fan, which we liked, and the bathroom had a jacuzzi tub and separate toilet room. The hotel staff were attentive to our needs, from front desk to concierage to maid service, and especially the valet attendants, who made us feel special. Our rate included a buffet breakfast at Ceres, which was very good, but we don't recommend dinner there (for the money, choose the Japanese steakhouse, Shizen). We were disappointed in the number of restaurants that counted toward our daily resort credit, since all the onsite restaurants were not affiliated with the JW Marriott. The only complaint during our stay was the pool experience. The cushions on all the loungers were faded and turning brown, which was pretty disgusting . . . for a relatively small investment, the hotel should replace them and add more umbrellas, which would greatly improve the poolside experience! Also, the waiters and waitresses rarely came by, so in the end we accepted the fact that in order to to get a drink or food, we had to walk to the waterside cafe to place our orders. All in all, it was a lovely stay, and with a few improvements, we would rate the hotel as excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Best Marriott in Vegas for Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: LifetimePlatinum
Reviews.Content: Former Ritz Carlton property - High end design and decoration - great pool area with large waterfall - beautiful grounds - once you arrive at the property, you can easily forget you are in Vegas. About 15 minutes from the Strip so not for those seeking that type of entertainment. Perfect for those passing thru or those who just want a gorgeous resort atmosphere - take advantage of as much or as little of the resort as you like. Have stayed here close to a dozen times and will continue to... Platinum has resulted in upgrades to 2BR and 1BR suites at least half the time (based on availability) - complementary valet parking (tip of course) or self parking for those who prefer to control their vehicle... Golf/Tennis/Spa treatments all available on site or very close by.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful suite, but not a perfect stay.”
Reviews.Author: TravelsHereNthere
Reviews.Content: We booked the suite for a family party and had food ordered through in room dining. The day of, the front desk agents were great, but we had to wait 2 hours to get our room! WE requested a certain view on two occasions, yet the reservation was never updated.We did get upgraded, but we barely had time to set up before our guests started arriving. The upgrade actually led to another mishap. The TVs in the different tower did not connect to VCRs, which was something we needed for the party. Engineers were trying to fix it throughout the party. They tried their best, but the problem just added to the upsetting experience. The in suite dining team also very polite, but the food was delivered 1 hour prior to when we'd asked for it to be delivered. Aside from that, the room was beautiful and spacious. For the price I paid, I would've only gotten a standard room on the Strip. The two bedroom suite is amazing, with a great balcony from one end around to the other. If you plan en event here, make sure you confirm every detail.

Reviews.Title: “Great again”
Reviews.Author: Brightwell1
Reviews.Content: This was Our second stay at the JW LV. It is a great location for families. The pool is really great and the whole layout is vacation planned. Staying here for work would be tough but its a great stop on a road trip.

Reviews.Title: “Business stay felt like vacation”
Reviews.Author: SleepyTurtle
Reviews.Content: Rooms are spacious, quiet and well appointed. Front desk and valet staff were excellent. Front desk assisted me with photocoping and faxing business documents, valet were always prompt and courtious. Great breakfast and small bites available at the hotel restaurant. Love not having to shlep my luggage through a casino to get to the front desk! Another pleasant stay at this hotel. Note: rooms have a "cooler", not a refrigerator. If requested they will provide a refrigerator.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort but a little boring”
Reviews.Author: 92081Traveler
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from three nights at the JW Marriott Resort and Spa in Las Vegas. The resort is beautiful and peaceful. It has a very nice pool area with lush green gardens, waterfalls and ponds. The service was excellent. All the staff we dealt with were very helpful and polite. Our room was spacious and comfortable though a little aged. The large bathroom had a separate shower and double Jacuzzi tub. They offer free valet service at both of their tower lobbies. The resort is very close to several outstanding golf courses and chain restaurants. Itwould be a good choice for those looking for a golf vacation. My only complaint is that this place is downright boring. There is no buzz or excitement. Walking through the empty lobbies and corridors, I felt like I was in a mausoleum. Understand, my wife and I are not club hopping, hard drinking partiers. We also don’t like to spend a lot of time in the casinos. We enjoy spending our time relaxing by the pool and enjoying the resort’s amenities. That being said, this place was even too dull for our simple taste. Our package included a buffet breakfast each morning and a $50 a day resort credit. My wife planned on using the credit for a spa treatment while I went golfing. Upon checking out the spa however, it appeared that many of the spa features were closed for repair. This included their signature hydrotherapy pools and waterfall showers. There are several restaurants on site. We ended up using the credit to have dinner at Spiedini instead. The food was outstanding and the service was excellent. However, the restaurant was almost empty on a Saturday night. Like the rest of the resort, there was no buzz or excitement. The kitchen and wait staff outnumbered the diners. Overall, if you’re looking for a serene anti-Vegas retreat, this is a great choice. However, it was a little too sterile for my taste.

Reviews.Title: “Great, out of the way family hotel”
Reviews.Author: flyhighandlight
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not for those seeking to be in the middle of the action. It is close to golf, local shopping and other non-strippy things to do. It has a great pool, great staff and is a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet gem in the desert”
Reviews.Author: Chantae
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this resort numerous times over the past 11 years and consider it a quiet gem in the desert. We like the distance from the strip and appreciate not having to walk through the casino to get to the hotel rooms. Unlike most visitors to Las Vegas, we don't go for the gaming or shows, we go to simply relax. However, if you are looking for nightlife, the strip isn't a long drive and the hotel offers a shuttle downtown. This property is close to a large variety of restaurants and shopping and the well-landscaped grounds always make us feel we could be anywhere but in Las Vegas. The property is designed in an L shape with two separate hotel towers on each end and the casino in the center. There are restaurants and shops in between, as well as a well-appointed spa. The Palms Tower houses the front desk, and a short walk/drive away is the Spa tower. It is particularly quiet there, as there isn't even an employee manned desk in the lobby, only the bellman out front. Most recently we stayed in the Spa tower, but have found all rooms similar in size and amenities. The rooms are generous in size, but it's the spacious bathrooms we find unique. There is a deep jetted tub and shower with a rain shower head and a double vanity with plenty of room. When traveling with our kids we have been able to get adjoining rooms without any difficulty. In the past couple of years we have expected to see remodeling taking place as the furnishings and decor are starting to show some wear, but it does all remain well maintained. The pool area is beautiful and when we take our kids they love the waterfall area. We usually book the Stay for Breakfast rate and the buffet breakfast is always enjoyable, though not over-the-top with food choices. We prefer to dine off-property for our other meals as is usually the case, the options are limited and pricey on-site. That being said, the food service at the pool has always been great and it is easy to spend the day there. This property remains a favorite of ours as overall we find it relaxing and beautiful, whether we are alone as a couple or staying with our entire family.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing place to stay in LV”
Reviews.Author: ABQDoc
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week in the Palm Tower of the JW Marriott in NW Las Vegas. It was nice to be away from the Strip's noise and traffic, but close enough to go there for a show. The hotel is quiet, relaxing and clean with indoor walkways connecting all of the guest areas (when it is 105 outside). The casino is small (we don't gamble), but has only a tiny no-smoking section-which we walked through to get to another part of the hotel. The hotel is close to Red Rocks Park, a variety of restaurants, shopping and an outlet mall. Our junior suite was quite spacious and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “When in Vegas, Stay Off The Strip!”
Reviews.Author: KPrince39
Reviews.Content: I go to Las Vegas at least once per year, and I have stayed in just about every hotel on the main strip (North and South ends). But, I was introduced to the JW Marriott Resort for the first time. I thought I was in another world out there. What a beautiful hotel and community (Summerlin)! Shopping, golf course, and no pedestrian congestion! I'm staying in Summerlin from now on!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: tangOtangO1
Reviews.Content: My family stayed here for 8 nights. Wonderful service, nice staff and beautiful resort. Helped us book some side trips around the area. Had some fun suggestions. We will go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Our annual retreat.”
Reviews.Author: cbufis
Reviews.Content: We stay at the JW Marriott every year and love it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vegas resort for families!”
Reviews.Author: Sabeja
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the JW for 4 nights at the end of June. I was traveling with my husband and 3 kids (8,10,12). We used LV as our home base for our visit to the Grand Canyon. I pupsoely chose this Marriott over The Cosmopoliton(on the strip) becasue it was away from the crowds of the Strip and appeared more family friendly. The rooms are huge. THe room was big enough to accommodate my family- even had a roll away bed.The bathroom is even bigger-almost the size of a standard hotel room like a Courtyard. As a matter of fact, the room we had at the Fairfield Inn (Marriott chain) in Flagstafff was the same size as our BATHROOM at the JW. We had a fabulous time! Word of advice for visiting this part of the country, have plenty of water. We bought s styrofoam cooler at the grocery store down the street and filled it with a case of water. By the end of our 8 day stay in the region, we drank all 35 bottles of water. Here are my Pros: -Beautiful grounds-waterfalls, koi pond, and lush greenery -Pool is fabulous- a waterfall in the pool! We loved it. -Rooms are spacious and comfortable -Family Friendly -Restaurants & stores close by. We reaaly liked the NY Pizza place at the strip mall a few blocks from the JW. Here are my Cons: -Restaurants on the grounds were a bit pricey. The food at the Rampart Buffet was so-so. I shuold say I am not a big fan of buffets to begin with. -Casino is very smokey- more so than the ones on the Strip. Should say that this is not run by the JW. -Furnishings in the room and at the pool are a bit used and out- dated. Marriott really should changes these out, especially for their JW brand.

Reviews.Title: “Beautifully presented, although a long way from the heart of Vegas”
Reviews.Author: vlp50
Reviews.Content: We had a very comfortable stay. We stayed here for a conference and didn't realise how far it was away from the city, so a little inconvenient, definitely needed a hire car as taxi from airport was $77. From the information supplied you couldn't rely on the shuttle bus it only did a couple of trips per day and if full you would need to make other arrangements. The staff were very friendly, the facilities are great, this would suit travellers who wanted to lie around the pool or use the Casino.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: Chris-2Elk
Reviews.Content: We got a fantastic special package deal at this hotel. We go to Las Vegas often to visit great friends so we are not into the whole gambling on the strip scene. This place is in the nice Summerlin area and is a non-smoking hotel. The room was nice and extremely comfortable. The pool was nice and the spa is great! Great golf package at a TPC course and transportion to and from the course was nice. Overall a very good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Property and Resort! enjoyable trip”
Reviews.Author: TNLZ
Reviews.Content: Was there in the middle of June and stayed at this property. Overall had a great stay. Started out a bit rough but the General Manager a Yolanda I believe corrected and tried to make things work. Had a lost item that was found eventually by housekeeping. Great Pool and Fantastic Spa Area!

Reviews.Title: “This is a JW Marriott?!”
Reviews.Author: mlimoges
Reviews.Content: This was my 5th time at this hotel, all visits being on business. Each time, this hotel has gone downhill. Upon check-in, in spite of my husband being a silver member, we had tp pay for am upgrade to junior suite. This in spite of the hotel being virtually empty (July in Vegas). We then get to our room and find it is a handicapped room. When I called At Your Service I was told no others available! Really?! Housekeeping was well after 2 each day and no turndown service at all. Employees seem bored/not interested in assisting guests and those were the ones we could find! This property seems to not be able to decide if it wants to be a casino type property or a real JW Marriott

Reviews.Title: “Big and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: awenzl
Reviews.Content: I just spent the weekend here at a business conference. The rooms are oversized and nicely furnished. Updated, spa-like bathrooms were a big plus. Several reasonably priced dining options. Beautiful grounds, and everything was well-maintained. I especially enjoyed the walking trails around the perimeter of the property. I didn’t gamble, but the casino appeared to be clean and well-staffed. The hotel’s airport shuttle is efficient and competitively priced. The only downside is no free internet.

Reviews.Title: “Clumsy, thoughtless service at a beautiful facility”
Reviews.Author: Pb650
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful facility. Too bad the service experience was, well, absent. Except for one person at the reception desk, no-one else in the resort seemed inclined to care much about delivering service. By far, the pool staff, from the waitresses to the lifeguards, were untrained, unpleasant, and unplugged. Not sure they would have actually noticed anyone in trouble, because they sure didn't care about the MANY people throwing hard objects around in the pool, one of which clipped me in the neck at high velocity, and another hard rubber ball which nailed my kid. Upon complaining of this to a "lifeguard", he just stared at me... blankly... not a word was uttered. I would have fired him on the spot. Ditto for the other lifeguards who didn't make eye contact, and wouldn't think to greet you. Poolside servers? Yes, just as absent... they don't actually stop and and ask you if you want anything, they just walk by quickly (if they walk by at all) and expect to be chased down. Don't ask for a pitcher of ice water (to go with your $100 food order), because you'll be told "We don't have enough, and I'll get in trouble if I give you one". !!! I thought this was a Marriott signature resort!!! Wow... I stay at Marriotts 30-50 nights a year, and I have FAR BETTER service at inner city Courtyard by Marriott hotels. SImilar problems were encountered with the bell-staff: After handing a $10 tip to the guy who brought our stuff to the room, we had this amazing exchange: Bell man: "Sir, can I get you anything else?" Me: "Yes please, may we have another luggage rack?' Bell man: (pointing to the phone) "Just dial zero" WT? Never again. Save your money and Marriott points.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort and awesome room!”
Reviews.Author: travellingsusan3
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel June 28th and June 29th to spend time with family playing Scrabble in the room and gambling at nite. We were in room 5156 which had a garden view and a view of a lovely waterfall below. The room was large and modern. I slept 6 hours straight (which I never do) because the room was totally dark with the drapes drawn. The bathroom was amazing. The bathtub had a jacuzzi tub. The shower was xtra large with 2 shower heads, 1 above the head and another at chest length. I've never seen those features before, not in the Venetian or other comparable hotels - perhaps in a more upgraded room. They had a small empty fridge and a robe - nice feature. Only thing is no free internet. Great place to stay though. Far from busy Strip. Lots of food places and shopping outside this resort.

Reviews.Title: “nice!”
Reviews.Author: Kristinxx27
Reviews.Content: Our room was nice! It even had a ceiling fan! This was a great property to stay at. Only a few miles from the strip. It was nice to get away from the craziness of the city. There is a casino inside of the hotel. The only thing I would have changed would have been to keep the pool open past 7pm. Thats too early!

Reviews.Title: “World Class Hotel. Thought we were in Monaco!”
Reviews.Author: TraveLee073
Reviews.Content: Hotel was recommended by avid-golfer friend who raves about both the hotel and local courses. Wife and I were there three nights for a nearby family wedding and found his assesssment to be spot on. Hotel buildings are remniscent of Spain and highlighted by lush landscaping - an overall delightful setting and not what you'd typically associate with urban Las Vegas. Views at night from room and balcony were spectacular - showing the glimmering lights of the city and gorgeous sunsets over the mountains and offered great photo ops. Grounds, with waterfalls and seasoned vegetation made for enjoyable garden strools. Architecture throughout the buildings and guest rooms themselves is beautifully designed/executed and remniscent of a bygone era, not unlike the Craftsman period, when there was a focus on stunning plaster and woodworking detail. If you appreciate elaborate workmanshop, you'll love this place. EVERY staff member, from arrival on, went out of their way to be helpful, friendly and accomodating. Bellmen, for instance, were personable, interested in how we were enjoying ourselves and responsive to requests for information. Housekeepers were thorough and readily solved a glitch with a table lamp and a TV remote. Our, large, two-bedroom suite (along with a 40-foot balcony) was furnished with quality furnishings, three wide-screen TV's, complementary art, two spa-type tubs and quality linens. Cleanliness, particularly of the three bathrooms and bar area, was excellent. Dining was made easy with restaurants ranging in both variety and price. We ate 5 meals there. The cafe was great for breakfast and we particularly enjoyed the ton katsu, soft crab and sashimi at the Japanese restaurant, SHIZEN. Lovers of authentic Japanese fare will feel right at home there. And those, like my wife, who enjoy opportunities for gaming will appreciate the large variety of casino games. What was the place missing? I could definitely taken advantage of something like an informal ice cream and dessert parlor - for late night snacks. I might add that the two dozen or so members of the wedding party who stayed at a popular strip resort/hotel and were subjected to the hubub and cattle-call-type hospitality of the area, were blown away by the serene surroundings and attentiveness found here. They won't make that mistake again.

Reviews.Title: “Preferred Hotel in Las Vegas for Families with Young Kids”
Reviews.Author: krmik
Reviews.Content: I had a conference in Las Vegas and we decided to stay here because my family came with me. We have 2 young children (ages 6 & 8) and we enjoyed this resort. It's about a 15 minutes drive without traffic from the strip. It didn't feel like we were in Las Vegas at all- it was quiet, serene, and had a tropical feel. The hotel staff was excellent- very friendly, helpful and really went out of their way to make our stay pleasant. My kids had a good time in the large resort pool. We had a suite that was spacious and clean. My only issue with the room was the furniture was chipped, worn and a bit dated. The chairs by the pool also looked worn and some were heavily stained. The only other issue I had with the hotel was the smoke from the casino. The starbucks and buffet restaurant my kids liked to eat at are right next to the casino. They inhaled a fair amount of second hand smoke when they ate there. I accept the fact it's Las Vegas where gambling and smoking go together, so we steered the kids away from that area. The other major reason we liked this hotel was location. The surrounding Summerlin area was a nice, clean, upscale suburb. There were plenty of shops, restaurants and grocery stores nearby. We didn't have to worry about our kids seeing smut. Las Vegas ads bill the strip as "family friendly." No matter when you go, at any time of day it's not for young children. We thought we could take our kids to an matinee magic show and lunch in the middle of a weekday and it would ok for them. There are too many in your face smutty ads and people on the sidewalk handing out cards with naked women who work at the brothels. They're not supposed to give them to kids, but the cards are strewn all over the sidewalk where anyone can see them. Even though we tried to shield their eyes, my kids saw things that they were too young too see. After that, we just kept our kids at the JW for the rest of our trip. It's a safe family resort away from the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Top Vegas Accommodations for Business/Golfer”
Reviews.Author: TheTravelProfessor
Reviews.Content: Stayed here before a recent business meeting and it was all good. A bit of arrive from airport but once on property, everything is handled at your request. An awesome golf package (TPC Las Vegas) made the stay One of the best deals of the year. Will return. The Travel Professor.

Reviews.Title: “Oasis in the 'burbs”
Reviews.Author: Solana75
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at the beginning of April. Weather that time of year is ever changing even in Vegas: it was warm pool weather one day then cold and windy the next. This gave us a perfect time to enjoy the property and surrounding area in Summerlin. Room was very good but could use an update to modern colors. We were upgraded to a suite but it only had 2 windows that needed to be open to see even with the lights on. Beautiful bar area and very large bath. Property was very clean and the staff were 'bend over backwards nice' everywhere. It is in Summerlin, if you have not been there it is in the western side of the strip, butting up against the Red Rock park and an upscale neighborhood. The area is a lot mellower than Freemont St. or the Strip but refreshingly nice to not have to deal with all that. Pool area was clean, drinks & food were available. Inside there is a small casino and a variety of places to eat & drink. We especially enjoyed the martini bar during happy hour where the signature martinis were only $5 and were there a few nights. We ate only a few times in the resort and it was pretty good but did not try the high end places which looked really good. The casino was uncrowded due to the time of year and middle of the week, but very smoky. I had to leave one night, way too smoky for me. The ventilation system could have been a lot better. Surrounding area is nice, there was shopping and many restaurants. Freeway access was great and easy to navigate and avoid going through some very seedy areas just west of the Strip. The real draw is Red Rock park. It's beautiful and a great place to hike or walk. I'd highly recommend it to expand knowledge of the area outside of the Strip and Hoover Dam and overlooked many times.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: calimi
Reviews.Content: When people are referring to Las Vegas they have in their mind first and foremost the whole range of hotels on the strip. And it is normal considering the tens of billions of dollars invested in that place. Plus, the convenience of accessing all of those in a fairly limited walking space. For people who anyhow want a slightly different experience the JR Marriott Resort Spa and Golf is an unforgettable moment. We had the chance to stay to at a lot of resorts here in the US and the rest of the world. What is unique in this place is the exceptional combination between classy comfort and a beautiful landscaping. A landscaping that could be described as a chain of separate beautiful semi-private parks where the lakes, waterfalls, palms, flowers, bridges, lights (during the evenings) and discreet music are in a divine harmonious orchestration. In such a large area even when the resort is fully occupied you still have the feeling of privacy and serenity. The Resort has also the privilege of having a close full spectacular view of the mountain range. For those who are still longing for a casino thrill, the Resort has a dedicated one and anyhow the strip is relatively close (13 miles). We strongly recommend this Resort for the above mentioned reasons plus other that we will leave you to discover yourself.

Reviews.Title: “Love Love Love this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: deenad
Reviews.Content: Awesome hotel! If you read the few posts before mine they sum up my stay! Will not hesitiate to stay at this fabulous hotel next time Vegas calls!

Reviews.Title: “A Las Vegas Dream”
Reviews.Author: GrahamGriffin
Reviews.Content: Imagine staying in a first class resort - with awesome, attentive staff, beautiful grounds, quiet and gracious rooms, all within 15 minutes of the Strip, - and Red Rock Canyon and free valet service? Well then indulge your senses and live life large by coming to this Marriott Resort in the suburbs of Las Vegas. We stayed here over the memorial day weekend - the hotel was at 100% occupancy for part of the stay and yet the grounds, rooms and public areas were immaculate. Calm prevailed everywhere - and there were loads of families; the staff answered questions at the desk/concierge very quickly. Staff overall were among the most cordial, professional and efficient of any stay at any hotel anywhere in the world. The breakfast buffet at Ceres was consistently a 10. The dinner at Spiedini was a 12 - chef Gustav Mahler deserves far more customers than were present over the weekend!! When the bacci court was closed for the night, a promise made by me to my son that we would play was met with a hand delivery of the bacci balls after they had been locked up for the night!
