(Ie - special requests don't upset the staff). For those of you who must go to the strip - take advantage of the free shuttle - no one in their right mind should be driving there on a Saturday night. And if you are like us and used this resort as a base - then the travel time to Red Rock Cyn for fabulous Zion-like biking and hiking is only 15 minutes away and Hoover Dam is only 35 minutes or so. The concierge has clear preprinted directions to and from - one on one side of a sheet and one on the other. All in all - indulge yourself - the staff, food, grounds and rooms are all top notch and no reasonable request goes astray.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Exceeded Expectations”
Reviews.Author: MiamiMo
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for an accounting conference with my family. Rooms - This was the best part. The rooms were spectacular. Marble on floor, showers, and walls of bathroom along with double sinks, separate toilets, shower, and, tub. Flat panel televisions, comfortable beds, and clean. Rooms felt very new and were very large and nice. Rooms have beuatiful views with double french doors that open. Staff - This is one of the best overall staff I have seen at a hotel. Everyone was always smiling and saying hello. Nobody walked by you without acknowdging you. Restaurants - Many restaurants to choose from. Location - This is the only downside. It is not just outside the strip, as in a few blocks away. It is actually about a 20 minute drive on highways.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: AngelFanSean
Reviews.Content: This hotel holds up all standards of JW Marriot's, it is beautiful, and the restaurants not run by Rampart Casino (Buffet and Cafe) are great. Make sure you try out the Irish and Italian restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: ua43221
Reviews.Content: Moved from the Strip after a week long business conference to stay at the JW with family and to visit with friends that live in NW Vegas. Wow - great accomodations; clean. Friendly staff, and an awesome pool. Easy access off of the freeway. Had a nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Huge rooms but in need of some room updates”
Reviews.Author: educatedcalimom
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Tower P. The rooms are quite large however if you are there for work the desk and chair isn't that great, the refrigerator was just sitting on the floor next to the shades and didn't have functioning knobs to turn it on as it wasn't cold and there was an old school plastic open top ice bucket (like you would put tokens in at an arcade), and the tv was an older model (large tube tv). The bed was very comfortable, grounds were SPECTACULAR with coy ponds, waterfalls, doors in the room that opened to a small balcony as to be able to hear the waterfalls, the air/heater was great, the starbucks staff in the hotel was very friendly as was the other staff. Pools were quite nice too. I'd say when there is a special rate it would be a great place to stay but isn't the cream of the crop.

Reviews.Title: “DISAPPOINTING”
Reviews.Author: Lovetotravel48503
Reviews.Content: I travel and stay extensively and am typically loyal to the Marriott namebrand due to the consistent qualities their facilities offer. I have few good words to describe my experience with this facility. I found the front desk staff understaffed and rude. At 10 pm I found myself arguing with the front end manager regarding a Marriott issued voucher. Ultimately there was no problen with the voucher, however the entire experience was in very poor taste and an unnecessary inconvenience for what should have been a nice getaway off the strip. The hotel facilities presented a weird combination of facilities. This is a sprawling complex that has 2 main hotel buildings with public facilities cosisting of restaurants and a casino connectting the main buildings. I found the hotel buildings very nice and well maintained while the casino and restaurant areas felt like I had walked into facilities that had not been updated in decades. In the end we stayed at the hotel and enjoyed the room we were in, but we spent our evening entertainment dollars at the Suncoast casino located 5 minutes away. Suncoast had excellent offerings that entertained us well into the evening. Overall I was extremely disappointed that Marriott would put the JW Marriott name on this facility. I have never been disappointed with a JW Marriott until this stay. The staff was unhelpful, facilities are outdated, and there are much better offerrings in the area. As a loyal Marriott customer I give this location a big thumbs down and would not recommend a stay here. This location was a big disappointment. Oh, terribly thin walls also!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: PandK09
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the JW Marriott over spring vacation with wife and 2 boys, 12+13. Everyone had a great time and loved the room, we stayed in a 2 bedroom, very spacious and comforable for all. Enjoyed the restaurant for breakfast and the pool during the day. Great spa also.

Reviews.Title: “Good golf location; however,In need of a refurb and some attention to detal.”
Reviews.Author: network55
Reviews.Content: * A bit dissapointing given the brand and its location. * The rooms are dated and need a refresh... carpeting, TV's, furniture * Room request was not fulfilled ( near elevator), instead at end of hall. * Noted bottles, empty glasses, and wrappers left on tables in public areas. Not a good first impression. * During weekend their was a number of youth soccer teams staying at the property. * Plenty of walking as the restaurants are in between both buildings. * The positive.... the public TPS golf course is adjacent to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Barbara2585
Reviews.Content: We were in Las Vegas for 10 days for a convention and thought that we would take a break over the weekend and stay at JW Marriott to be away from the strip. I have always thought of JW Marriotts as being top notch properties -- this one was a major disappointment. We had reserved the room at least 6 weeks before we arrived and had requested a room with two beds -- instead we were given a king. When we asked for the room we had reserved, we were told that the hotel was full, although it did not seem crowded at all. The room was horrible -- there was virtually no furniture in it other than a bed, a small desk and two chairs. No table, no coffee table, no couch like you find in comparable properties. During the same trip we stayed at the Wynn and the Venetian for the same price and those rooms were 1000% nicer. My husband said the furnishings in the room reminded him of a Motel 6 he had stayed in 30 years ago. When we asked for a table to be brought to the room so we could have somewhere to drink our coffee, we were told that they were taking the tables out of all of the rooms. We finally got a small coffee table which looked like it had come from a flea market. One of the lamps in the room had no way to turn on or off without unplugging. The batteries in the TV remote were dying, When we turned off the main switch for the room lights, the alarm clock turned off too. You would expect a flat screen TV in a JW Marriott, but this room had only an old tube type set. The bathroom was nice, with a large jacuzzi tub for two and a separate shower with a rain shower head. The grounds were beautiful and the pool area nice. Other than the front desk (which we found unhelpful) , the staff (the waitress in the Irish pub, the bellman and the valet were all very helpful and nice. However I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Close...but not close enough”
Reviews.Author: NumbersAtlanta
Reviews.Content: 15 minutes from The Strip. the rooms are big and the bathrooms even bigger, with a jacuzzi tub and separate shower. Room lighting is poor - no desk lamp - and the rooms are not well maintained - burned out lightbulbs/beaten up chipped furniture. No flat screen TV, either, which is not what you'd expect from a JW property. The casino is old and run down. The friendly staff delivers the consistently good Marriott service. Bottom line - for the same price or less, you can get higher quality, better amenities, better casinos and better dining if you stay on The Strip.

Reviews.Title: “Watch out for laying around drugs...”
Reviews.Author: ShannonT78
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is beautiful..typical of any Las Vegas hotel. The shower took about 5 minutes of running water to finally warm up. What really worried us is the drug pipe that my son found hiding in the lamp. Security came up took a picture and that was it. When we spoke to the manager, all he said was sorry... My 19 month old baby could have easily got a hold of it if my older son didn't find it first. Unacceptable!!!! Very upset with the level of service we received considering that we always stay at Marriott's and have always been trated well. My advice, stay at the Cosmopolitan....they are new and have great customer service!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a nice area.”
Reviews.Author: JFFWheaton_IL
Reviews.Content: This hotel is definitely one of the top ten, I've ever stayed in. The room is large. It has a nice sitting area with two chairs and a coffee table. Great for relaxing or watching TV. There is also a jacuzzi tub and a double bowl sink in the bathroom along with a separate shower. There is even a lighted magnifying mirror for makeup or shaving, along with a water closet The staff is very friendly. The only criticism I'd have is for the adjoining ramparts casino. It needs a non smoking area.

Reviews.Title: “They spent a ton of money on waterfalls but forgot about customer service!”
Reviews.Author: Marmot65
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 4 days. The buffet breakfast, which was part of our room package was way below par. We came to find out that the buffet was cut back to accomodate a convention. When we complained we got back the cost of the buffet, but were told that the convention was more important than us. An additional complaint letter to Bill Marriott resulted in a form letter response. This whole expeience has ruined the Marriott Brand for my wife and me.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel to relax and get away from the strip”
Reviews.Author: Atlglobetrotters
Reviews.Content: I was on a 1 week business trip with my wife to Las Vegas. Stayed at a horrendous hotel there which I will be reviewing next. Since my conference was on the strip, I had to stay nearby, but as soon as the conference got over, I booked a regular room at the JW Mariott. The hotel is about a 15-20 min drive from the strip and I have to say the lobby is not very luxurious nor the staff very warm, but the moment you step inside your room you will be in for a surprise. The room was large and very clean. Best part was the 2 person jacuzzi inside the room which was a great stress reliever. Couple of negatives: The hotel has small casino which is decent, nothing great. The buffet was sub-standard as well. It certainly wasn't the $20 pp which was charged. Overall: This hotel was free of the riff-raffs. The clientele is older and mature people and we only saw a few 30 something couples besides us. Yet, it was a very pleasant stay and we will certainly stay here again, most likely in the luxury suite.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT place to stay off of the strip”
Reviews.Author: LexBo
Reviews.Content: I stayed 2 nights at this resort for business. We experienced a few problems using business funds to pay for the stay (the gentleman at the front desk wouldn't accept our business check, although later, after others were coming and paying by business check he decided to take it, only it was too late as we had already paid by personal credit card). The rooms were very large/spacious. Bathrooms were clean, soaker/whirlpool tub was very nice and relaxing after a long day. The in-resort casino is a good size; not too big, not too small. Dining options are fairly limited as most everything else is far from resort. The cheap buffet in the restaurant (Ramparts) isn't worth the few dollars that it costs. The Irish pub across from it, though, was excellent. Business was easily conducted as the resort houses nice areas for conferences. Check-out was a breeze. Would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel... like Buick is a nice car... or your blind date has a nice personality”
Reviews.Author: texmln
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a conference at the JW Marriott. It's certainly a nice hotel... big, clean rooms, good service.. yada, yada, yada. Your grandparents will love it. Don't get me wrong - there's absolutely nothing wrong with the place. But in a town full of Ferrari's, this one's a Buick. There's no excitement here, no edge... no fun. The term "fuddy duddy" goes well with the JW. If you're a boring person, looking for a slow time with uninteresting people - albeit in comfort - this is your place. Old school in a bad way. If I'm going to stay in the suburbs off the strip I'm staying at the Red Rock just a few miles down the road. It's got the style, class, and fun factor that's missing from the JW. If you haven't been to the JW but are planning to visit let me tell you a little about your 'date'... she has a nice personality.

Reviews.Title: “Room was awesome...”
Reviews.Author: DallasRebel
Reviews.Content: We had a business conference here in September and I was on the planning committee so we all had the fortune of junior suites. Mine was awesome. Bathrooms were huge! Although one friend had the very large glass shower door come halfway off in her hand as she was getting out of the shower. Food for the conference was just so-so. Having a conference off the strip was good for session attendance and many folks stayed over but changed hotels to more Vegas-esque location. Our biggest complaint however was on day one which for some was the day before the conference. The plan was to have a little downtime by the pool before the busyness of the conference started. It rained for about an hour to an hour and a half that morning. The management in a not so stellar moment let ALL of the POOL STAFF go home!!!!! By noon the sun was shining, it was a glorious day and the pool was closed. We had a reverse mutiny and just took over. Going ourselves inside and getting two drinks at a time in styrofoam cups from the Pub inside. No towel service, no bar service, no lifeguards... Not a smart decision. It's VEGAS! how long does it normally rain? I'm not sure of the woman's name or even her position in the hotel BUT she did come out in her suit, hose and work pumps and started taking drink orders, schlepping buckets of beer herself back and forth to the inside bar. She finally ditched the pumps after finding some tennis shoes in the office! Saw her everyday on the trip and she was always gracious, smiling and asking if everything was Ok. When we did have pool service the next day and into the evening the servers were awesome. Took care of us like royalty. We were there by the pool late one evening AFTER the pool was closed and they sent out room service to us for dinner. The casino attached to this hotel is very very smoky which resulted in a lot of complaints. When walking to the conference center you had to go through the casino to get to the center. Not pleasant at peak times. The signage and directions around the hotel and conference center can be a little tricky as well. Did see a couple of furry long tailed critters scurrying around late at night but it is the desert and this is a ways out so that is to be expected. overall the stay was pleasant enough. I don't know that I would recommend this hotel for a getaway specifically if going to Las Vegas or for another conference due to the casino situation.....

Reviews.Title: “LOVED this place-class act all the way.”
Reviews.Author: vivace21
Reviews.Content: Just returned home from a 5-night romantic vacation at this JW Marriott and we absolutely loved the place. First of all, it is quiet and away from all the crazy congestion of the strip. There seems to be an older crowd and conventioners who use the facility, along with a lot of weddings due to the unusual date 10-10-10. It looks like a lovely place for a wedding. The grounds are beautifully well maintained, with lush fountains and palm trees everywhere. I loved the lagoon style pool with waterfall. There was MORE than enough space to find your own area at the pool without having to be near other guests. The poolside service was wonderful, and the food/drinks were good but typical extra high prices (10 bucks for a small margarita). That's expected at any resort. I was very pleased with our large room. Very clean, with beds that had down bedding and were SO very comfy (plus turn down service). There was a walk in closet and ceiling fan, and mini fridge (really a cooler more than a real fridge, but it got the job done). The absolute best thing that impressed me the most was the HUGE bathroom with soaking tub, steam shower, and seperate room for the toilet. Loved it. My only tiny complaint about the room was it had french doors that opened to a ledge only, and a balcony would have been awesome. Oh, and the TV is not a flat screen, but that was not a big deal for us considering how nice everything else was. The housekeepers did an outstanding job. We ate at the Italian place downstairs and it was good but again somewhat overpriced. I also utilized the Starbucks several times and we had a good breakfast in the place by the casino. Like everyone else mentioned, the casino is stinky and not that impressive. However the benefits of the hotel FAR outweighed any negatives. I am already planning our next stay!

Reviews.Title: “Felt as opulent as a European Spa! Lovely...”
Reviews.Author: Hillary47
Reviews.Content: Felt as opulent as a European Spa! Lovely area of town and easy to get to the Strip for fun. Restaurants in the area are excellent! Try Rosemary's .

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ariannacolffer
Reviews.Content: ive stayed here twice, both times because i was playing a tennis tournament at the darling tennis center 5 minutes away and i loved it. this is my go to hotel for when im playing here. unfortunately its somewhat far from the strip but the service was great and the beds were amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Almost a Gem”
Reviews.Author: Hope2FlySouth
Reviews.Content: After several nights on the "strip" of Las Vegas and attending a conference, we wanted to find a quiet spot to relax and celebrate our anniversary on our last night. We took a trip to the resort first to get a tour and check out the rooms. The desk staff and valet were super nice and despite a busy check in made a tour possible. We ended up making our reservation for the following night. Check in was smooth and we were able to check in early which was great because i wanted to sit by the pool and unwind. Our deluxe room was pretty nice, but you can see some wear and tear throughout the hotel. The room was spacious and comfortable but the best part for me was the huge bathroom and giant soaking jacuzzi tub! What a great place to unwind after a long week at a convention and staying on the LV strip! Perfect! The resort grounds were very well kept and the landscaping was beautiful. The pool area was large although the furniture was a little dated but overall very nice. The only down side to our experience was our restaurant experience. We decided to stay on the property and made a reservation for our anniversary dinner at their finer restaurant, "Ceres." It wasn't overly busy so it was clear a reservation was not needed, but when we arrived at the empty hostess stand we were greeted but had to wait about 10 minutes to get our table. The plus here is that we were able to sit outside since it was a nice cool evening. Our waiter made his way finally to our table and the first thing he said was "you'll have to be patient with me because we are swamped and short staffed tonight." Really? The first thing? Okay, well, my husband and I are in the hospitality business so we laughed it off and made little jokes....the rest of the service was slow but steady. We ordered their prix fixe menu but after a quick first course it took about 45 minutes to get our entrees. The atmosphere, the weather, and the food quality all made up for the service. Nonetheless, it was our anniversary so we enjoyed ourselves! We also ordered room service for breakfast and it was on time and excellent! The western omelet was amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, relaxing hotel, except for the smoke"”
Reviews.Author: MelG
Reviews.Content: We were taken aback when we first entered the lobby and were hit with heavy cigarette smoke. The first question out of my mouth, was that I thought it was smoke free. As it turned out, the smoke was drifting into the lobby from the casino, which was quite a distance down the hall. We could even smell the smoke in the hallway on the 4th floor., but our room was fine. If you can get past the smoke, this is a beautiful hotel with spacious luxurious rooms, and beautiful grounds. The pool area is especially relaxing and their breakfast buffet is lovely and delicious. It's located on the Western Edge of Las Vegas, so we enjoyed being away from the hustle and bustle of the downtown area. You can see the strip off in the distance from some areas of the hotel. The rooms are exceptionally nice with beautiful linens and very large marble bathrooms. The staff was very nice. Another disadvantage is that many of the little restaurants are in the casino area, so you have to walk through heavy smoke to get to them. I obviously don't like smoke, but even being sensitive to this, we had a great time and I would go back, since our room was fine and we spent most of our time at the hotel by the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Conference Hotel Off Las Vegas Strip”
Reviews.Author: DavidBStaffordshire
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights here as part of a work business meeting. Its off the strip and the taxi from the airport is $60 with another $45 if you want to go to the strip. Hotel does have a limited shuttle service. Rooms were well appointed and bed superbly comfortable - with great views of the mountains surrounding Vegas Didn't have time to use the pool or leisure facilities but they looked top notch Hotel is quite large - but they give you a map to find your way around Conference rooms were well equipped and catering of a high standard Only downside was having to walk through smoky casino to get anywhere Would recommend for business meetings / conferences

Reviews.Title: “Nice to be off Strip”
Reviews.Author: nyegirl
Reviews.Content: The valet are wonderful. The room very spacious with doors/windows that open. The bathtub was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Expectations”
Reviews.Author: thecoeinn
Reviews.Content: We booked the Marriott due to the more affordable Saturday night rate. The staff was very friendly and since we were celebrating our 26th wedding anniversary they sent a surprise amenity to our room. The landscaped areas are very beautiful. We especially enjoyed the outdoor swing. Be sure to enjoy the nearby Red Rock Canyon - worth the $7 entrance fee.

Reviews.Title: “Unless you're never leaving the room, stay somewhere else.”
Reviews.Author: The_hopester
Reviews.Content: I ended up staying at the JW Marriot because it was the recommended "overflow" hotel for a conference I was attending at the Red Rock Casino (down the road). The room itself was very nice. Comfortable beds, nice view, huge walk-in closet and luxurious bathroom. However, I was greatful that I wasn't spending much time in other areas of the hotel. 1) Casino: VERY stinky from smoke. Average age of players was certainly over 60. Carpets and walls showed signs of wear. 2) Food: only one option for breakfast and casual lunch, in the restaurant immediately adjacent to the STINKY casino. Couldn't tell if the gross food was prepared that way, or due to smoke exposure. Room service fruit plate was okay but pancakes were definitely Bisquick. 3) Transportation: The hotel has an airport shuttle TO the airport, but they don't bring people to the hotel from the airport. None of the shuttle companies will go out to the Summerlin area. $57 for a town car or $60+ for a taxi! Since parking is free at the hotel, spend that sixty bucks and just rent a car. In total, if you're under 50yo, go to the Red Rock Casino instead.

Reviews.Title: “Why do people want to stay here?”
Reviews.Author: gt_a_lif
Reviews.Content: As I sit in my room at 6AM bleery-eyed from little sleep, a few sips of coffee and a totally frustrating attempt to exercise I scratch my head as to why I did not receive any of the pleasures others have posted. And I am not tired because of late night activities. I started my unsuccessful journey to peaceful REM at 9PM last night since I flew cross-country during the day. To start on the positives, this is a beautiful hotel located outside of Las Vegas. It is NOT, by any stretch IN Vegas, just to manage expectations. The common areas are bright and airy and the pool area is pretty large. The rooms are very large, the beds are very comfortable (for the little time you can sleep) and the bathrooms are very large and clean. It is attached to Rampart Casino and the hotel has out-sourced many of the basic amenities to the casino. Issues: 1 - When I reserved the room I requested foam pillows. This was confirmed at check-in and the front desk person wrote on the list (at 2PM). After dinner (~8PM) the pillows were still not in the room so I called At Your Service. She started blaming others (I could not care); there was one person ahead of me in line for service (I did not care; TMI) and she would have Housekeeping bring them to the room. They did and half were foam and half were feather, which I discovered when I got into bed at 9. 2 - My room was over the entrance and every time someone drove up they kept the music blaring and the bell people did nothing. Up and down all night. Likewise every shuttle bus and tourist bus idled outside my window, a constant droaning invaded the room. 3 - Fitness Center - This is basically two vacant rooms in the Palms Tower and suffers from severe neglect. The photos on the website ARE NOT the firness center associated with the hotel, but require a $25 per day fee per person. Totally false advertisement. BTW - you need to go through the smoke-filled casino to get to the $25 fitness center as well as the Marriott's feeble "fitness center." Just what you want, lungs full of smoke on your way to exercise and then on the return. 4 - Coffee - Yes there is one cup available in the room via a coffee maker. So they have 2 Queen beds and one cup of coffee. Make sure you read and follow the directions of (a) cup; (b) coffee; (c) water; (d) plug in. One point, the coffee cup holds LESS than the coffee maker so if you fill the reservoir it will overflow into the cup. Perform task in bathroom on the sink. There is NO place to get coffee in the hotel, but there is a 24-hour restaurant if you go through the smoke-filled casino. Just what you want, lungs full of smoke on your way to get a cup of coffee first thing. When I asked the front desk if they do take-away, the response was "some times they do and sometimes they don't." Are you kidding? BTW the covers do not fit the take-away cups all that well. 5 - Housekkeping - This has become a standard inadequacy in many hotels in the US. The housekeepers do NOT vacuum when you stay multiple nights. But in this case the vacuuming did not occur between guests as well. Upon arrival there was still scraps on the carpet from previous occupants. Likewise at this location housekeeping did not clean the waste bucket in the room. Just total laziness on the housekeeper's part as well as quality control by the supervisor. 6 - Minor nits - there is no switch on the lamp on the night table. You need to get out of bed to find a light switch. The lighting in the bathroom is very low. The TV can only be seen from the bed. The desk and the chair are not in the TV's line of site.

Reviews.Title: “STAY AWAY!!”
Reviews.Author: cliffrose1
Reviews.Content: My mom, sister and I came to stay at the JW Mariott in Aug. 2010 for a fun girls weekend. We had a blast while in Las Vegas. As we were traveling home i realized some small bumps on the back of my arms but didn't think anything of it. When i got home and really examined the bumps i kept finding more and more, all over the back of my arms, back, neck, chest and face. I got online to figure out what the bumps were and found out they are BED BUG BITES!!! So i called the JW Mariott to let them know about the bites. The manager told me they didn't have bed bugs and thinks it was a spider that came into my bed. A SPIDER??!! I have over twelve bites on my face alone and am covered in them from the waist up!! She was rude and inconsiderate when all i wanted to do was report the bites. Don't stay here, there are plenty of other places in Vegas that care about the business.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel--stay here!”
Reviews.Author: landr
Reviews.Content: The JW Marriott is simply wonderful! If you're looking for a quiet oasis from the lights of Las Vegas, this is the place. We spent 2 nights here before leaving for the Grand Canyon. The rooms--large, comfy beds, beautiful marble bathroom with whirpool tub & glass shower, nice size TVs. The hotel is connected to a casino so you don't have to leave. The pool area is large with waterfalls and cabanas. Food and bar service is available at the pool. Definitely reserve the breakfast package. The buffet breakfast is well worth the additional $20 per night. We would definitely stay here again--free valet parking and no resort fee for elite rewards members. The spa is really something to see with its own outdoor pool. Enjoy!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but...”
Reviews.Author: quik
Reviews.Content: This is the 4th time my family has stayed at this hotel. We really like this hotel because it has big rooms and a beautiful bathroom. It is also a very good value during the hot summer months. While I love this hotel there are a few things that I don't like. First, the pool hours. We were informed at check-in that the pool would close at 6:00 pm. It was a Saturday night with about 100 people in or around the pool and it was about 100 degrees outside. Also, I was not happy that they allowed cigarette smoking right next to the pool. There were a lot of children there and several people smoking. Second, we are Gold MR members and did not get an upgraded room. Not a big deal, since all of the rooms are beautiful, but we've had better rooms when we were only Silver. We were, however, offered a pass to the spa, which we could not use since we had kids with us, and free internet. Third, the lobby of the hotel and the hallways smelled like the attached casino. I would not let these things keep me from staying there again, because it is a nice place, but I think that the pool should stay open later at a resort hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet hotel with great amenities off the strip, but CHARGES?! for wifi”
Reviews.Author: MarylandDoc
Reviews.Content: This JW Marriott is a quiet, large, and was mostly empty throughout a seven day trip in August. The hotel staff were friendly. We enjoyed using the location as a launching pad for day (or more often evening) trips to the strip, Hoover Dam, and downtown Vegas. Best marks: breakfast buffet was awesome! The room was huge with a luxurious bed and huge bathroom with separate soaking tub and shower. There grounds are beautiful: we usually followed breakfast with a wonderful, relaxing walk each morning. Big challenges: the casino inside had the worst win rates of any of the 10 casinos we visited everywhere else in Vegas. Self-parking was fairly inconvenient, a long-walk from our room in the spa tower. Huge problem: Wifi is $10 per day. For a hotel with these nightly rates that's frankly cheap and silly.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was Ok”
Reviews.Author: meks76
Reviews.Content: This hotel overall was ok, it's not a place if you are under 50 and not on a business trip. The hotel grounds were nice, we enjoyed our time at the pool. We had a horrible experience at the restaurants so beware (the Promenade Cafe food was disgusting and the J.C. Wooloughan Irish Pub had the worse service ever) . If I had to do it all over again, I wouldn't have chosen this hotel for my stay in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic wedding experience.”
Reviews.Author: Blondedia
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the JwMarriott, as we booked with them for our wedding on June 30th 2010. We only stayed for 2 nights as we were moving onto the strip, but we were sorry to leave.!! We had a small wedding in the Zen garden of the hotel. The hotel gave us a junior suite which we were'nt expecting so that was a great surprise, it was a lovely room. The wedding was great. The wedding officiant Dr Mickie Hecht was fantastic, she made the wedding so personal to my husband and I, we felt totally at ease with her and I highly recommend her to anyone looking for a wedding officiant..!!! The hotel gave us a complimentary breakfast in the Ceres restaurant which was a buffet. Food was fantastic. We ate whilst looking onto the garden with the beautiful waterfalls. I highly recommend this hotel to everyone, cant say anything bad about it. We stayed at the Bellagio and the Encore for a few nights after. I do not recommend the Bellagio, dirty bedding, and when this was replaced, the clean sheets had holes in them.!!! Not what you would expect from a 5star hotel. If I was to go back to Vegas at anytime in the future, I would definately stay at the Marriott again.

Reviews.Title: “It's a satisfactory hotel, if you need to be in Summerlin.”
Reviews.Author: TwoFourTheRoad
Reviews.Content: First off I have to say that I liked that fact that the resort fee was optional and not automatically tacked on to the bill. For $25 you can opt to take advantage of the fitness center, spa, internet, etc. So kudos for making this fee optional. And now for the bad: they 'canceled' our reservation. We had a suite reserved weeks in advance and while we were driving out to LV, we received a phone call asking if we had canceled our reserv. When we said 'no' the agent said that all the suites were now booked but she'd try to get us appropriate accommodations. We told her that we had just gone online at 10pm the night before to print out the confirmation and we had it with us. It all seemed very suspect, as when I've previously canceled reservations, no one calls to ask if I'm still coming and if I had in fact canceled. So I think that they canceled us on purpose to give the room to someone else (at a higher rate perhaps?), and then called us to 'let us know' that we would be staying in a different room/rooms. They put us in adjoining rooms instead, and they gave us a reduced rate on them, and we saved a little bit of money by doing it, but it was all very disconcerting as we had two teenagers who were really looking forward to the experience. In our bldg (there are 2 hotel towers), the areas around the elevators smelled like a sewer leak and/or mildew, depending on the day. Luckily you just pass through these areas and the rooms we had did not smell at all and were very nice, clean, and comfortable. The beds were great. The bathroom is great. Housekeeping was great. In-room coffee/coffeemaker is good. TV channel selection was good. The pool is nice. The grounds are nice. Parking is plentiful. The buffet is awful. The hostess in the buffet is the rudest hostess I've ever encountered. There are a lot of eating places within a few minutes drive of the hotel. Definitely have a car if you stay here, it's very very far from the Strip, and it's not walking distance to anything. Overall recommendation is: if you're attending an event here, then it's a satisfactory place to stay. If you don't have a specific reason for staying here, then stay elsewhere in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “The Best of Both Worlds”
Reviews.Author: Paul-From-NY
Reviews.Content: This is a great resort! What it is NOT: If you’re expecting sleek glass and steel, a hot casino and easy access to the 24/7 “Vegas Strip” you are out of luck. This hotel won’t offer “the greatest weekend you’ll never remember.” What it IS: This J.W. Marriott is a sprawling resort in great condition. It offers impeccable grounds complete with flowing fountains indoors and out. A huge beautiful pool, a gym that rivals any health club and access to a whole lot of golf that’s practically within walking distance. My wife and nine year old daughter loved it. We spent our days away from the crowds in a dessert resort. When we were ready a fifteen minute ride yielded all the glitz we could handle at the Vegas strip. ROOM: What most hotel rooms cost buys you a one bedroom suite. It was roughly the size of Yankee Stadium. The main bathroom was divided in three sections. Giant shower, giant bathroom including a Jacuzzi and a separate room with toilet and bidet. Additionally, there was a half bath on the other side of the apartment. Furnishings were not new but in excellent condition. There were two TVs with cable—not flat screens but heck! We weren’t there to watch TV. Two French doors overlooked mountains and golf course. STAFF: Excellent. Concierge, bell hops, valet, front desk and maids are all tireless and friendly. They even have lifeguards at the pool and the waitresses there keep you fed and hydrated. CASINO: It’s tacky. It’s loud. It stinks of smoke—just like every other casino. RESTAURANTS: There are lots on the property. We only ate at one (the pub). It was fine, nothing special but fine. SUMMING IT UP: Great place to relax, excellent pool, good golf, lots of shopping around. But if you want “the strip” stay on "the strip."

Reviews.Title: “They did it again”
Reviews.Author: PortNo_California
Reviews.Content: My family and I have stayed at the JW Marriott in Summerlin several times over the past years. It continues to be one of the best hotel expereinces we have encountered. The physical plant is fantasitc, high quality materials, large rooms and public areas. We love the feel and energy of the resort. The staff has always been fantastic. This was a trip I took with some friends and we spent a lot of time at the pool. The pool seems to be about an acre in size with pleanty of lounging space a nice food menu and great beverage service. Being away from the "Strip" noise and action we really like. You can go to the strip, visit and return to a very quite setting.

Reviews.Title: “The Best”
Reviews.Author: dustyo
Reviews.Content: This was our second time staying at the JW Marriott Resort. WE LOVE IT. Quiet, comfortable and clean. All employees were very nice and helpful. The rooms are large and nicely decorated. The bathroom is huge. I loved the walk in closet. The buffet and other eateries were the best. The wait staff, in all, was great. The Rampart Casino, on site, made it easy to go back to our room when ever we wanted too. I will stay here again on our next visit to Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet but lacked the wow factor normally found in JW's.”
Reviews.Author: ppmintpatty
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here on a last minute trip to Vegas for some R&R at the swimming pool. Very quiet and relaxing - the pool wasn't loud and wild like at some Vegas Strip resorts. This hotel is far from the strip and they only offer a couple of free shuttles a day so we decided to rent a car. No shuttle service available from the airport and a taxi would be very costly. We stay at JW Marriott's quite often but this hotel was in rougher shape than Orlando and Phoenix - and not nearly as impressive and lacked a wow factor. But the rooms were big and the bathrooms were absolutely stunning. Great beds and linens. We got a good deal so we were pleased overall but we would probably not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for family”
Reviews.Author: Lovetravelpskk
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for a weekend with 2 young kids. They loved this place and we loved it too. It is 15 minutes drive from strip. Perfect distance for us. we still go to the shows on the strip but without crowd and smoke. it is a real resort to relax. Morning breakfast is great. Beautiful ground with great pool. never feel crowd here. We stay at 2nd tower. It is great walk to breakfast in the morning. Kids like the pool (will be better with few water slide). great value with AAA. Will go back agian.

Reviews.Title: “Alot of walking”
Reviews.Author: ktraveler2
Reviews.Content: We were in the Spa tower in room 4128 which is the farthest from anything. We overlooked the parking lot but could see the strip in distance. The bathroom was great a 3 person jacuzzi. The pool was full of kids but thank goodness for the Aqua Sulis spa areas. Spa and fitness areas were very nice. I had a very good massage. Spa tickets were included with our golf package. Golf package was a great deal as the TPC was awesome and lots of fun. I loved #12, a canyon version of an island green. The food at the pool bar was good. It's weird that you have to walk through the smoky casino to get to 'restaurant row" and the spa. Ate at Spiedini and the Asian restaurant which was just ok and overpriced. The irish pub food was ok but I thought the portions were small but the price was moderate. They had a great band on Sat called Swagger, I would go back to catch them again. I did not like the size of the resort and the fact that it felt like you had to walk a million miles to get anywhere. The grounds are nice but very confusing. I would not recommend for anyone who has trouble walking.

Reviews.Title: “JW Marriott does not value their locals”
Reviews.Author: LVNV2010
Reviews.Content: JW Marriott has raised their prices for local to go to the pool. Last year, it cost $20 to enter, now it costs $50 per person. I think this rate increase is ridiculous. In these times, esp in this city, all hotels should be competing for the best service and prices for their locals. The cabanas at JW are behind the times and the pool does not have anything better to offer than a stations casino, which has nicer pools and better service. I will never go back to JW and will never recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: westernnewenglander
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on points from 5/27 - 5/30. Beautiful grounds, great pool area. Go here for a quieter spot away from the strip. It's about 15 minutes from the strip by car. Parking is free. Great spa. Decent gym. Casino is OK. Pretty small and smokey. Our room was adequate. Had a balcony door, but not much of a balcony. Bathroom was large.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: RockyRaleighNC
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great – it’s well off the strip which is what we wanted. We had a Jr suite which was quite large with two full baths one of which was huge. The resort is huge which it’s supposed to be, there are several restaurants (service is spotty but prices are reasonable). There is one pool which is pretty good. Then there’s the casino – we don’t gamble much but overall the casino was pretty cheesy, and the average age of the people in there had to by 75, very different from the downtown casinos. We don’t gamble so we didn’t really care. The hotel is right up the street from the TPC course, and it’s actually in a pretty suburban area even though the picture makes it look a bit more isolated. This however worked out quite nicely cause the place is surrounded by great restaurants and the location is very accessible to other stuff. I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location if you don't want to be downtown”
Reviews.Author: TandAFailor
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the JW Marriot Sept 2-9 to get married out in Red Rock Canyon. Even though we did not use thier Wedding coordinator and ended up handling it all ourselves, the hotel staff was AMAZING! I am a Platinum Rewards member and have every spread of experience at Marriotts. This place, although a tad older, was STUNNING. We were upgraded automtically, without even asking, to a 2 room suite with a HUGE patio overlooking a waterfall. The concierge was extremely helpful and room service was always timely and well done. Before the wedding we were given all access to the resorts waterfalls, landscaping, etc to take some breathtaking photos. As previously noted by other travellers, the rooms ARE HUGE by Vegas standards. The location is PERFECT for wanting to experience Vegas a day, maybe two, but still enjoy the restful portions of being on vacation. The location is great for families that don't want to subject their kids to the "glitter" of downtown, although might be a bit stuffy for younger crowd looking to be in the thick of things. The pool was great, waitstaff and towel attendants were polite and helpful. The drinks and food at the pool was a bit over-priced. The casino was not all that, but we arent big gamblers. The highlight of our trip was after our wedding, (mind you, NOT arranged by Marriott) we were told we had reservations at Spiedini Ristorante for our entire party, if we wanted to dine there. There were 8 of us total and we did not return from REd Rock until almost 8pm, but they made it work for us. They set us up at a private outdoor table overlooking a pool and waterfalls. The manager and wait staff were OUT OF THIS WORLD, comped several aspects of the meal and a bottle of champagne. The food WAS 5 STAR and I am very picky when it comes to italian food. Overall, a terrifc experience at an outstanding location.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort”
Reviews.Author: annc123
Reviews.Content: We reserved the standard room at a good rate, and we were very happy with our stay. The hotel accomodated our requests, and we LOVED the pool area. Tons of chairs, a great waterfall, and lots of sun and shady spots. It's pretty far from the strip (20-25 minute cab ride) but we were OK with that. I would recommend this hotel for a romantic getaway or for families. It's not "spring break" wild, but more mature and pretty.

Reviews.Title: “2ND Stay @ JW Marriott LV”
Reviews.Author: elon94
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at JW Marriott LV twice in the past (3) years. The first trip was during March Madness 2007 with a group of friends from NC. We were there to watch NCAA B-Ball and play golf. The second trip was this past December fro quick work trip. The hotel rooms are very nice and are on the large size; have stayed at JW in Orlando & DC; neither of those hotels had standard rooms like LV. The resort has a good gym and spa; in fact the spa is one of the nicer ones I’ve seen. The grounds are very nice and kept immaculate. There is one factor about the hotel which can be a positive and/or negative depending on your opinion of Casinos. The Hotel leases out casino space and there is a small to midsize casino in the center of the property (you don’t have to go thru it but it is close to shopping; restaurants; spa and it is in the walkway between 2 tours. The con is that there is a casino with the noises (bells & whistles); the pro is that restaurants and drinks are much more affordable than most JW Marriott’s. The only regret is that I haven’t been able to get my wife out to JW LV; but maybe sometime in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and Overrated”
Reviews.Author: funnytraveler1
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel before, only because my client has a corporate account here. I have never thought is lived up to the Marriott name, but my last trip was my last stay in this over priced motor inn. It started at check in, where my reservation was not shown as prepaid and then continued with them attempting to charging me a rate that was almost double our corporate rate. The front desk staff was snooty and apparently thought they were working at the Ritz. In the middle of my four day stay, I was locked out of my room and told I had checked out that afternoon. It was an embarrassing situation that was played out in front of a lobby full of guests. In addition, there restaurants are mediocre at best and their casino looks like something you would find in a downscale local neighborhood. I will never stay in this hotel again and am doing everything in my power to ensure my company closes their account here and moves to a hotel that appreciates customers. Do not waste your money or time here.

Reviews.Title: “Kinda Creepy & Prone to Excessive Charges”
Reviews.Author: foureyes18
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for four nights as part of a conference. A real mixed bag but ultimately turned off by excessive charges that are a result of hotel shortcomings. Here's the quick rundown. Pros - HUGE rooms by Vegas standards. Some of the furniture could use a touch-up but the bed and pillows were top notch and the rain-style shower head was a plus. - Quiet. Almost felt like I was staying in a private apartment building. Very low-key and subtle. Cons - Insanely geriatric, retiree locals who come for the casino and cheap food give the place a creepy vibe. Nothing like having to see motorized wheelchairs, chain smokers, and oxygen tanks in a hotel. - Casino is on the small side and has limited variety. - Location is at least 20 minutes from the strip. - Wireless dead zone. Almost everyone in our group complained about the poor mobile reception both in the rooms and common areas. - Daily charges for internet The last two Cons really stuck me and had me angry at departure. It is pretty insane to charge anyone for internet access anymore and to charge obscene rates for phone usage. If LaQuinta can offer Internet for free, a property advertising itself as high-end can certainly do it too. Because of the poor mobile reception I was forced to use the landline and was charged an INSANE $200+ for four phone calls that averaged 10 minutes each. That's not a typo -- $200+. Unacceptable. The front desk said there was nothing they could do about the charges or my complaint about being forced to use their landlines. In a rush to get to the airport, I couldn't argue the point further but will certainly take it up with the property via email once I return home.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: romadaro
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at JW Marriotts all over the world-Lima, Rio, Hong Kong, Singapore to name a few and this one doesn't EVEN come close. You could choke to death in the casino because of all the smoke. I walked in, looked around and was out in ten minutes or less and absolutely wreaked of cigarette smoke-to the point that I went to the room and immediately took a shower. As far as the rooms are concerned, they are dull and unexciting. They upgraded me to a suite and it was the ugliest thing I've ever seen. The furniture was scratched, the carpeting was stained and one of the lamps didn't even work! This is definitely the dog of JW Marriotts. Book it only if you can get a good price!

Reviews.Title: “I know JW Marriotts and you, sir, are no JW Marriott”
Reviews.Author: Travelbuff32
Reviews.Content: I'm a Marriott Silver Elite member and frequent traveler who has enjoyed high-end JW Marriott properties, like the one in Miami. This is NOT that JW Marriott. This property didn't begin as a JW Marriott and you can tell. The attached casino and restaurant choices are dingy, not well lit, and limited in choice. Oh, and did I say smoky? Unlike the newer casinos, this one is definitely smoky and definitely not full of a hip gambling crowd. The rooms are not what you'd expect from a JW Marriott. Old clunky TVs instead of a flat screen and the bathroom doesn't even approach the high standards of a hotel like The Venetian. I had asked the night before if I could duck into the never-used conference room off the lobby for a quick business call and was told yes. But then in the morning, I was refused access to that room and scrambled to find a quiet place. I had to duck into a hallway off the lobby and stood there gazing out the sidewalk, to see a rat cross my path outside. Kind of the perfect capper to a not very pleasant stay. The Red Rock Resort is BY FAR a much better off-Strip destination and, in fact, that's where we wound up going for dinners and movies. Our 19-year old son's reaction to the Red Rock was "Why aren't we staying HERE? This place rocks." Lesson learned!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, crap location”
Reviews.Author: gotogo
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the JW in Feb08 and again in Feb09 Rooms very nice, large and clean. We had one of their 2 Bed suites - PERFECT ! Service efficient and friendly. Breakfast good and again staff very accommodating, just ask for what u would like and they will bring it. The on-site Casino is good for a night, but after that u will start to feel the only real disadvantage of the hotel and that is the distance to the Strip. There is a shuttle bus, but it finishes after 24:00 i think. Nevertheless, having also stayed on the strip on both visits it was also a welcome break. My recommendation - If u are in Vegas for the first time and looking to experience the noise and action, this hotel is probably not for u, however if u are a returning visitor and looking to experience the fun but would still like to return to civilization in afterwards then this place is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Bag”
Reviews.Author: mplstraveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is truly a mixed bag. We stayed here because it was our first time to Vegas and we were not sure if we would like strip life. Well, turns out we did. Therefore, the location was a real pain. On a normal day, its not too bad getting to the strip - 20 minutes max. Do not stay here if you plan to spend a major holiday on the strip - i.e. New Years, Christmas, etc. That was my mistake, and next time I'll stay on the strip. However, the hotel itself is a bit dated. Looks like the potential is there, but they have let maintenance slide a bit. The carpets are dirty, there is always room service food sitting in the hallways, and our Jacuzzi jets did not work. If you do not want to Valet everyday, the self-park is a bit of a walk. Also, you must pay 25.00 per room per day to avail of the internet as well as use of the spa facility (which has a real gym.) Unfortunately, the internet is not wireless - you must work from a little desk. This fee also supposedly includes two waters a day -ours was never restocked. There is free coffee in the room, unfortunately, the creamer they left was completely congealed and spoiled when I opened it. A bit more attention to detail would greatly improve this hotel. On the positive side, rooms are large and spacious, the bathroom is beautiful, there is a rainforest shower in the shower stall, the spa waterfall shower is amazing, the jacuzzi tub fits two people, and the bed is comfortable with beautiful linens. All in all, its still a good value but you need to see if the positives outweigh the negatives for you.

Reviews.Title: “Oasis of Quiet in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: hallieb
Reviews.Content: The JW Marriott is a lovely quiet resort about 25 minutes from the Strip. It has all the amenities you'd expect from a Marriott; our favorite was the comfy bed with down comforter, etc. After reading many of the reviews of this property, I am stumped as to why there are so many complaints about the distances between rooms, restaurants and lobby/concierge. This is a RESORT, people, which implies space, where there is room to spread out. If you want everything super close, don't go to a resort. Go to a hotel. That said, we didn't mind the walk to conference rooms, Starbucks and the Carmel Room (a terrific high end steak place with romantic curtained booths!!) but the sewer smell we experienced in the hallway was disgusting and put our appetites in check. (I had read reviews about this problem, why can't something be done about it?) The JW Marriott is quiet, understated and luxurious and a lovely change from the glitz and frenzy of the Strip. Get a rental car and you'll enjoy both.

Reviews.Title: “would stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: amanjman
Reviews.Content: I am SOOO glad we did not stay on the strip! This was a nice hotel and the entire staff was lovely. We had to pay for internet, so we just chose to do it one night out of 4 while we were there. We were able to easily access the internet on our phones if we needed to. There are two "towers" each 6 stories high. We were not in the spa tower so each time we entered the hotel, there was no receptionist and practically no other guests in sight--we loved it!! It was not a long walk to the main reception area/concierge. The valet was always available at both entrances and there was no charge for parking as often as you would need (we did tip an awful lot). We were upgraded to a suite which was really the nicest room we have ever stayed in and we have stayed in many very nice hotels. I got a very nice (and very expensive) manicure while I was there, and the manicurist was so sweet and professional. It was worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Located near Red Rock Canyon and golf courses”
Reviews.Author: joycekwong
Reviews.Content: Good location 30minutes from the Vegas Strip in Summerlin and close to golf courses and Red Rock Canyon. The rooms were roomy but a bit old. The in-room jacuzzi works well. There is an abundance of choices for those with a car.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TalonFarmer
Reviews.Content: By far the best Hotel I had ever been to, great staff, great service and an even better Buffet. You dont even have to leave the Hotel, food, games everything is right there. Outstanding!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: sincityjenn
Reviews.Content: We got a room on the 6th floor (top floor) in the Spa Tower. If you are going to stay here, I would suggest the Spa Tower, unless you have kids, then the other tower would be for you. The Room: We walked in our room and it was fabulous! At night we had a great view of the city. There were french doors that opened up to a grass/garden area. It wasn't a balcony, it was french doors that just opened up with a balcony railing right when you open the door. There were a couple sitting chairs and a coffee table that were right next to the french doors, so you can open the doors and sit in the chairs and relax. There is an ethernet cable ready for you to plug your computer into and it was free. The desk is nice sized with an office chair. The bed was really nice. Very comfortable and not too hard. There is a walk-in closet (nice-sized) with an ironing board, iron, and a safe. There is a little bar area that has a mini coffee maker. It makes single cups of coffee at a time. There is a little box where you can choose your coffee, tea, etc.. The Bathroom: The bathroom is BIG! There is a corner jacuzzi tub that can easily fit 2 people. There is a corner shower stall that has a sitting area and you can choose between a regular shower head or the waterfall shower head. Dual sinks with great ammenities. (shampoo, conditioner, shower gel, lotion, q-tips, cotton nalls, etc.). The toilet is in a seperate part of the bathroom and is seperated by a door. There is a knob in the bathroom that you can turn on to listen to whatever you are watching on TV. I guess it's good if you're listening to the news while getting ready or whatever. The room includes some really nice and comfy robes. Dislike: The only thing I did not like was that there was no fridge in the room. As nice as the rooms are, there was no fridge. Kinda weird. In place of a fridge was what they consider a "cooler". This thing is not a cooler and you cannot change the temp of it. They have a bottle of water in there ($5 for the bottle) and it was maybe 2 degrees over room temp. Pretty pathetic cooler. There is a sign though that says that if you would like to request a fridge brought up to the room you can do so, but for only certain rooms. Again, weird. The Pool: The pool is gorgeous! Unfortunately I was unable to go there. The Spa: The Spa is awesome! A little pricey, but well worth the money. I got massages, scrubs, etc.. You get a robe and slippers, a private locker and it is just absolutely relaxing. There is a sauna and a steam room, hot and cold plunges, and a little pool inside the locker room. There is also these showers that have water plunging down on you really hard. Kinda massages your back and stuff. There are normal showers in there as well with the waterfall nozzle. They have large bottles of shampoo, conditioner, and shower gel for you to use. There is also a fitness center in it, so you can work out too. I ordered lunch there which was also a little pricey for a salad but I was so relaxed I didn't care. There is a door to go outdoors to a coed pool and jacuzzi. There is also a fridge that you can have unlimited juices, water, and fruit. Restaurants: For breakfast, Ceres is best! They have a breakfast buffet that is really good! You can sit outside on the patio or you can eat indoors. Speidini's is really good too! It's an italian-type restaurant and is great for dinner. The hotel is connected to the Rampart Casino. I do not recommend eating at the Rampart Buffet for either breakfast, lunch, or dinner. I heard mixed reviews of that place, but after eating there, my husband and I both felt a little queezy. And we have iron stomachs! The Promenade cafe is good for lunch. There's a Starbucks there that comes in handy. The Carmel Room is a pretty good steakhouse. It's a la carte, so it can be a bit pricey. There are these secluded tables that are seperated by curtains for privacy. Pretty cool. If you eat there, just request one to the hostess. There's no extra charge for them. Checkout: Checkout was pretty easy. If you need a ride to the airport you can take their shuttle for $30 per person. The only bad thing is the shuttle only leaves at certain times and there are only 4 or 5 time slots. So you have to hope that your flight is somewhere around that. The other choice is a private vehicle for $50 that can pick you up whenever you want. Since there were me and my husband it was not only cheaper for us to take the private vehicle, but it was also more convenient (time-wise). The valet guys are really nice and very hospitable, so make sure you tip them. The only thing about the hotel is it's location. It's not on the strip and about a 15+ minute drive from the strip. It's in the Summerlin area which is on the other side of town. However, it is really nice and very relaxing. Since there's a casino attached, you can get your gamble fix in as well. There's also a casino next door and another one a few miles away.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed”
Reviews.Author: Sparhawk6
Reviews.Content: This hotel is billed as a nice resort in Vegas, but it's anything but. I was surprised to find that there is no option for wifi, at least in the palm tower. The rooms have ancient tube TVs, and the remote for my room did not function. There was also a stench of open sewer throughout the building the weekend of my stay. The free parking for the Palm tower is a long walk from the front door. Your other option is paying for a valet with tips. The rooms a a good size, and the restaurant area is pretty nice, but to be honest, the place feels deserted - almost too empty. It feels dead.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best Marriott experience I've had”
Reviews.Author: e_in_miami
Reviews.Content: This was a mixed bag, to be sure. The rooms are certainly large and nicely appointed. The view of the mountains from our room was spectacular. Though we didn't use the pool, it's lovely and huge. Did use the hot tub which could've been hotter but was warm and bubbly and after a long day walking on the strip was perfect. The grounds are beautiful and staff was invariably pleasant and helpful. So why wasn't I thrilled. Let's start in the bathroom. It's enormous with a jacuzzi tub and separate shower. But on getting into the shower, it appeared that there was black mildew growing where the "seat" built into the shower met the floor. Which was creepy. On closer inspection, there was simply no grout there at all, those were unfilled gaps I was seeing. Also kind of creepy. The lighting was another issue. While there were five lights in the bedroom/living area, with all of them turned on, it was still dim. But the bathroom was the worst. The lighting was behind a cove, and even with the lighted makeup mirror, it was difficult to see well enough to even put on makeup. The hairdryer was one of those small travel-type dryers with two settings - burning hot tornado or light breeze cool. It made it really difficult to use and I very much regretted not bringing my own dryer, though in general, we stay at Marriotts and they have much higher quality dryers. Another issue was transportation to the strip. I found either on the conference brochure or their web site (can't remember which) that there was a shuttle to the strip. I am SO glad I called because this shuttle, during the week, goes 3 times a day. So you can't come and go at your leisure and if you go in the morning, you are pretty much trapped there all day unless you're willing to spend $50 (I'm told) on a cab. This is definitely not a hotel I'd ever stay in without a rental car. The casino seems small and shabby. It didn't seem at all up to par with the strip hotels, and certainly not to the casino at the red rock resort which is only about 10-15 minute from the Marriott. We were there for a business meeting and so didn't have a choice on where to stay. I have to say though that I would never choose to stay at this hotel. Too many negatives and way too many other choices.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you need”
Reviews.Author: LT1
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at this resort for a weekend on our way to Utah. It was a fabulous property that had everything we needed to make our stay comfortable. The room was spacious enough to fit a roll-away bed. The beds were Marriott quality--- heavenly comforters and goosedown feather pillow. The room was clean! The property itself was huge, with a great swimming pool, volleyball area, meandering walkways, etc. We purchased a package that was advertised at the check-in counter for an extremely reasonable rate that allowed entrance/use of the workout facility and spa for two people and internet use and the bottles of water in the room. They have a gift shop/store, restaurants (one that serves buffet), and a casino. The great thing is that there is a golf course nearby and another casino in the vicinity. It is not on the strip, so there is no traffic to deal with. The surrounding area is quiet and beautiful. We would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Gigantic rooms and great pools”
Reviews.Author: cardigans1
Reviews.Content: We took a weekend trip to Las Vegas with our two young children under 7. The JW Marriott is exactly what we had hoped for. It was a huge property with gigantic rooms. It was only about 7 minutes off of the strip. Self Parking was right by the entrance to the Spa Tower which was very nice. One odd thing that seem misplaced was the casino. I'm assuming they farmed it out as the restaurants and the casino seemed so un-Marriott like. We had the breakfast buffet at the restaurant closest to the front desk (can't remember the name right now). They had omelette station, waffle maker, and fresh pancakes. Other than that, the buffet overall was pretty disappointing as far as selection goes. We loved the gigantic pool. It was 3 1/2 feet deep in the majority of the pool which was perfect for me 7 year old, but a bit too deep for my 5 year old. There are two hottubs as well. The one closest to the towel cabana was lukewarm, the other one was the perfect temperature. Overall, I would highly recommend this hotel if want to be in Las Vegas but not necessarily be in the craziness of the Strip.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing, Yet Plenty to Do”
Reviews.Author: MBSNewJersey
Reviews.Content: A beautiful resort with a very helpful and pleasant staff. It is close enough to the strip yet far enough away to escape from the hectic pace of Sin city. The hotel has several restaurants at various price points, and offers a good variety. The staff was very helpful, dining was never rushed, which was good after a day or evening in the casinos. We used the fitness center and spa which had a nice private hydrotherapy pool, sauna, and various fitness machines. It was a great way to spend an entire day. Since we were there in May you could sit outside without melting and enjoy the pool and gardens. I would surely stay here again. They have a shuttle bus into the strip which leaves a few times a day. It was never crowded, we had no problems getting a seat. During the busy times of the year that could be a problem. We did have a car, but the bus was so easy we took that into the city many times. Be sure to get a car to go to Red Rock Canyon, it's very close by and worth the trip. Also go the the Valley of Fire, it should not be missed for the scenery. The Hoover Dam is an easy trip, go by car. I wouldn't bother with a tour, that seems like they are herding cattle, go on your own. You can then go to Lake Mead and tour on the paddle boat, great trip. Again, go on your own, no need for a planned tour unless you do not have a car. We did the Hoover Dam, Lake Mead, and Valley of Fire in one long day, but it was worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, a few problems though”
Reviews.Author: Lizzyzim
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this lovely resort for the third time in four years. I like it in general, but we have always had a problem getting the rooms cool enough. There are motion sensors on the thermostats and when you go to bed, it gets way too warm for comfortable sleeping. A very nice custodian came by but couldn't do anything about it. Also, the food and service at Spiedini Restaurant were just awful. It was hot and stuffy and the waitstaff couldn't fix it (are they trying to save money by cheaping out on A/C?) and the calimari was so greasy and horrible that the three of us who ordered it couldn't eat it at all--and the waitress didn't apologize or offer to bring us something else. We won't stay here on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “We love the JW”
Reviews.Author: MOTHERLOAD
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in April 2009 and again in July 2009. I think we have stayed there a total of 5 stays. We love it. Great pool, casino at hotel, golf course, several restaurants, on site, and the rooms are huge and just awesome! We usually go over to the Red Rock Casino for the excellent buffet and for bowling (72 lanes). There is also a Cheesecake Factory nearby, and other shopping and restaurants. There is an Irish brewpub in the Casino area next to the JW that has good food and beers. There is also a Starbucks on site for lite breakfasts. The JW restaurant is good and has a nice breakfast buffet where you can eat outside next to the pond and watch the fish & waterfalls. Room service is pretty good, with large pizzas, ice cream, etc. They have free valet parking at the JW and a good spa also. I can't wait to go back again. The beds are awesome!

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel, advantage of being away from the choas of LV”
Reviews.Author: stolkien
Reviews.Content: Large hotel, like all Las Vegas hotels have to walk miles to get from one end to the other. Stayed with my husband and 2 daughters aged 7 & 11. We had a 2 bedded queen room, large spacious room, walk in wardrobe, large spa bath, seperate shower. Considering we have 4 guests in our room , towels for 3,more towels requested as well as rollaway bed.No problem.On our return the next day back to towels for 3 people alittle annnoying. No free internet service. Large pool no deep area, very cold, not heated only our daughters braved it very slowly. Plenty of pool loungers. Restaurants around the hotel, very mixed and very very average. Didn't eat at expensive restaurants as with our children. Ate at Irish pub food pretty awful, the aeroplane food was better. Breakfast was also very basic,at the Rampart Casino restaurant. Slow from ordering miserable waitress full order was not received but due to her manner couldn't be bothered to chase up our toast. Glad we are not here any longer than the 2 nights. Only main advantages large pool with fab spa bath and away from noisy LV strip.

Reviews.Title: “Getting tired - needs updating”
Reviews.Author: TRS
Reviews.Content: We have been staying at this property near Las Vegas for about 5 years. It's funny how new hotels pop up and suddenly your "old" hotel has lost its charm. That's definitely happening with the JW Marriott Las Vegas. The rooms and the common areas (hallways, dining room, even casino and bathrooms) are simply not in the same league as other 4 or 5 star properties in Las Vegas. The casino and establishments near it are also getting "tired". Having stayed at several JW's over the past 5 years, this one simply continues to look more and more dated as the years go by. The furnishings and decor are all very dull and uninspired. They never really tried too hard to tie in the southwestern feel of Nevada nor did they try to make it particularly luxurious which would be fine if this were a regular Marriott property rather than a JW. We did appreciate that the parking is free although the valets were busy chatting when we were struggling to get our bags out the door the morning we checked out. Housekeeping also needs to be told to "use their inside voices" because one yelling down the hall to the other at 8am is simply unacceptable. The breakfast staff at the main restaurant "Ceres" were all very good to us but we did have an issue with one man at the front desk. Breakfast for 2 was included in our room but my husband did not have any "coupons" with him so the waiter simply suggested he go to the front desk to get coupons. The front desk clerk was very irritated that the waiter suggested this and my husband ended up walking all the way back to our 4th floor room (which was some distance) only to find they never provided any coupons. In May we stayed at the JW Desert Ridge in Phoenix and breakfast was also included. There, you simply advise your name and room number and they take care of the rest. Here at the LV location, it's apparently like the food hall at your old college campus. This is not the way most 4/5 star resorts operate and in a hotel like this, the front desk should have been more concerned about the guest rather than their displeasure with a coworker. We chose this hotel partly because of its proximity to Red Rock Canyon - where we like to hike - but also the fact that it's not on the strip and we wanted to relax on the first leg of our trip (we returned to Vegas and stayed at The Palazzo the following week). The other reasons we chose this hotel was because of the size of the rooms in the main building and the pool area - which I still love. I do however believe there were some people at the pool who were not guests at the resort which I never care to see and I wish hotels were more vigilant about that. I just hope that Marriott can take a real hard critical look at this property and bring it back up to JW standards. I would still recommend this hotel to a friend but only if I gave them the entire picture. While we truly enjoyed our time by the pool - even though it should stay open longer in the summer - this place needs to be freshened up.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel I've ever stayed, it was excellent and wonderful”
Reviews.Author: sam8839
Reviews.Content: No complaint at all for everything! Beautiful exterior and interior that really mathes surrounding atmosphere, friendliness of the people, cleaness in the facility, reluxing garden and swimming pools! Good access to Red Lock and Mt Charleston both laid within the reach of less than 1hr drive so worth relaxing in the nature in the day time before heading to the strip in the evening for another enjoyment there. I was really convinced that it was the exact right choice! My wife already started saying "I want to be back there again " immediately upon our return back home in Japan! Worth staying there if you want a real relaxation.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel just made our stay GREAT!”
Reviews.Author: alliebdive
Reviews.Content: We visited Las Vegas for a week and had a marvellous time. We quickly realised that if we hadn't picked to stay at the JW, our experience would not have been nearly so good. The hotel has a real resort feel - it is in a peaceful location in Summerlin, maybe 20 minutes from the Strip. This was really important because in temperatures reaching 108F during the day, the wonderful water gardens, the superb pool and the golf setting was just a world away from the crowded strip. We loved going down there at night and either drove ourselves or used the free hotel shuttle but I wouldn't have wanted to stay down there. It would be great if you were just going for a weekend, or possibly in the winter when it wasn't so hot, but not in August. We spent fabulous days around the pool - it felt like a real holiday - and then lived it up down on the Strip at night. Our room was very spacious - two queen sized beds and an enormous bathroom with large spa bath and huge shower. We had a small balcony overlooking the grounds and we were in the main tower. There is a restaurant in the hotel but most of the dining options are in the casino area. We ate a lunch buffet and a dinner buffet (pretty mediocre to be honest) and had breakfast a couple of times. Wouldn't rave about any of them other than they were cheap. Valet parking was free and very speedy. The pool is beautiful with superb beds and a good little snack bar with very quick pool service. We spent a lot of time out there. The only problem was that there were not a lot of umbrellas which was strange but as the hotel wasn't crowded when we were there it was not an issue. The loungers were very comfortable. We ate out in Vegas a lot and attended shows and generally walked around admiring all the glitz and glamour. Really enjoyed the week and wouldn't hesitate to return. We visited many of the Strip hotels and whilst they were very elaborate and exciting, it would have been like staying in a theme park: so noisy, crowded, tour groups constantly moving through, the noise from the casinos which are in the lobbies. The JW is NOTHING like this and that was a blessing for us. If you want to be in the heart of the action 24 hours a day, it won't suit you. If you want to have the best of both worlds, then it is a fantastic choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great to be so far from the strip! Lovely pool, relaxing stay”
Reviews.Author: TokyogirlManchester
Reviews.Content: If you want to spend all your time at the Strip, then this is probably too far away but if, like us, you only want to see the Strip for a fleeting glance, the JW Marriott is perfectly located (although our taxi driver took over an hour to get us back there as she hadn't a clue where the hotel was and wouldn't believe that we did). The hotel is definitely over-sized and felt very empty in July (presume the recession had bitten) but the room we were allocated was fantastic. Really sumptuous and perfect for a family of 4 sharing two Queen beds. Amazing bathroom - huge - with great shower and bath. We didn't have much of a view but that didn't matter on this occasion. The breakfast was pretty limited and not very exciting although the staff were very attentive and friendly. The revolting casino area was dreadful and in fact that entire part of the hotel, really unattractive.
