However, the hotel's huge swimming pool was our reason for booking because after driving hundreds of miles, we were delighted to relax with the children and enjoy some down time. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to have a lazy couple of days en route to LA or Grand Canyon. There is a reliable shuttle bus to the Strip and there seemed to be a good choice of restaurants if you wanted to eat at the hotel rather than head in to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Love Marriott..Hated this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: DaphneBernstein
Reviews.Content: I am a faithful Marriott customer, gold level elite member, and ALWAYS stay at a Marriott property when traveling for business or for pleasure. I've stayed at JW Marriott properties before, including the Star Pass Resort in Tucson (my very favorite resort) and the JW in Washington DC, and have always had very positive experiences. With this visit, we were so dissatisfied, that we left the property ten minutes after checking in. The first impression was (and I KNOW this is a little thing) that the table sitting against the wall just inside the front doors was pushed to the side so that it was not centered under the mirror above it. Most people would not notice this, and most people who would notice it, would not care, but it was a sloppy first impression to me and not in line with what I have come to expect with Marriott. The hand railings and the interior doors were in need of paint, and again just surprising to see in a JW Resort. Our room was small and did not have the big nice bathroom that you see pictured on the internet. The room did have a very small balcony, which overlooked the main street. I noticed that the room charge listed on our room key holder was more than what the reservationist had told me and more than what was listed online, so I tried to call the front desk. Nobody answered the first two times I tried to call, and finally someone picked up the phone after many rings during my third attempt. They verified that my room was going to be at a higher rate and I explained that I was not impressed with my room or with the service so far and decided to check out. When I went to the front desk, the gentleman at the front desk told me that it was our fault that we got that room because we "insisted on checking in before a nicer room was available." (I am NOT kidding.) We stayed at a very nice suite at the Venetian - the room was much bigger, the bathroom was much nicer, the bed was incredible, there were three TVs and curtains that closed with the touch of the remote. We were very pleased with our decision to leave the JW. The hotel would be nice for an older couple (we are in our 40's) who wants to play golf and who does not like Vegas. If you want more of what Vegas has to offer - luxury hotels, action, lights, night life, great pools, spectacular spas, etc - the luxury hotels on the Strip have so much more to offer. The hotel just didn't have the crispnesss that you would expect to see, and seemed that it needed some repair. I found the service at the front desk to be horrible. If you stay, I would suggest staying in the main hotel rather than the tower in the back, which is where they tried to place us.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: quik
Reviews.Content: This is our 3rd time staying here on the way to/from our home and California. The rooms are beautiful and big. It even has a walk-in closet. The bathroom is amazing! We were told that the pool closed at 8:00 pm on a Saturday night. Way too early!!! We checked-in around 4:00 and our family quickly went out to the pool. We enjoyed about 5 minutes and then within the next few minutes there were way over 100 cheerleaders in the pool. We had to leave because it was taken over by screaming girls. We were extremely surprised and disappointed that a JW Marriot would allow groups of kids to stay in this hotel. They must be desperate for business in the hot summer months. Also, when we made the reservation we asked for a roll-away. When we checked in we were told that there weren't any available and we could be put on a waiting list. We called back later and still no rollaway. After a third call suddenly they found one. We ate at the Rampart Buffet ($13/ person) and it was AWFUL! Even our teenagers didn't want to eat anything.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: nighteyesnoire
Reviews.Content: If you don't mind being 15 min. off the Strip, this place, tucked away in northwest Las Vegas, is wonderful, makes you feel like you're not even in Las Vegas! Stayed with softball team. When I heard "Marriott", I expected a very basic hotel. "JW Marriott" must be the upscale tier of Marriott properties. As we drove in, the 2 towers looked lovely & fancy. Free valet parking for guests! (excluding valet tip). I recommend this because the hotel grounds are huge & regular guest parking is a bit of a walk from the lobby. Our room had 2 queens & was very spacious. Nice-sized walk-in closet. Best thing: the bathroom! Granite vanity with 2 sinks, big spa tub, separate shower & separate toilet. Plenty of room for 2 or more to get ready in. Brightly lit. One bad thing about the room: Instead of having a small fridge, they have what they call a tiny "cooler", which is not cold; you can't store food in it overnight. I hope this isn't a trend ... sports teams need a cold fridge! Beds were amazingly comfy. Plenty of comfy pillows. Free wireless Internet. Inside, between the 2 towers, were several restaurants, Starbucks, casino, gym, spa. There's 1 24-hour cafe. Food is decent, but service is very slow. Restaurants are Italian, Japanese, Mexican, etc. Japanese one was unimpressive & over-priced. Gym & spa charge expensive fee per use. Staff was friendly & helpful. One bad thing: there are people at the front desk in the main (Spa) tower, but not in the 2nd tower. You can't go to anyone to ask for help, you have to call the main tower. Our team rate was $129 per night. I would definitely stay again! It felt like a luxury hotel. You felt like you were away!

Reviews.Title: “jw was great”
Reviews.Author: Carole1
Reviews.Content: we spent 4 days at the jw marriott in las vegas. the hotel room was really great, big, and the bathroom was all you would want and more. we did make what i consider a find as far as a place to eat. there is an irish pubb at the jw named wooloughan's that has wonderful comfort food at reasonable prices. we had a waitress named dorie who made us feel so much at home that we came back again and again. we were given an extended balcony room, which i would recommend. i think most rooms did not have a balcony, but french doors that opened to a railing. the pool was nice, but i did hear someone ask another person where she lived, and she said right down the road and would be back with her kids the next day. i guess locals can come and use pool when ever they want. other than that, would recommend hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: nikitajain29
Reviews.Content: Being one of the best cities in the US, i especially chose to stay in the best hotel !! It was a marvelous experience, a breath taking one. The rooms were spacious and well lit. the room overlooked the city and by night it looked gorgeous. the staff was always smiling and this made my stay even more memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Everything was Great”
Reviews.Author: Retailwonderer
Reviews.Content: Huge rooms, big shower, whirlpool tub, quiet location, excellent service. I liked being away from the Strip, but still not too far from the airport. All staff members were friendly and attentive, but not intrusive. Great restaurants on site; lots of choices. Highly satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location If You Want To Stay Off The Strip”
Reviews.Author: Ainslie45
Reviews.Content: Nice resort hotel about 25 minutes from the Vegas strip. Very comfortable rooms. Ours had a patio with two Chase lounge chairs. The property is huge and is for the most part self contained as many Vegas properties are. Great golf close by. I though the food service was very good with a nice variety of restaurants to choose from. This is not your serious gamblers destination.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect place to escape the Strip”
Reviews.Author: kev67
Reviews.Content: We figured that after a few days along the Strip we would want a break and we were right! The Marriott was the perfect place to stay! Pros: -incredibly clean -very spacious rooms -the staff helped us with everything we needed -the pool area is perfect with lots of available chairs no matter what time you show up, great food and drink service and comfortable loungers -lots of great food options - 2 people can enjoy the buffet for $20, Ceres has a three course options for $20 and a few other reasonable restaurants on site -only a $40 cab ride from the strip or airport and they have a free shuttle to the strip several times a day Cons -the pool closes early (but that seems normal for Vegas) -the casino is okay, lots of tables and slot machines available but it's pretty smoky and there is not alot of selection when it comes to slots Definitely a good value and a great way to finish off our trip!

Reviews.Title: “Great pool, nice off-strip location, kid friendly”
Reviews.Author: UtahMikester
Reviews.Content: The nice thing about this hotel is you don't have to feel like you are staying in a casino. The gaming area is attached to the hotel, but you don't have to walk through it each time you exit you room. A great place for kids with a huge pool, nice lawns and a decent breakfast. A quick drive to the stip and great golf courses and restaurants nearby. Also, don't miss the Red Rock Canyon park -- a 10 minute drive from the hotel gets you to fantastic hikes and intersting desert scenery.

Reviews.Title: “The one thing that could have made my stay at the JW Las Vegas perfect is...”
Reviews.Author: Spillthemoment
Reviews.Content: its location! Upon arriving at the hotel, you are greeted by complimentary valet service. At the front desk, at check-in, you are treated like a VIP (the complimentary bottled water is a very nice touch.) Our room was immaculate, as well. (and the bathroom, I felt like we were in a luxury suite!!) Very luxurious, quiet, and comfortable. We ordered room service a few times, and it always came on time and the food was awesome! So what's wrong with this hotel?? Its location about 15 minutes away from the strip (by highway) is a BIG drawback. We were in Las Vegas for a concert at the Hard Rock Hotel and had we realized how far of a drive it would be, we would probably have preferred to stay at the Strip instead. Now, I realize that the location of the hotel is something that cannot be changed, so this is the advice that I would offer. IF you are looking for a one night stay in Las Vegas, will not be visiting the strip, and plan on staying inside the hotel the entire time, then this is your place. There is virtually NO nightlife in the surrounding area as it is located in your typical suburban district. If you are planning on visiting the strip, do yourself a favor, stay on the strip!! I'd definitely stay here again though, but only if on a quick one night stay in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, could be tidier”
Reviews.Author: ValleyMom
Reviews.Content: I chose to stay at this property for an overnight Valentine's getaway. I am very familiar with it , and received a terrific "locals' rate" when I booked. We checked in late in the evening; still the front desk staff was very friendly and helpful. Even a random bellhop we encountered in the elevator told us to have a nice visit. We were very impressed with the room at first glance: It was incredibly spacious, on the sixth (top) floor with a small balcony overlooking, well, essentially nothing, but it was a nice amenity anyway. A small mirrored bar area with a coffee maker was also featured, as was a walk-in closet with a wall safe. The bathroom is gigantic with a "rain head" shower (as well as a regular shower head) featuring a tiled seating area, a large jacuzzi tub, a speaker in the ceiling that allows you to hear programming from the TV in the guest room, plenty of lighting, a lighted makeup mirror, a laundry basket for towels, and an old-school telephone in the water closet. The negatives: Things could have been a bit cleaner. The vent in the water closet was visibly clogged with dust. One of the two faucets at the sink had a hole in it which shot water toward the bathroom mirror and all over the counter when it was turned on. The "rain head" shower head -- even when not being used -- dripped a good amount of water on you whenever the regular shower head was turned on -- rather annoying. There was visible dirt and a couple of black hairs in the bathtub, as well as a large spot of dried urine on the floor in front of the toilet. The bottle of hand lotion provided was only half full, indicating that it had not been switched out following the previous guest. There were not nearly enough towels in the bathroom (only two of each size and a bathmat). And while the bed itself was comfy, the small pillows were not and ruined what might otherwise have been a terrific sleep. The TV is a little outdated and the remote difficult to maneuver in a darkened room. Also, the ceiling fan was very noisy -- so much so we could not turn it on when we went to bed for fear it would keep us up all night. Had drinks and dessert in the Irish pub downstairs -- both were terrific. The house band, The Wild Celts, were performing and made things a lot of fun. Overall, a great stay. Just a few minor quibbles. But we are looking forward to returning for another visit in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Well worth staying.”
Reviews.Author: chilligal
Reviews.Content: We made our first trip to Vegas for my husband to attend a conference at the Marriott. This is a very nice hotel - beautiful large bathroom and comfy bed. They could update the TVs and toiletries, but we got a great rate due to business travel. The Irish pub in the hotel has a wonderful happy hour on weekdays, and the appetizers are terrific. If you have a car or are willing to taxi, Lindo Michoacan is delicious Mexican not 6 miles away. This hotel is in Summerlin, quite a distance from the strip. They do provide a shuttle to Fashion Show Mall, and you can then walk, or take a bus up and down the strip ($7 for 24 hours).

Reviews.Title: “I Love the JW”
Reviews.Author: DSTDiva
Reviews.Content: When I travel to Vegas I usually stay here. As a matter of fact, whenever I take someone there for the first time...they always go back!!! I was a guest most recently for NYE and once again it was a wonderful stay. The rooms are huge, the hotel always honors my requests and it keeps me coming back. It is off strip and is very quiet. This is the type of property that I prefer. I think that it is very soothing to return to my quiet room after a day on the noisy strip. I will be returning this June to have a spa weekend with some girlfriends. If there is any complaint about the property I would say that it is the $25 fee to use the spa fitness center. Other than that I have none.

Reviews.Title: “Resort and Golf”
Reviews.Author: JohnBR
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the JW Marriott on a buisness/retreat visit. I was concerned that the hotel wouldn't work for casual business meetings but we had no problems. Big, well layed out rooms, excellent but not over the top restaurant, and great golf. This place is just about perfect for business/golf outings. I can't comment on the spa but other people thought it was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Nicer than Strip Hotels but too far from Las Vegas Blvd”
Reviews.Author: AmberNicole625
Reviews.Content: While visiting family in Las Vegas, my boyfriend decided that we would try something a little further than the strip as opposed to other years where we usually stay at Bellagio, Venetian, MGM. Our room was defintely more aesthetically pleasing and more elegant than our relatives rooms at the Bellagio and New York-New York. The bathroom was HUGE with a jacuzzi tub, amazing shower and the bed was soooooo comfortable! The room also was very nicely decorated(which may or may not affect others when choosing a resort). We also opted for prepaying Breakfast Buffet for 2 every morning and it was definitely worth it! Although breakfast buffet closes as 11am(which is hard to make if you party all night) the food is very good and the prepay price is way cheaper than it would be paying at the time of order! HERE ARE MY COMPLAINTS: All travel websites state that High-Speed Internet Access is Free and it is not. It is $9.99/day. They pitch you at the front desk to purchase a "Resort Fee Package" which includes 1 bucket of golf balls per day, Internet , and one pass/person to the fitness center and spa; all for $25/day. Also, if you plan on spending time on the strip and getting home late this hotel is about 12 miles driving distance from the strip and traffic from the hotel to the strip is horrendous! It states that the hotel is only 5 miles from the strip which may be true distance wise but driving there is 12.2 miles on the freeway and you're stuck in traffic most of the time(aside from the hours of 12pm and 7am). All in all it is a nice hotel but next year we will be staying on the strip so it is more convenient. If you aren't planning on visiting the strip very often then I would definitely recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Pampered for Pennies”
Reviews.Author: jek134
Reviews.Content: I LOVED my stay at the Las Vegas JW!!! I could not believe how big the standard room was. There was so much room I almost felt like they wasted space - but I'm not complaining. The bathroom was so luxurious. We used the whirlpool tub every day we were there. PROS: - Huge room - Awesome shower and whirlpool tub - Very classy common areas and beautiful landscape - Nice view of the mountains - Restaurant Row (connected to the resort) had a variety of different types of food - American cafe, Starbucks, Japanese like Benihana, buffet, Irish pub, Italian, as well as the hotel's standard restaurant Ceres - we ate at the Promenade Cafe which had the standard coffee shop type of menu and all three times we went the food was superb. We also ate at the Japanese restaurant and it was good. Each morning we had breakfast at the Ceres restaurant. The buffet was standard. I've had better. We decided to order off the menu for breakfast and both dishes were wonderful. - Nice sized casino - We're not gamblers so I didn't choose this hotel for the casino scene, but it was a nice size. I actually won $50 at blackjack. It was nice to see $5 tables on a weekend night. In the past, the other hotels on the strip only seemed to offer $25 minimum tables. - The pool was closed for the season, but I would definitely come back to try out the pool. - Clean and classy - Overall good service from everyone we met CONS: I can't really think of any cons except that maybe the towels and pillows didn't smell fresh, but I understand some people don't like a scent in their pillows. Not a big deal at all and not a real complaint. We weren't interested in going to the Strip, but it didn't seem that far to me, especially if you have your own car. I thought the location was perfect. Overall, a wonderful stay and we will be going back soon!

Reviews.Title: “Loved JW”
Reviews.Author: MELfromOZ
Reviews.Content: We stayed at JW Marriott for 3 nights while in Vegas and loved every minute of our stay. While the hotel was off strip they had shuttles available although we used our hire car. The first thing we noticed about the hotel was the huge, beautiful rooms. We got a one bedroom suite that had a lounge, dining, kithcenette, large main bedroom with spa ensuite as well as a powder room. The second thing we noticed was the fantastic service. The girl at reception called our room when we arrived to make sure we found it o.k., then called again to make sure we got our two rollaway beds. We got room service twice after two big days and there were no complaints there. The casino was good but hubby was disappointed that they didn't have Texas Hold'em Poker. The kids absolutely loved the pool and waterfall. The hotel was close (about 20 minute drive) to the strip, outlet stores and Boulder City airport for our Grand Canyon helicopter flight. Beautiful hotel with fabulous service and no more expensive than onstrip hotels. Would definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “it was really great”
Reviews.Author: OntarioJamie
Reviews.Content: this isa very nice well kept hotel the grounds and gardens are outstanding we really enjoyed our stay there . if you are looking for all the excitement of the strip, this is not the hotel for you . it is about a $50.00 cab ride into the strip .

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay for Business Trip”
Reviews.Author: BILLJ_GA
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the hotel in the Palm Tower to 2 nights. I did not smell cigarette smoke anywhere in Palm Tower, but the Casino was a little smoky. I actually enjoyed the casino because I am not much of a gambler and the people working the tables were more than happy to guide me along and teach me some things. Also the minimum bets are lower than you find on the strip. The room was nice, but the TV was old. I am surprised they have not upgraded them yet. Also as a FYI, the best way to get from the airport to the JW Marriott is to take a hired car from the airport. It was $45 when I was there. People who took cabs spent anywhere from $50 to $65. The only reason I stayed here was because it was a business trip. If I was on a personal vacation, I would stay somewhere on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “If this is Marriott's best - keep looking”
Reviews.Author: MattNY
Reviews.Content: This is the place to skip when going to Vegas. They should rip the "JW" off the building as this place is barely a Marriott in terms of quality. I'll start with the grounds - they happen to be nice. And the staff was very friendly. The rooms were a contrast in good and bad. I'll start with the good: -Great bathrooms, including jacuzzi tub and dual sinks. -Comfortable beds. -Breakfast buffet at Ceres - not a huge selection, but high quality. Now the bad: -The dirty, used bathrobe hanging in my room when I arrived (wonder what else wasn't cleaned?). -If you ask for a foam pillow, you'll be sleeping on a lumpy log. -The tv's suck. They're the old, monstrous 32" tube tv's (haven't heard of flat panels I suppose) and depending on the station, you may very well get humming sounds and ghosted images. This was a problem mostly with the broadcast networks. The signal's been split way too many times. -The work area is atrocious for a conference hotel. I had to crawl under the old desk to plug in my laptop. The desk and chair were not ergodynamic and actually incredibly uncomfortable to work at for any stretch. -The "free" gym may have been the worst hotel gym I have ever seen. I walked in an walked right out again. The spa gym, which is an astounding $25/day to use, was much nicer, but with low-end cardio machines and deflated workout balls (they couldn't find the pump). The individual tv's had the same problems with many of the broadcast networks. -The casino was terrible. At all hours of the day, this disgustingly smoky room was filled with old people who parked their walkers next to the slots and puffed away while gambling the social security check. It really looked like death's waiting room. Now, when I spoke to the front desk, they were very nice (really, all the staff was great) they comped the gym for me and gave me some points for my troubles, but this is one property I won't be visiting again. Overall, this place is to be skipped since there are so many other, and much better, options in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: CanaryHucks
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Marriott during a recent trip to Vegas . We wanted to stay off the strip for a change but also play some golf and the location was ideal. The hotel and casino are close to each other but virtually separate and it is possible to use most of the facilities without going through the casino unlike most other hotels in Vegas. The pool area is excellent and Ceres Resaurant ok. Main downside is transport intop Vegas if you don't want to drive - it is quite a way out and a taxi fare is quite pricey. There is a shuttle bus however which goes at fixed times and takes you into the Strip for nothing . Several golf courses nearby - quite expensive by UK standards - we played at Badlands.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, low-key, non-glitzy hotel”
Reviews.Author: RELJD
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here for a rock climbing vacation in October. The hotel is an easy (10 minute) drive from Red Rock Canyon. We had originally wanted to stay at the Red Rock Resort ("RRR"), but it was booked up for some of our days. Last time we were here, we stayed at the RRR, which was fabulous. The Marriott is very pleasant, in a low-key way, but it is definitely not as posh and glitzy as RRR. If you want to stay someplace more "Vegas" - beautiful people, sumptuous interior, clubs, glitzy casino, etc., stay at RRR. The Marriott had great service, a very low key environment (didn't feel underdressed walking around in shorts), and good food at the restaurants. It is undoubtably a comfortable hotel...just not glamourous. I had a spa treatment at the Marriott's spa, which was great. The spa, like the rest of the hotel, is very nice and relaxing...but not exactly "sumptuous" or "glamourous" like RRR. The casino at the Marriott was, frankly, depressing. Like visiting a nursing home. I did not play anything in the casino, but had to walk through it to get from one side of the hotel to the other. It is smoky, dull, and I didn't see anyone under the age of (it appeared) 75 in there. Worse of all, no one was smiling....they seemed catatonic. Then again, if you are going to gamble, you'll be staying in downtown Vegas anyway. I originally had the room reserved for $250 a night, but called back a few days before we arrived and got a deal of $220 a night plus breakfast. The breakfast buffet was very good, and would have costs $30 for the two of us had it not been included. In short, I would recommend the Marriott as a nice place to stay, especially for golfers or for those wanting to explore Red Rock Canyon...but it is not as glamourous or post as the Red Rock Resort.

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your money!”
Reviews.Author: ginarug
Reviews.Content: I attended a pharmaceutical investigators meeting this past weekend (October 2008) at the JW Marriott Resort and Spa . SOME COMMENTS: * Entire resort smelled of smoke. * Do Not stay if you have allergies. Smoke was enough to make you sick. * In order to use the spa, you must enter into the smoke infested Casino. * All floors smelled of smoke. * VERY FAR from the Las Vegas Strip. Average cost was $60.00. * Shuttle to the Las Vegas STrip ended at 11:30 p.m. * Shuttle Rider just dropped guest off with no information. Ended up on the "Ghetto" end of the Strip. * Outside jacuzzi was often closed due to multiple outdoor weddings. * Spa OVER PRICED.

Reviews.Title: “just okay”
Reviews.Author: BrowninLA
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night and found the experience to be just okay. The hotel was horribly understaffed; it took forever to get the front desk to answer the phone, 10 minutes for the valet to retrieve the car , and there was absolutely no one to be found by the pool for help with towels. The hotel has good bones that speak to the resort it was before it became part of Marriott. My room was very large and comfortable, but the juxtaposition between the original details (crown moulding and the ceiling fan) and the new details (hideous beige vinyl wallpaper) tells me that despite the lovely surroundings, it is still a Marriott. Also, the casino is quite tired.

Reviews.Title: “Our new Las Vegas Destination”
Reviews.Author: Gord1066
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Marriott for two nights in late September. Whoever designed the rooms at this hotel knew what travelers today want most – plenty of space. As other reviewers have noted, the bedrooms and bathrooms here are extremely spacious and we loved it. We didn’t want the hustle and bustle of the Strip and enjoyed the solitude afforded by the Marriott. Our one visit to the Strip was only a 15-20 minute drive however. We didn’t have time to take advantage of the many facilities here but perhaps will do so on our next visit because we promised ourselves we would be back. In fact, I believe we have found our permanent Las Vegas retreat !

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Room, Gross Casino”
Reviews.Author: MarisaOC
Reviews.Content: Hubby & I just got back from a night at the JW Marriott. We booked it through Expedia for a decent rate. The hotel itself is large, and is connected to a casino. We LOVED the room, especially the bathroom; both were suprisingly large, and the bathroom was fabulous - giant jacuzzi tub (big enough for two!) and shower. (The room and bathroom could've both benefited by flat screen TVs, though.) The hotel's grounds were nice, but not spectacular. The casino connected to the hotel was an obvious favorite of the "retired" crowd, and completely reeked of cigarette smoke (worse than any casino we visited during the weekend). The drive back and forth to the Strip got old after the third time, so if you're wanting to be a part of the action on the Strip, this might not be the place for you. Nonetheless, a nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Heaven at the JW Marriott”
Reviews.Author: alpetor
Reviews.Content: This is a top-notch hotel off the Strip, yet within easy reach of the Strip and surrounding businesses. Although I rated this an "excellent" stay, I do have some quibbles. Pulling up to the hotel, we learned from a bellman that we had to backtrack to another building for check-in. No big deal, but maybe this could have been handled by the concierge on her phone. Kudos to the bellhop team - those folks were great. Our room was really beautiful, with a lovely view of the eastern horizon. I had no problem with the lack of a flat-screen TV (perhaps there was one?) as these are hugely "anti-green" devices and still only show you the same shows you'd get on any other TV. Housekeeping was outstanding, making no fuss about our bikes being in room. The bathroom was beautiful and beautifully kept. The beds were dressed with soft linens and a plush mattress top. We slept very well! One problem was the noise of the air conditioner. We called for help with this, but the handyman who arrived was only able to tell us how to use it, not how to fix it (it was quite loud). We solved the problem by just leaving it off, which is probably not an option for guests during the summer months. We ate at Shizen - wow! So yummy! We also ate at an in-hotel cafe, which was good food-wise, but bad cigarette-smoke-from-the-casino-wise. We ate at Ceres, and the food was excellent both times, and at brunch, creative while still offering the old standbys. Service was quite good. I agree with another reviewer who found the lack of Wi-Fi annoying. With this quality of hotel and the availability of this service at other accommodations, JW should just make it happen. A boon to all and a plus for visitors - and for the hotel. One caveat: you are about a half hour from the Strip. But that's the beauty of this place.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Room”
Reviews.Author: lizattiledepot
Reviews.Content: When we arrived I was supprised to find that the hotel was much bigger than it seemed on the website. We had chosen to stay there for our first few days in Vegas, away from the Strip. However it was a little more like the strip hotels than I had imagined - the hotel is set around a large casino. Having said that the room was amazing and the bathroom was bigger than my bedroom at home!

Reviews.Title: “Liked it, but didnt love it”
Reviews.Author: goldendeal
Reviews.Content: This hotel has glowing reviews, and for the most part well deserved. I had a recent 4 night stay here and although I liked it, I didn’t love it. There are several reasons this hotel falls short. I made reservations through a travel agent well in advance, to celebrate a very special anniversary Upon check in, we were rushed off to a no view room, right next the elevators. So if you check into this hotel make sure you don’t receive a room near the elevators or you will hear a rumbling noise all night long. Another problem was the Spa. Do not pay extra to use the spa pools. This is a 25.00 charge. They claim in the brochure that “there are six invigorating chambers of the outdoor Hydro-circuit pool" Ummm well, only two were working. They need matience badly at the spa pool area. Things looked worn down and in need of repair. There is no pool service at the Spa pools, which is not too good as if you wanted a drink you had to wander into the locker rooms The main pool was large and seemed to have many people enjoying themselves but a couple times time I attempted to relax by the pool it was close do to "special events” One time was a wedding, not sure about the other time, but was closed due to a special occasion, which left the majority of the guest without a pool area to enjoy. The Irish pub was nice and had wonderful fish and chips. Shizen the Japanese Steak House and Sushi Bar was out of this world, excellent service and food. Don’t miss this. Breakfast buffet at Ceres in the hotel was very good, they have a nice omelet station, try the made to order waffles, excellent!! For some reason the hotel restaurants had a hard time accepting Marriott gift cards we received as gifts for our anniversary. They would say they cant accept since they are not owned by Marriott,,,but the front desk told another story and said they are accepted everywhere on the Marriott property,,,bottom line,,,BIG HASSLE...Marriott needs to get their stories straight and on the same page. Maid service was spotty at best, first two nights received room cleaning, last two nights, nothing, and they didn’t show up. I happened to catch a maid in the hallway and asked why my room wasn’t cleaned, and I got a "no speak English" response....ok whatever, moving on… They need to update the TV's...most hotels of this star rating has flat screens by now. The bed and the sheets were very comfortable. I happened to look at when the mattress was purchased and it was back in 1999, so maybe a refurbish would be a good idea sometime in the near future. At check out I brought up the problem of mold that was in our shower, they seemed surprised, not sure if they were surprised I brought it up, or it had mold. They made a note of it and said would have it checked out. As I said, this was our anniverery and several other reviews said they were sent, a bottle of champaign, strawberries and chocolates to their room..., no such luck here. Although my travel agent made sure to let the hotel know about the special anniversary celebration the hotel they seemed to just ignore it. The valet service was great; the guys very fast, helpful and friendly. The hotel seemed to do the bulk of their business with convention guests, and this is who they prefer to cater to, very little leisure guests and I can tell the business guest are number one here and treated so, vacationers are a after thought. As I said, I did like the hotel, but it fell short of my expectations.

Reviews.Title: “WOO HOO JW Marriott Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: cindeeandjim
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visit Las Vegas a few times per year. We own a timeshare on the strip (Marriott Grand Chateau). We planned this trip with our daughter and her boyfriend and traded another timeshare and were going to stay in a two bedroom off strip. Daughter and BF broke-up. I wasn't interested in staying off strip, so we traded again but had no where to stay our first night. We decided on the JW. We have stayed here for a week a few years prior and I previously ranked this as favorite hotel ever. Anyway... We arrive at 10 am. Visit with parents. Arrive at JW at 2 with a 4 check-in. We are told we are upgraded to a suite--- did I mention I paid with Marriott points and hotels basically get nothing for this...? Anyway, they also give us free breakfast at Ceres, which is wonderful -- BTW... and a pass to the spa, which is my fav for free--- SCORE!!!! I love the cold plunge, hot plunge, float pool, waterfall showers, outdoor private pool with six stations. So, we go to the fourth floor and are in 4100 --- walk out of elevator and dead in front of us is double doors --- 4100 suite---- sweet. We walk in and there is a foyer, a 1/2 bath, a mini kitchen, a huge dining and living area. A bedroom that could fit three king beds, a bathroom with watercloset with bidet, and toilet, lovely bath, and rain shower. Can you tell I am HAPPY!?! I was princess for a night. Thanks to Marriott and especially th JW for taking good care of your Platinum members.

Reviews.Title: “Feels like a large conference hotel”
Reviews.Author: TAmembers
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on our last night of tour of Arizona and booked due to reviews and fact it was off strip. It was fine but a bit disappointing after staying at MGM Signature at beginning of tour. Our room was fantastic, large and high spec but the air con was warm and when we complained to reception, maintenance rung and told us that whatever temp we set it to it went off when noone was in room (not sure what happens at night) and it was limited to not go below a certain temp, certainly not as low as we had set it to..they were able to override this and from then on we had no complaints. Window overlooked building site next door. Hotel was very very big and felt like a big conference hotel. We didnt like the look of the resturants and drove into Romano's Macaroni Grill off the strip which as usual was brilliant. Went in the pool which was fine although at the end of the day there was alot of rubbish and towels around the sunbeds such as tissues and cups which staff could have cleared away. Breakfast was inc and was very very good. Wouldn't stay again and would recommend MGM Signature for location, luxury, staff and value.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a Business Conference”
Reviews.Author: Brenda C
Reviews.Content: I recently planned and held a business conference at this resort. The staff was phenomenal. Just excellent. Very well organized, helpful and on-top of all details. My only comment might be that they need to consider a way to offer wireless internet in the meeting area for attendees. Otherwise, the space, the AV, the food, EVERYTHING was top notch. I would HIGHLY recommend this property and staff for others planning a large or small conference.

Reviews.Title: “Love this resort”
Reviews.Author: JudyAC
Reviews.Content: My husband I and I stayed at the JW Marriott off the strip in LasVegas for 4 nights over a holiday weekend. We loved it and would recommend it. It reminded us of a resort in Mexico. Here's our review: - Guest room – Great! Really large! We were in the Palm tower – must be the convention tower, but we saw no one around until the night before we left. We did not mind being a walk from the main building. - First floor patio - Relatively private (surrounding foliage) with lounge chairs, eating table and chairs. Much nicer than a room with a “balcony”. - Staff - Courteous staff. Average on a scale 1-10 (10 being highest) – we would give them an 8. Some were very nice, most were nice. Housekeeper Radmilla, very nice. Front bell staff – very nice. But - Crabby bartenders in the Irish pub! - Casino – nice size (didn’t win, but had fun!) - Spa - Wonderful! The best experience I have ever had! Ask for Brian (Cucumber/Melon body scrub). - Healthclub – Big, fancy healthclub in the main tower free on the days you “spa”. $25 on the days you don’t. Other option, go to the Palm tower to a small workout room for free. (we did one day of each) No real walking trails. - Pool – very nice, not crowded at all when we were there - Amenities – we asked for a refrigerator in our room so we could keep water, snacks. There is a VONS grocery store nearby. - Distance from the strip – about 20 minutes. Worked for us – we did a lot of other sightseeing. - Onsite restaurants – Buffet – okay. Look for coupons. Café – okay. Use your casino points there to get a discount. Starbucks – good for coffee every morning. What we did (beside the strip) - Liberace museum – Very kitschy, fun! Gotta see it! - Atomic Testing museum – kind of depressing, but complete historical info - Ethel M chocolates – worth it for the free samples! Yum. - Freemont street – make sure you see the light show at night - Red Rock – only 20 minutes from hotel - Red Rock casino – check it out. Pretty slick Where we ate - Nora’s wine bar – YUM! Near the hotel, about $20 ala carte dinners. The Farro e Cinghiale – (Braised wild boar) is wonderful! (1031 S Rampart Blvd) - Hennessey’s - burgers and fries (Freemont Street) - Ricardo’s - a local favorite for Mexican food (4930 W Flamingo Rd)

Reviews.Title: “Nicest Hotel I have Ever Stayed At!”
Reviews.Author: CarnerosGrape
Reviews.Content: I am a Marriott employee, so I have had to luxury to travel to amazing destinations at a discounted rate. For the last two years I have created a grading system based upon the JW Marriott, Renaissance and Marriott's. Hands down, this is the nicest hotel that I have ever stayed at! It was truly amazing! The rooms were incredible with the jacuzzi style tubs, rain fall shower head, ceiling fan, french doors and private patio.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: TvTeacher50
Reviews.Content: Loved the room, shower, pool and the staff. Everything about this hotel is first class. WE recommend Rosemarys Restaurant in summerlin for great food, with quality that will rival spots on the strip. Stay here and just go into the strip off and on. Here you can get some r and r and some much welcome peace and ambience. Loved it!! Dont miss Cirque's Mystere and skip the trip to grand canyon west. TOO much nickel and diming and the views are not nearly as good as the north rim which requires an overnight. DO GO to the nine mile loop at nearby RED ROCK Canyon. Georgeous!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice!”
Reviews.Author: professor01
Reviews.Content: Won an auction at SkyAuction.com and so got a preferred/reduced rate. This was the second time we've stayed there. First time was two years before. Just as good as the first time! Pretty laid back and much less crowded, esp. as compared to strip hotels. You really need a car as the complimentary van to the strip is limited by capacity and times. It's only 9-10 miles but takes 20-30 minutes, depending on where you're going on the strip and the time of day. The hotel is clean (we look under the mattress) with good service. There are 4-5 restaurants, including a Vegas-style buffet that's OK but not great (desserts need help). Casino is nice but lavish. All in all, it's a good, relaxing hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to relax”
Reviews.Author: holly_catBelgium
Reviews.Content: We stayed here after a long flight from Europe. It is a very nice hotel with nice rooms. Check-in went fast. The pool is nice and big and there was even a movie showing that evening at the pool. If you need a nice place to stay in Vegas after a long flight without the hectic stuff of the strip. Go for it!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: MONTES
Reviews.Content: Very large rooms with excellent tub and separate shower (rain). The breakfast buffet for about 13 a person is really great. The swimming pool with a waterfall is nice. My wife can't stop complementing the Spa, she says it's great! The only drawback is the fact that you have to go through the middle of the Casino to get to some restaurants and or shops, other than that it's good.

Reviews.Title: “Best Vacation Experience Ever”
Reviews.Author: xtina56
Reviews.Content: Our 3-day, 2-night stay at this resort was absolutely over the top. Everything was perfect, and I never say that. The staff was incredibly kind and accommodating; our 2-bedroom suite was beautifully appointed, elegant and impeccably clean. Every staff member from the front desk to the bellmen to the concierge to the valet were warm and welcoming. The poolside wait staff remembered our food and drink orders and even the names and interests of our children. On our last night there, my husband hurt his back and required a chiropractic visit. The concierge directed my husband towards a competent, local chiropractor and the manager allowed us to remain in the hotel beyond check-out time the following day to ensure my husband was able to travel. I always thought Bellagio or Mandalay Bay were the way to go when in Vegas, but I don't think we'll ever settle for the strip again. If you're looking for a true vacation in a remarkably beautiful setting, this is the place. We can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Definitely a hotel worth the stay”
Reviews.Author: Chambord
Reviews.Content: Resort is written all over this hotel. What a gem in the Vegas area! The layout and landscaping gave the impression that this hotel could have been in Hawaii or Florida or Palm Desert. Many amenities on location and excellent staff to answer questions and attend to your needs. We would absolutely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Always a great Stay”
Reviews.Author: jlutzky
Reviews.Content: This is about the 7th time I've stayed at this property and it's always great. The rooms are large and comfortable and the staff is always helpful. There were three of us checking in at the same time who were together and originally we were in two different towers but the desk clerk was able to juggle us around and get us in the same tower. That's not always a big deal, but at this hotel it is since it's a long walk across two corridors and through the casino to get between towers. During the day we rented a cabana and it was well worth the money. We got one of the large ones and it came with three tables and chairgs, and five lounges outside the cabana in an area that was private from the rest of the pool. Also the misters were a big plus in the 100 degree weather. The one negative for the hotel is that the casino is kind of lacking compared to the strip and even comparing it to the Red Rock. The good news is that the Red Rock is only about a 10 minute drive away, and you can get to the strip in about 20 minutes so if you want to be away from the craziness of the strip during the day this is a good option. The restaurant choices are fairly limited. There's a Japanese restaurant with Sushi that's pretty good, the standard Vegas coffee shop and one nicer restaurant called Ceres that has a pretty good breakfast buffet. If you want something nicer you'll have to drive. All in all, it's a great option for Vegas depending on your needs.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel / You won't regret it”
Reviews.Author: GMONI
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 days/3 nights at the J.W Marriot and was definitely impressed. I have never written a review before but I thought I had to give this hotel one. I initially booked the hotel to get away from the crowds along the strip. It was the best decision I made. We also attended my kids AAU Basketball tournament at the Cashman Center which was only 10 mins away. The strip was only 10min to 15 min away. It is conveniently located. The hotel was beautiful, not to mention the hotel grounds. The breakfast at the Ceres Restarant was great. I highly recommend it. I did not care for the lunch buffet at the Rampart Buffet Restaurant. Swimming pool was beautiful. It wasn't crowded at all. The kids loved it. I plan on coming back to this hotel at my kids next basketball tournament. Stay at the J.W. Marriot. You won't regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Luxury Resort”
Reviews.Author: Ta10p
Reviews.Content: Incredible hotel! As all Marriotts(I think) it is non-smoking except in designated areas. We stayed for 5days/4 nights. You have to go at leat once just to check out the unbelievable marble bathroms. An oasis of calm and luxury in the desert. Only about 20-25 minutes to the strip this is the perfect resort to go to if you want a beautiful retreat not too far from all the action. The free shuttle service is friendly and the drivers had plentyof tips if you asked. Our room window opened to a beautiful waterfall and it drowned out the noise coming from the roadways nearby. Didn't care much to have to walk through the casino to get everywhere but once we discovered the outside paths it was much better. The spa facilities were first rate and the fruit/drnks available were a nice touch. Because we could not have the requested room, the friendly desk clerk upgraded our room at no charge and offered us complimentary breakfast for 3 mornings! The restaurant staff was so friendly that when we returned to LV a year later we went to the Marriott Resort in Summerlin just for the wonderful breakfast buffet at Ceres(restaurant). 2 waitresses recognized us and recalled our names. Now that's impressive. My beautiful wife and I highly recommend this very well kept resort. I'm not a golfer but the grounds I could see were impeccable. The views of Red Rock Canyon were breathtaking and we enjoyed walking on the upper terraces at sundown. Felt totally safe wether accompanied or alone

Reviews.Title: “Great stay - highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: antrimman
Reviews.Content: We had a very pleasant 4 night stay at the JW Marriott Las Vegas Resort. We got a great rate as, like a previous reviewer, we kept checking the hotel rate in the three months between booking and staying. Rate fell by almost a third in that time, saving us nearly $200 for the four nights. We were upgraded to a lovely room with a balcony on the top floor in the Spa Tower overlooking the golf course and mountains, with Las Vegas just about viewable too - best of all worlds! Huge bathroom with separate shower, two sinks and large clothes closet in hall. Self-parking was free, no need for valet parking at the high rate charged. Internet worked fine but daily charge of $9.95 was applied. Staff were courteous and helpful at all times. Didn't take the shuttle bus as we had a car and the hotel was easily accessible to the Strip (15 minutes drive) but satellite navigation is very useful.

Reviews.Title: “Golf at the J.W.”
Reviews.Author: Cottonsfancy
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights at the end of June (second visit to hotel). Still think the bathrooms are the best part - huge & luxurious. I wanted to mention specifically the golf available, particularly with reference to overseas guests who may not have brought their clubs. At present the hotel has negotiated a deal with the TPC Las Vegas & Angel Park (courses next door) to provide club hire to guests free of charge. This is a significant saving. So pack your shoes, glove, and a few balls and you have all you need. Hopefully the hotel will set up a similar deal at Badlands soon (another excellent nearby course). It should be noted that to get this deal you must book the golf through the hotel's golf concierge. I tried to arrange direct with the TPC without success. Incidentally, I'd read a couple of poor reviews about the condition of the TPC, but we found it in good shape late June 08. Cottons.

Reviews.Title: “very nice but not memorable”
Reviews.Author: pparnell
Reviews.Content: We booked this vacation nearly 1 year in advance. We chose this location as we are fans of JW Marriott and we have had great experiences at our 2 visits to the Phoenix Desert Ridge JW Marriott resort. We thought it would be great to be off the Las Vegas strip but close enough. From the reviews at Trip Advisor I expected the JW Las Vegas to be at least as good as our experiences at the Phoenix resort. We chose June/July as we love the heat. The biggest advise I would give with regard to staying at any Marriott is to go back and check room prices frequently leading up to your stay. You can do this online quite easily. As I said, we booked this approximately 1 year in advance (July/August 2007). When I checked the room cost 4 months later (December 2007), it had dropped by nearly ½. We called and we were given the new, discounted rate. When you’re talking about 7 nights at an upscale resort, which can be a significant amount. Again, I checked the room rate 2 weeks before we were scheduled to leave and it had dropped again to the tune of $150 for the week. We called and they gave us the new rate. Keeping on this saved approx. $1000 for the week. When booking we requested a balcony room upgrade as high up as possible. We also had them document that this was our 25th anniversary in the hopes that it would impact getting a better room at check-in. We waited until almost 4pm and our room was ready. It was a beautiful, very large King room. Did we get upgraded…no. But we got a great balcony room on the top floor (6th) with a great view of Red Rock Canyon just like we requested. Mid-week the hotel sent up strawberries dipped in chocolate and champagne for our anniversary. Very nice touch. When we first arrived our room was not ready so we decided to take a walk through the resort. First impressions…..the place was very nice but darker and more closed in that I expected. Nearly all the restaurants and lounges at the resort were either directly attached to the casino or you needed to walk through the casino to get to anything. Apparently a common practice in Vegas. Although the resort and restaurants in Vegas are non-smoking, the casinos are all smoking….cigars and cigarettes included. There are 2 main buildings (“Towers”). The Spa tower and the Palms tower. The Spa tower has only 1 restaurant in the lobby area (Ceres), which is where we spent most of our time. The food was decent and the drinks were good. What we liked most was the Ceres lounge area which has couches and over stuffed chairs. The lounge is full service and you can order off both the lounge menu and the restaurant menu. Very comfortable. The Palms tower was actually more nicely decorated, but there is little going on. If at the Palms tower, however, you have easy access to the Starbucks, Woolighans Irish Pub (greasy food), Speidini Italian restaurant (high quality food but lacking in flavor), a Shizen Japanese Steak House and the Rampart Buffet without having to go through the Casino. All the restaurants and lounges are operated by Marriott except the Casino, the Promenade café (literally almost IN the casino – SMOKEY), and the Buffet. The Waterside Grill by the pool has a great Mai Tai and OK food. It closes early though. I believe around 6pm. I had read a lot on the shuttle at Trip Advisor. Some said too crowded and long waits, others said a long ride to the strip, and yet others said no problems. Our experience…..no problem. The shuttle was never full. That said, we went in June/July, apparently the slow season. Our stay was from June 28 – July 5. Based on what I had read, I was not expecting anything significant for the 4th of July. When we arrived, we asked the concierge at the hotel if July 4th was a big event in Vegas. She too stated that it was not. The 4th came and nearly all the hotels shot off fireworks. It was quite a display. When we made our plans to visit the Las Vegas JW, we knew we wanted to visit the Hoover Dam, Red Rock Canyon, and the Grand Canyon Skywalk. We did, therefore rent a car. I would not, however, recommend driving on the strip if you can help it. The traffic is unbelievable. That said, it is extremely easy to get around and through Vegas. The highway system is well designed and fairly easy to navigate. Just avoid the strip when driving if you can help it. Wall to wall cars, red light after red light, and crazy taxi drivers. We visited Hoover Dam. Amazing. We took a hike in red Rock canyon. Beautiful. Just remember to bring lots of water. Never made it to the Grand Canyon Skywalk – 3 hour drive. A few other things to note: Nice pool but not the cleanest. We actually called to complain because there were tissues and a used Band-Aid in the pool for 2 days. They say there is a refrigerator in the room, but is actually a crisper and not cold enough to cool drinks or keep leftovers. The resort is still using big 32 inch tube TV’s. I expected flat screens. Overall a nice resort. If we were to go back we would stay for less time and stay at the Bellagio, which is in my opinion the most spectacular and classy hotel on the strip. If you’re thinking of vacationing in Arizona or Nevada, I would recommend the JW Marriot Desert Ridge in Phoenix which is far and away a nicer place than the Las Vegas JW Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “Relax in Vegas, if you can.”
Reviews.Author: WestVanMan
Reviews.Content: So if you want to stay on the Strip in Las Vegas, this review is not for you. Nor is this resort for you as it is 20 minutes away by car west on the freeway. However if you want to relax at a nice resort without all the crowds and packs of hormone induced young and old adults, this may be one of the few places that probably rates highly for that. I say highly because this was my first time to Sin City. I actually used tripadvisor.com to help whittle down the choices I had to make and I'm happy with the selection. Now being there at the end of June does test one's resilience to heat, but that comes with the territory. The fairly lush grounds with many water features and one large pool minimizes the heat sink that a lot of hard surface paving would otherwise create. The JW Marriott Resort is in the town of Summerlin, just west of the City of Las Vegas and very easy to get to from the Strip and McCarran Airport via the freeways. Once on the freeway leaving the Strip, there is only one traffic light to encounter before driving onto the grounds so access is quick and easy. The Resort is a collection of two 6 story towers of over 600 hotel rooms and probably Marriott timeshare units. As we were there for only 3 nights, I didn't get a chance to take everything in. Nestled between the towers, there is the hotel entrance and lobby, the full service Aquae Sulis Spa, and fully equipped exercise facility, 6 on-site restaurants, meeting facilities and the outdoor amenities including a large 4' deep free form pool with water fall, several jacuzzis and private cabanas and tying it all together a network of landscaped water features and gardens.....all very nice. Poolside service seemed quite attentive. Of course, being in Nevada, there has to be a casino, the Rampart Casino. Nice thing though is the entrance lobby of the hotel has no signs of the casino nor any sounds of slots within earshot. The Casino is completely removed, but also not far away. I liked that. Not being a gambler, I cannot comment on this amenity. There is no grand architectural statement made by this hotel like you would find at the Strip or other out-lying resorts. Nor is the architecture of the resort going to turn any architectural eyes with the standard beige sandstone colored facades and Spanish tile roofs. However it is straight-ahead high quality, open resort planning with generous interior spaces and outdoor landscaping finished reasonably well. My wife and I had a standard single room on the top floor with a shallow balcony (about $200/night). The king bed was very nice and the overall appointments were not anything really special, but it was well designed. The bathroom was very large and generous with a shower (with wall and overhead shower heads) and two person jetted tub and separate stall for the watercloset. Granite counters and marble floors were nice. Marriott toiletries were provided. The room itself, while it had a lock-off door to the adjacent room, was solid and quiet. One thing of note, and I don't know if this is typical of most upper scale Vegas resorts as I know it doesn't happen in other desert places we have stayed in, but this JW Marriott treats the hotel room water to soften it (it's not hard water that I've usually found elsewhere in the desert). It's tastes very good, no chlorine flavor, and as is typical of soft water, feels like you've not rinsed off all the soap in the shower. HIgh marks for this. If you've read some of my other reviews, I like to fit in some exercise and with 100F temperatures, that wasn't going to include an outdoor run or hike so I had to resort to using the fitness centre. Very plush and visually impressive with all the treadmills and step and elliptical machines having their own TVs. Weight machines are all on a carpeted area and most machines are there. There's also a glassed in hardwood floor, exercise fitness studio floor where they run some classes, but I didn't see any while there. Locker room is very nice and there is complimentary fruit, juice and use of special treatment baths. There is also a dedicated outdoor pool and patio which looked very inviting. All this comes at a price however, which I found to be the downside and limiting me to only one use of the facility. As nice as it was, the $25 fee for a day pass was excessive, especially if one only uses the place to workout for an hour or two and then is outta there afterwards. One consolation is that if you get a Spa treatment, the fitness fee is waived that day. They should work on a lesser rate for those who just need to get the blood circulating. The large pool was nice with lots of deck chairs. We were out there by 9 each AM to beat the heat and there would only be few others out there too (late risers in Vegas). Lots of trees, grass and plants and some umbrellas for shade. There are several jacuzzis around and also cabanas with misted air conditioning and TVs. While the pool was fairly large and adequate for the numbers, a second separate pool would have been nice. We only had one breakfast at the Ceres Restaurant on site and it was done well, but not memorably special. Other meals were had off site as we wanted to see some of the sights. Front desk service was very good as was the Concierge. It definitely helps with the hotel not being inundated with guests. If there had been a convention, that might be different. We also noticed that the weekend brought in more people. Parking on site, while available on the open air parking lot, is best done in the parkade connected to the Casino to keep the car out of the sun. We rented a Dodge Caliber from Dollar for 4 days for a total of just under $50 plus gas. Can't beat that! For the golfers, this is a great location as the Resort is next to the TPC Las Vegas (formerly the TPC Canyons) and the Palmer designed Angel Park Golf Club which in addition to the Mountain and Palm Courses also features a night play 12 hole short course and 18 hole putting green. I didn't get a chance to play, but maybe next time. While never really wanting to go to Vegas in the past, I can't say I won't go again. Finding this hotel would make that difference. Apart from the hotel, here are a few other things we did that I would recommend: 1. We saw two shows. Bette Midler at Caesar's Palace Coleseum and Le Reve at the Wynn Hotel. Being a Bette Midler fan I'd have to give it 5 stars. She's not only a great singer, but a crack-up comic and so inventive with her spectacular show. Le Reve is an aquatic Cirque de Soleil type show which is in a theatre in the round, all good seats. This too is spectacular for completely different reasons with tremendous aquatic and athletic performances, props water and lighting effects and aquatic staging. You should check the website to understand the story first as there is little dialogue. Also note that big shows in Vegas command big bucks. 2. Shopping is great to buy things at the Fashion Show Mall across from Treasure Island and Wynn Hotels as there is Bloomies, Nordstroms, Macy's, and Nieman there and a three level mall. Also the Las Vegas Prime Outlets 10 minutes away by taxi or shuttle have the usual assortment of mid-range outlet stores. If budget is no object, the The Shops at the Forum at Caesar's Palace and at the Wynn Hotel are Rodeo Drive transplants. We never made it to Bellagio Hotel itself, but I imagine the shops there to be of this same no budget caliber. 3. See the fountains at the Bellagio. It's free and it's a different show every 15 minutes, each show lasting 3 or 4 minutes. Go at night. 4. A short trip to Red Rock Canyon, if you like geology, is a nice getaway. There's a 13 mile scenic loop with a number of stops and a Visitor Centre. HIke in the trails if the temperature allows. Entry fee for the drive is $5 for a car. While it's neat, Sedona north of Phoenix, makes this pale in comparison. 5. Of all the hotels we saw on the Strip (Caesars, Venetian, Paris, Treasure Island, Mirage, Palazzo and the Wynn), my favorite was the Wynn by far. It's probably at least on par with the Bellagio, but not having visited that, I can't compare, but being built by the same guy, Steve Wynn and with the Wynn being newer, I would lay bets, the Wynn may be at least a touch above if not more. Travel websites rate the Wynn as the best in Vegas and one of the best in the U.S.. Happy Travels!

Reviews.Title: “An oasis in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: jogom
Reviews.Content: My husband attended a business conference at this hotel and we (the rest of the family) tagged along for fun. This was our lst trip to Las Vegas (husband has been many times for various conferences and stayed in several other LV properties). The JW Marriott was a perfect way to experience Las Vegas without having to stay in the midst of all the crowds and noise at the strip. The rooms were huge and the whirlpool bathtub was perfect for soaking in after a very hot day walking on the strip. The pool and hotel grounds are beautiful - it's obvious they spend alot of time and money making it not look like it's in the middle of the desert! The gorgeous grounds and pool helped me forget that it was about 110 degrees most of the time we were there as well! If I ever go to Las Vegas (and have to spend my own money on a hotel which I didn't do in this case), I'd stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Far Above Expectations GREAT HOTEL!!!”
Reviews.Author: htwheels
Reviews.Content: The photos do not do this property justice (spotless inside and out). Great service from check-in to check-out. We had a suite facing the golf course/mountains and enjoyed breakfast on the balcony. Amazing bathrooms as others have said. If you have seen and done the strip (as we have) treat yourself to a cabana by their excellent pool. We loved having a retreat from the summer sun and stayed poolside all day long. They even show movies at the pool on summer sat. evenings. WE WILL BE BACK!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great property for thse who have been to Vegas before”
Reviews.Author: eva10
Reviews.Content: We have been to Vegas a few times now and we always stay on the Strip at MGM, Planet Hollywood... but I had once read very nice reviews about this property and I was very curious. This hotel had amazing rooms. First of all the rooms are enormous for hotel rooms, especially when you compare it to the regular rooms at any hotel on the strip. They had amazing bathrooms with his and hers sinks, very nice Jacuzzi tub for two (plenty of space; I must add that my husband and I are tall people) separate stand up shower, and the toilet was in a separate place with a door, very nice. The property had very pretty ground, the valet parking was for free and the crew was really nice and fast, very worth the tip :-) They have a few restaurants in the hotel but we had tried only Ceres for breakfast one morning and the brunch was really nice, must try the waffles, they were wonderful, and I normally don't eat waffles. The hotel service was good, and they also have the Rampart Casino connected to the property for all those late night gamblers, $5 blackjack at the Rampart casino. The grounds were beautiful but we never got to use the pool since the weather did not cooperate for us that week-end ;-( The drive the to strip was only 12 minutes so it was very convenient. The only thing I was not really impressed with was the Spa. It seems that it was only one person doing all the treatments that day, she was nice but nothing spectacular. If you want to use the spa facilities ( which included the fitness area) a they charge you a $25 fee per day ( free day pass to the facilities, if you do a spa service that same day). I would not recommend to pay $25 because it was worth it. I think the hotel should give free access to these facilities anyways. Overall it was an amazing hotel if you want to still enjoy the casinos and dining on the strip but prefer to relax at night and be away from all the noise and rumble.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel with Fantastic Scenery of Red Rock Canyon”
Reviews.Author: Lindyloo1
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the JW Marriott after a long drive from Scottsdale, Arizona. Our room wasn't ready however the receptionist offered us another room that was. She said the room she had held for us and that was not quite ready had a wonderful view of Red Rock Canyon and was a very nice room so we decided to wait. When it was ready the receptionist told us and sent chocolate covered strawberries and champagne to our room to apologise for the wait !! that was a very nice thing to do indeed. The hotel is simply beautiful and the pools are tranquil and relaxing with comfortable padded chairs. I booked the JW Marriot as it wasn't on the strip although only a seven mile drive to the strip where, if you wanted, you could have dinner. They do have some very good restaurants at the JW so if you don't want to go out there is no need. The best part of our two day stay was our drive up Red Rock Canyon which was absolutely wonderful, the way the desert has created this canyon along with the colours is quite a miracle. I think I read earlier that somebody didn't like the shop at Red Rock Canyon - why ? it was a super shop and I bought myself a solid silver bracelet with opals for a bargain price ! JW Marriott have done it once again, another wonderful resort in another splendid place.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel- Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: warrenrandy
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Vegas and we had an awesome time. We were upgraded to a Parlour Suite for an awesome price. What a room! The decor and layout were fantastic. If you want the fun of Vegas bur nit the crowds all the time this is the place to go. We drove into teh Strip several times and loved it. It was great to be away from all the crowds when we were in our home hotel. I would strognly recommend this hotel for someone that wants to relax, but also that wants to take advantage fo the strip when they want.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive off the Strip Resort”
Reviews.Author: Dagdabear
Reviews.Content: Flying into Vegas only as a starting point for a cross country tour, we weren't looking for a on Strip Casino-Hotel, hence our choice of the Marriott which is some distance from the main part of Las Vegas. As well as being the luxurious peaceful place we wanted we were pleased, with the helpfulness and quality of the staff, the general amenities, and the absolutely superb room we were given. To stay I've stayed in hotel rooms which were smaller than the bathroom that accompanied our balconied suite is not an understatement. The resort has a casino but it's not over emphasized in the set-up, although it's no surprise you have to pass through it to get to the on site restaurants and other facilities. We ate in the on site Italian restaurant and found it well up to specification, also the cafe for breakfast excelled. The buffet was economic but very busy so we avoided this. A special thanks to the valets and security staff of the resort who, dealt with our car being damaged accidentally by another guest in the middle of the night, and provided us with all the paperwork we needed and the help to get the matter quickly sorted the next morning. A highly rated stay, just a pity we are not gamblers so have limited reason to return. If this resort had been in a major city I always stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: swimmermc
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Vegas and my stay at the JW Marriot. Great value for the money (around 200 per night with AAA discount). Ceres restaurant had good breakfast buffet and servers were very attentive and helpful. In particular, one server (buyon??) went out of his way to ask the chef to prepare us bag lunches for our hike later that day. As we were getting ready to go the chef ran out and gave us oranges to go in our bags (very thoughtful). Rooms were very spacious. Nice spa tub and rainfall shower and good view of golf course/mountains. The poolside service (although only open one of the few days I was there because it was cold/rainy) was good. Often you had the hottubs to yourself. Unless you are going to get a treatment, I wouldn't pay 25 per person so use the spa facilities for a day (although they were nice (we checked them out-nice sitting areas, waterfall showers/hot tubs in the women's facility)) because you could just use the hot tubs near the pool. Also the spa entrance is right near the casino (poor layout). It is nice, though, that the casino was far removed from the rest of the hotel!! Most of the people at the hotel were older or business people there for conventions. Very few children. When we went to the Dolphin habitat and got a view of the hotel pools on the strip (OVERCROWDED) I was sooo happy I decided to stay at the JW. Grounds were amazing. The red rock casino/hotel grounds looked terrible comparably (just a giant building that pops out of the desert on the way to the red rock conservation area). Only thing that annoyed me a little was that they didn't have a room available for us when we tried to check in at about noon on our first day. They held our bags for us while we went out to the strip though. Great valet service (complimentary). I was getting used to just driving up to the door and leaving the car with the valet. Little weird that they tried to sell us on a new marriot timeshare on the strip by offering us another stay in either the jw or the timeshare property on the strip for 150 to 250 ish if we went to a presentation on our next stay. Would have been a good deal if I felt I would return to vegas in the next year (could be extended). Did get a 10% off food at the ceres even though I didn't accept the offer.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice resort But Make Sure You Get the Right Room”
Reviews.Author: dmsgrl
Reviews.Content: We really liked this resort and will definitely go back. The restaurants were good, large and well appointed rooms, grounds are lovely, great spa, attentive staff. My one BIG complaint is that my room in the Spa Tower "faced the golf course." This actually means you can see the golf course waaaayyyy over there on the other side of a busy road. It also looked directly over the entrance way. This meant noise all day and (this being Vegas) well into the wee hours as people returned from their nights out in, shall we say, a cheerful frame of mind PLUS lots of traffic noise from the busy road starting in the early morning. It being nice weather, I would've liked to have slept with my french doors open but this proved absolutely impossible to do and get sleep and I was on the 5th floor! I can only imagine what it would've been like on the second floor! I honestly have to say I've rarely been in such a noisy room and certainly not at $275 a night! When we return, I will definitely make very sure I'm not "facing the golf course" in the Spa Tower! That being said, the resort is great in every other way. I do wish they had some other nightclub venue. They have two small bars offering live entertainment but nothing with a dance floor or a nightclub atmosphere. Also, they have a free shuttle to the strip (otherwise a $40 cab fare including tip); however, it lets you out across from Fashion Mall. It's a real hike from there to any of the main resorts (like at least 20 blocks). Cab fare from there to Mandalay Bay where we were attending a show was $15 with tip. Since we were only going to the Strip once during our stay, it wasn't a big deal. If you are planning to spend a lot of time on the Strip, you might want to take the transportation into consideration.

Reviews.Title: “Glad someone likes it”
Reviews.Author: RoomChanger
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the JW Marriott April 4-6 and paid full rate instead of using our points like the previous reviewer. Our deluxe jr. suite view was the top of the trees and that's it. I'm glad they got upgraded and all the attention because none was sent our way. Our room was not cleaned our entire stay. When we arrived back to our room on Saturday night (Sunday morning) and saw that it still had not been cleaned, we called the front desk to at least get clean towels. They showed up with bath towels, but no wash cloths. When we questioned it, we were told housekeeping was closed and they didn't have any others. My husband had to suggest they go to a vacant room to get us wash cloths. We had ordered a platter of chocolate covered strawberries and truffles - what a joke for $40. There were four mushy strawberries with the chocolate mashed on there with a fork and four truffles the size of marbles. Needless to say, it sat there until we left. The rooms are big, the pool is beautiful. We had the buffet breakfast on Saturday morning but it was not yet open when we arrived. The hostess was so grumpy that she asked "it that a problem that you have to wait 5 minutes?" to our "what time does the buffet open" question. She also yelled (yes, she did) at my husband for picking up a brochure. She told him it was not for him to read. Hello, don't have a stack laying out on the table!! I don't know if I'll go back. This hotel is not the same quality as the JW Marriotts' in Cancun, Orlando and Arizona. It could be a great place with a few quality checkups - like making sure the rooms are cleaned!

Reviews.Title: “Great time at the JW Marriott!”
Reviews.Author: OCTwinsDad
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my wife and two 5 yr old children Apr 4-6, 2008. I booked the stay with Marriott Rewards points and was pleasantly upgraded (upon request) to an approx. 2000' two-bedroom suite! Incredible room with enormous bathrooms (2 1/2) with jacuzzi tubs, separate shows, double vanities, etc. As a Marriott platinum, I was also provided with four vouchers for the breakfast buffett for 2 (total of 8 meals) and a pass to the spa. What a great place to stay in Las Vegas - far enough from the strip (about 10 minutes drive) so you get the true resort feeling, but close enough to venture in if you desire. There's a lot of new construction in the surrounding area with many good restaurant choices. The JW's pool was great and the grounds are beautiful. We're definitely going back.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Bathroom and Pool”
Reviews.Author: VirgniaBiztrvlr
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the JW Marriott for five nights in March 2008. I loved it. The bathroom in my room was the nicest hotel bathroom I have ever had. In addition to the spacious marble shower with bench and optional rainshower head, there was a large corner whirlpool. The vanity had two sinks and the toilet was behind a door. Very nice!! The pool wasn't open when I was there but people were sunbathing around it. The poolside cabanas must be really amazing when in use. I noticed that they have ceiling fans and what appeared to be mounts for televisions. I couldn't help but take tons of pictures of the huge pool because it was so amazing looking.
