Think curves and grottoes. The hotel is surrounded by waterfalls and landscaping galore. I would definitely return to this property.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the JW Marriott”
Reviews.Author: nugent17
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the JW Marriott in January after a 3 day stay at the Venetian. We loved both hotels! The JW Marriott is a nice change of pace if you want to get away from the hustle and bustle of the strip. The property is beautiful and the service is excellent. Our room was beautiful, a nice size and very clean. We also had a lovely view of the mountains. Make sure you get a room with a balcony, it does make a difference. The staff does try to please and are very friendly. The casino is also very nice. If you stay at the JW Marriott make sure you eat at Rosemary's. It is only 5 minutes from the hotel and I can see why it is the #1 restaurant in Las Vegas. We also took a tour to the Grand Canyon, South Rim with grand-adventures.com. Daryll was our tour guide/owner. Most of the tours from Las Vegas are to the West Rim, which is actually not in the Grand Canyon National Park. This tour takes you to the South Rim and is really beautiful. The day we went there was a fresh coat of snow and it was breathtaking. Daryll's tours are different in the fact that he only takes about 10 people in a mini van, unlike most tours to the south rim which are in a large bus with 50 passengers. The ride was about 5 hours each way, but well worth the trip. He allows plenty of time at the canyon. I highly recommend this tour if you want to see the South Rim and have a limited amout of time. We also took an ATV tour and Valley of Fire with awesomeadventureguide.com. We had a great time on this tour, about 4 hours on the ATV in the dunes and than a drive through the Valley of Fire which is really amazing. I would also like to add that a drive through Red Rock Canyon is a must, it is only a five minute drive from the JW Marriott. Golf is excellent at the JW and I am sure the pool is amazing in the summer time. I highly recommend this hotel is you want to be away from the strip and experience more of the natural beauty in the area.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful resort!”
Reviews.Author: adusek
Reviews.Content: Resort was gorgeous, room was huge!!! We had a balcony with a view, 2 queen beds and the bathroom was bigger than a studio size apt with a jacuzzi tub!!! Pros: 15 min from strip and rosemary's restaurant (sundays are half price wine nt at Rosemary's). A quick relaxing retreat from flashy vegas lights. Cons: bring your ipod.........alarm clock radio stinks and hotel charges $15 for 2 hrs of music through tv. Pricey, pricey, pricey salon/spa services (despite fact that women's spa atrium is under construction with a large black canpy in middle). Overall: We would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Nice Vegas getaway”
Reviews.Author: bocanewlywed
Reviews.Content: Great place to getaway for locals. My husband and I just wanted to take a break and celebrate our anniversary. The room was huge. As a matter of fact, much of the hotel is so large and open, it seems like a waste of space. (by Las Vegas standards.) The hot tub was great, the best part. The Rampart casino is kind of a dive compared to the hotel, but definitely a bonus. The hotel staff was friendly, we had a good time. We are especially fond of J.C. Whoolihans (spelling?), GREAT bar food with an Irish flair. I got my discount, so it was only $79/ night on the weekend, which made it worthwhile.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!!!”
Reviews.Author: Myas
Reviews.Content: My sister and I had our first ever sisters' getaway (she in her late 20s, I in my early 30s - better late than never!) at this fantastic resort hotel over Memorial Day Weekend 2007. The resort itself was beautiful and well kept. The food was great (although a little pricey, but what can you expect?!), the room/bath was clean, and the service was impressive. They even had daily complimentary water bottles in the lobby for hotel guests. We enjoyed sunbathing around the huge pool. Although the pool area got crowded as the day went on, we did notice how much more laid back and relaxed the environment was compared to the pool environments of the strip hotels, which always seemed hectic and jam-packed like sardines - no exaggeration! I had a great massage at the spa. The workout facility was top-notch - the machines and fitness equipment rivaled that of high-quality health clubs. The workout facility even offered a variety of fitness classes. The concierge was very helpful - they gave us a back route to the strip as we had a rental car. Therefore we were able to avoid major traffic and usually made it to the strip in about 15 minutes. Although we didn't play golf, the course looked impeccable. I almost felt guilty for not taking my hubby! I would definitely visit this property again. It's great for couples, families, and of course, a sisters' getaway!

Reviews.Title: “Loved our golf and spa visit”
Reviews.Author: cheathamtrailblazers
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because we wanted to use marriot rewards points. We were looking for a desert vacation that offered golf, dining, and spa. The hotel was wonderful. The staff was very attentive. The spa was nice and relaxing. My husband golfed and I rode along. We had excellent concierge service. She helped us book dinner reservations and get great tickets to see a Cirque du Soleil. Overall, it was a wonderful, wonderful vacation and we would defnitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “One of the Best in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: jimboc
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying at the JW Marriott earlier this year as part of an industry conference being held at the property. A good first sign: I was notified at the front desk that I was being upgraded to a Junior Suite, which has a real living room-sized area next to the bedroom. The bathroom was also massive, with a whirlpool bathtub that was the biggest I've ever seen. The bed was heavenly. I had not slept so well in years (it helped that the kids were back home). I would also add that the room is quite dark, since there was only a single window in the large room. Of course, this also helped me to fall asleep quickly. Except for a couple of dinners, I did not step foot off the property. Nor did I need to. There were plenty of restaurants onsite, and a casino that just met the needs of the hotel's guests. My meals onsite ranged from buffet breakfast to a midnight meal of spaghetti and meatballs. While they were nothing to race about, they were filling and adequate. The property is adjecent to the Suncoast Casino/Hotel and several golf courses. There is also a shuttle bus to the Strip. But why would anyone want to go there after staying here?

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: d33j
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights for business conference. Lobby has rustic interior design. Room spacious with king bed, desk, and love seat. Bathroom had double sinks, shower and separate bath hot tub. The resort has casino, conference center, and collection of restaurants, all in separate wings. Japanese restaurant offered fresh sushi and reasonable prices. Had lovely courtyard where a wedding was being planned. Had spa, golf and tennis which I did not use. Paid $189 rate for conference attendees. Room was in corner of top floor of tower by lobby. Very quiet. Hotel has 2 towers of rooms. Hotel has shuttle to the Strip which is about 15 minutes away. If you have been to Vegas before, this hotel would be a refreshing change. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great offstrip hotel”
Reviews.Author: alexsndiego
Reviews.Content: We were really pleased with our stay at the JW Las Vegas. You drive up to complimentary valet parking. Check in was quick and we assigned a room on the top floor which is only the 6th floor. This is not a high rise hotel. The casino (not run by Marriott) is nice and small with cheap tables. We enjoyed that very much since we are not heavy gamblers. The buffet at the casino is okay. We enjoyed the food at the Irish Pub although service can be sketchy. We were a little disappointed with the breakfast buffet in the hotel. Food was somewhat cold. Eggs were on the warmer too long. Stick to ordering from their menu. Service was good one day and somewhat unattentive the next day. Lorraine was great the first day. She offered great service. The second day the staff was more worried about setting up for a large party than the current diners. The large party took up more than a quarter of the dining room. That group should have been put in a meeting a banquet room. We did not use the pool because it was too cold. Bathrooms in rooms are as great as advertised. We will be coming more often to the JW Marriott in Las Vegas. This will be our 1st choice to stay every time!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty property, service hit or miss, food only ok”
Reviews.Author: ajkyc
Reviews.Content: Pros: - some eco friendly elements (e.g., the room lights turn off when you leave, but come back on exactly the way you left them when you return). - Terrific lamb chops. - was upgraded for no apparent reason to a huge, stunning suite with Strip views and an enormous, luxurious bathroom with a comfortable 2-person jacuzzi. - great towels and robes - very friendly and helpful valet and bell staff - beautiful, spotless property and grounds. Cons: - No minibar! - toiletries were not refreshed at all during my 4 day stay - some of the front desk staff were cranky - No balcony furniture - food (besides the lamb chop) not up to par for a property of this kind also, it's quite far from the strip - more like half an hour than the advertised 20 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Guest and Meeting/Conference Experience”
Reviews.Author: STC
Reviews.Content: I attended a business conference at this resort, November 2 – 6, 2007, rate of $189/night. My transfer from the Las Vegas airport took about 20 minutes in pre-rush hour traffic. During the conference, all the attendees were transferred to the Strip, to the Mirage for dinner at Stack’s and to see “Love” (Beatles Cirque de Soleil Show). That transfer only took 15 minutes. So, the Las Vegas Strip is a short transfer, but a transfer none the less. The JW Marriott is very nice with beautiful landscaping, a big resort pool, a big fitness center & spa, its own casino, a handful of restaurants, a Starbucks, and a couple of shops. The rooms are top notch, spacious, and loaded up with marble bathrooms, separate tub and big walk in shower, a walk-in closet, safe, good desk with an Internet connection. From a conference/meeting perspective, it was just fine, with guest rooms comparable to Bellagio, Venetian, and almost at nice as the Four Seasons. So, if you are going to Las Vegas and don’t want to stay on the Strip, then the JW Marriott will be just fine. For me though, given a choice, I would always rather stay on the Strip. There’ just a whole lot more to do and see, and you can avoid the transfer.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful spa experience!”
Reviews.Author: btravis
Reviews.Content: My husband and I loved this hotel and spa! The room was very spacious and the bathroom was luxurious. This was our first time to Las Vegas, but we had no interest in staying on the Strip. The JW Marriott is a comfortable distance from the hustle and bustle of the Vegas life. We were looking for a relaxing vacation with occasional excitement. This hotel was perfect for us. The grounds were perfectly manicured and there were rosemary bushes everywhere. The spa was AMAZING...one of the best I have been to. From the moment we stepped into the area, it was pure relaxment. There are plenty of attendants to help and many service rooms, so there are few times that no services were available. All of the services we had were WONDERFUL! If you are looking for a hotel that is about relaxing, this is the place for you!

Reviews.Title: “Not one bad thing to say”
Reviews.Author: NRosenbaum
Reviews.Content: I have nothing negative to report about the JW Marriott. Everything from check in to check out was just great. Quiet area of Vegas, which we liked. We can visit the strip and return here away from the crowds, ect. If you like the Strip action this is not the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Sketchy Service kind of a bummer”
Reviews.Author: Eiregirl
Reviews.Content: This is kind of a confusing hotel. Rooms are great and typical of an upper-end property, but the layout of the hotel is a bit bizarre. The previous review that said that the hotel wasn't for disabled travellers wasn't joking...I'd also add that it isn't the best for hoofing around in a pair of high heels either! I'd reckon that the endless corridors orginated when the Marriott planning team tried to work its way around the Rampart Casino. The hotel is pretty crisp in a reassuring, vanilla kind of way until you walk through the casino hub...then it's all worn carpet, low ceilings and cigarette smog. Not exactly ringing the five-star bell, if you know what I mean. All of that aside, however, I probably won't rank it as low if it wasn't for the dodgy service issues we encountered. Nothing earth-shattering, but the lot would put me off staying at the hotel again. Stuff that happened during our stay included... --Laundry that showed up at the last possible second. We had sent some suits in to be pressed when we arrived early the first afternoon and we were told they'd run it through and have it up the next morning. Late the following afternoon, as we were contemplating how to spruce up our t-shirts for a business dinner, we were told that the order had been sent off-property and it still wasn't back. The gal on the phone was very helpful and entertained our half-hourly nervous phone calls but it was a little too close for my taste. --Concierge apathy. We needed some information on how to get ahold of a few simple things and both gals suggested that we check the local shops. Funny that I didn't think of that. I was a concierge myself, and I dimly remember something about assisting the guests by providing specific information, and even calling a few places if I didn't know the information off the top of my head. Being as we didn't know the area, even a nudge in the right direction would have been helpful. --Strident telephone operators. My cell phone wasn't working, I was down on the Strip and I needed to contact my husband at the hotel. I had the room card jacket so I called the number on it. The operator patched me through to the room. As soon as I set the phone down, I realized that I needed one more piece of info so I called the hotel again. This time a different operator tells me that she can't connect me. I have to call the local number. I explain that I'm calling from a borrowed phone, and that I had just reached the room moments earlier. Besides, each piece of hotel information in my purse only lists two phone numbers for the hotel; a 877 phone number and a local fax. She tells me that she CAN NOT connect me. It is impossible. She will be happy, however, to give me the local number if I can find a pen. I said again that I was on a borrowed phone and could I please speak to a manager. She sent me to a voice mail box. When I got back to the room, I sifted through my purse again. I had the hotel brochure and a bunch of little cards from the room key jacket. All have the 877 phone number listed. I'm confused why this number is prevalent if guests aren't allowed to use it once they are in the hotel. Overall, there were just a bunch of little details like this that kept the stay from being relaxing and enjoyable. Could have just been our bad luck that we kept running into so many off-putting quirks, but I don't think that I would ever venture back to this hotel again when there are so many other premium options in the area.

Reviews.Title: “First Class Joint”
Reviews.Author: donstone
Reviews.Content: I had opportunity to spend 4 nights at the J W. This place is probably one of the best hotels I have experienced. The staff were friendly and very helpfull. The food was excellent. The sports bar was superb. The place is huge. The rooms were larger than normal and had a huge bathroom with a jacuzzi and a huge shower. The hotel is located west of Vegas, about a 15 minute drive. one day on the strip is enough for me. The JW is a great place to just get away and relax for a few days.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - serious and dangerous operational practices”
Reviews.Author: KawiGirl
Reviews.Content: This resort is beautiful and the staff is nice, but there are serious problems with some of their policies which puts you and your belongings at risk. To add to the problem, their front desk management on duty is not empowered to rectify the situation. All went well for the 2 days I attended my conference, but it all went bad on checkout day. First, they put your bill on the outside of the door in the middle of the night rather than sliding it under advertising to others your name, etc. Upon check-in, I requested and was granted a 1pm checkout time. My conference (held at their facility) finished at noon. The hotel knew I was part of the conference group. I went back to my room at 12:35 and my key didn't work. Then my door opened from the inside. The hotel had taken it upon themselves to decide I had checked out even though all my belongings were still in the room and had given the room to new guests. These guests had been in there long enough to fully unpack and hang everything up (weird that they put my suitcases right inside the door rather than calling the front desk). When I complained to the front desk, they offered to knock a little off my bill, but when I explained that it was not my company inconvenienced, but me and could they offer, instead, points, future stay discounts, spa or restaurant discount, I was told that I could take the business card of someone who couldn't/wouldn't talk to me and pursue restitution when I got home. This was from the customer satisfaction supervisor! They even argued that I had checked out at 10:30 - note... I had not even looked at the video bill, had not called the front desk, had not left my keys in the room - I had done NOTHING to trigger a checkout other than to be a well organized, tidy solo traveler. I had been planning to come back ... now I'd never go back - can't trust their procedures or judgment. Triggering a "checkout" based on one maid's viewpoint that the room is neat and clean should never be allowed. Note: the maid had to move or trip over my 2 suitcases to hang up fresh robes in the closet.

Reviews.Title: “fabulous”
Reviews.Author: AntoniaV
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel at the beginning and the end of our trip, for a total of five nights, both times in a junior suite. We knew off course that this hotel does not have your typical 'Vegas atmosphere'. The quiet and remoteness from the strip were important reasons for us to choose this hotel; we planned to visit the strip with our rental car and park the car in one of the casino garages. This worked out fine. The hotel itself was wonderful. The rooms were possibly the best we ever stayed in, with the super bed and bathroom as mentioned in previous reviews. There was a wetbar in the room which came in handy. The service was good, with quick and courteous luggage delivery and parking valets. We had the breakfast buffet once, and it was excellent. I give the hotel the highest rating and would recommand it. I must however mention two minor niggles that should not happen in a hotel like this. During the first stay we were awakened in the middle of the night by a telephone ringing in an adjecent maintenance room. It souded so loud that at first we thought it was in our room. During our second stay we were awakened by someone taking a shower somewhere. Never heard it before or since though, nor any other sound at any time, the rooms were indeed very quiet at all times.

Reviews.Title: “OK, nice location away from the Strip”
Reviews.Author: ZadaZainal
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel after a week on the Strip- what a blessing to see a bit of "normal" that Vegas had to offer! It was easy to find, 15mins from the Strip, within 2 mins drive to the nearest local restaurants and shops, big rooms, romantic gardens and lovely pool area. We booked using the Labor Day discount and found ourselves in a tired-looking room with 2 Queen beds (they didn't have any King beds left) with a view of the road, so maybe you get what you pay for? Plus the TV had poor reception, the AC wasn't easy to control and the extra room for the luggage was actually too small for the purpose. Saving grace was the bathroom with the wonderful rain-shower! Service I found to be a bit on the poor side- our luggage was dumped on the floor by a trainee porter who looked extremely hot and bothered and had his shirt buttons undone. The receptionist at the check in counter gave the impression of being very rushed although there were only a few people there. In comparison the Bellagio check-in counter was extremely slow but once you got there they treated you 100% better and catered to every need. The valets were polite and quick though.. Pool smelled strongly of chlorine but it was exactly the same at the Bellagio. All in all, I rated this hotel an average coz it really was.. average. After a week of staying at the best hotels in Vegas I wasn't really impressed with the room or the service. For the price we paid we should have stayed longer at Signature (best hotel in Vegas!). I might stay here again if it was fully booked everywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel if you want a little bit of peace and quiet away from the Strip”
Reviews.Author: ct1young
Reviews.Content: PROS Lovely grounds and a little bit of peace away from the lights and sounds of the Strip. Rooms are well sized and there is good choice in terms of food and entertainment on site. The themed Irish pub is a bit like being back in an O'Neills in London but with much better food and cheaper beer (even the Irish ale is cheaper!) The casino is small by Vegas standards but a good way to learn the ropes before losing even bigger sums in the resort hotels on the Strip. Buffet breakfast was included and was good quality with varied selection. Red Rock Canyon is only about a 20 minute drive away and well worth the trip. There is a well signed scenic drive which is great around sunset. CONS Hotel wasn't very busy but we still found ourselves having to wait a little to get anyway from reception when wanting to use the business suite and had to wait to be seated (around 10 minutes) each morning for breakfast. We presume would be quite long during peak season. Not exactly a typical Vegas hotel and drive to the Strip is around 20 minutes with good traffic. The free shuttle service to the Strip is very useful but again, during peak season is must get a little fretful as it is first come first served and only goes every hour.(However you can park at all the main Strip hotels so driving there and back isn't a real problem unless you plan to drink) SUMMARY Overall a very nice hotel and we would stay here again but having stayed one night at The Hotel at the Mandalay Bay we would suggest that if you want the full Vegas experience you go for a hotel on the Strip.

Reviews.Title: “Not for disabled travelers”
Reviews.Author: ez4me
Reviews.Content: Recommend for convention & weddings, not weekend or spa get-away. A la Vegas style, all access to conference rooms and restaurants are via Casino but with a very steep ramp. If you have difficult walking or wheelchair user avoid this hotel. Service great, rooms large, too many mirrors in bath. Secluded from strip, pricey food & spa.

Reviews.Title: “Consistent Paradise in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: ATWillow
Reviews.Content: My husband and I started staying at the JW Marriott twice a year after we read the outsanding reviews here 5 years ago. Every experience we have had at JW has been nothing less than perfect. This includes the location, staff, restaurants, grounds, pool, spa, and the weather!!! The setting is so beautiful and romantic but also great for families and conventions. The location in Summerlin is great and has not been inconvenient for us. We can be on The Strip to enjoy the sights in about 15 minutes and then the same quick drive back to a quiet setting. The rooms are outrageous, luxuriously appointed and immaculate. The oversized spa tub is wonderful. Everything is first class from the towels, comforters, to the sewing kits. The outdoor pool is huge with a waterfall. Treat yourself to brunch at Ceres and eat outside by the waterfalls. The wait staff is really attentive and friendly. The Irish pub is also very good if you are looking for a casual dinner without going "off campus." We always feel like we are treating ourselves with extreme kindness by staying here and will be back again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Wonderful !”
Reviews.Author: hdblue
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the JW Marriott for 1 night in a standard luxury room. This was my second trip to vegas for work this month and I wanted at least one night away from the crowds, noise and plastic hotels on the strip and I definitely found it here. Everything about the hotel and the rooms are first rate, better then any Marriott resort or hotel I have ever stayed at anywhere in the U.S. The rooms are beautiful. They are over sized with a wonderful bed and bathroom. There is plenty of room to spread out and enjoy yourself. The bathroom is fantastic with a spa jet soaking tub and shower with rain faucet. The rooms came with quality comfortable robes and a full walk in closet. The beds are heavenly, better then most marriott beds I have been in, fantastic quality sheets, duvet and pillows. There are plenty of restaurants on site and there is no waiting like those on the strip, actually you dont wait in line for anything at the hotel. The pool is awesome. It is very large with a waterfall and spa pool. There is plenty of room around the pool and since this hotel is not on the strip the pool isnt a zoo and you can always find room and space for yourself. There was nothing lacking in this hotel with the possible exception of the TV which needs updating but you wont be watching that much anyhow. Everything is quality and tasteful, not gold covered plastic that you find on the strip hotels. The only thing that kept me from rating this hotel 5 stars was that I reserved a patio/balcony room and they told me there were none available. For a frequent traveler it is really annoying to plan a trip, book the room you want only to be told you arent getting that room and really there is no excuse for it. At a minimum I expect that if a hotel has run out of the room I confirmed they upgrade me to better room and that didnt happen here. Other then that I would return without hesitation next trip to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Flower46
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our stay at this JW Marriott (Sept 19-25th) and had a fabulous time. As usual we had a wonderful room, bathroom with jacuzzi tub and excellent service. We met some wonderful people Grace - front desk ( thank you for the complimentary birthday breakfast at Ceres), Mimi - concerige who was so helpful and the staff at Speidini Italian restaurant who provided wonderful food (love the halibut) and exceptional service - thank you for the surprise birthday dessert. The spa and the staff was exceptional. I had a wonderful massage by Michelle (from Minnesota/Texas) and my husband had a massage by Cody - they were both wonderful. Our only downside was the shuttle driver who arrived at 5:15 instead of 5pm (Sept 20th) and offered no apologies to the waiting guests. We had to rush to make our dinner appt followed by "O" at the Bellagio - we would make alternative arrangements in future than use the shuttle to travel to the Strip. Otherwise we are planning a return visit in the spring and will sing this property`s praises to all who will listen.

Reviews.Title: “Feels like you're not in Vegas (a good thing!)...”
Reviews.Author: OftenContentFlyer
Reviews.Content: This hotel and it's surrounding area is a great alternative to the strip; it feels more like Phoenix than Vegas, and I loved it. It's quiet, feels fairly small, and is well kept up. The service was only slightly sub-par, with a few small details lacking, but overall I think this is a great place. If you're looking for a strip casino, this isn't the place, but if you're looking for a quiet, classy alternative, this is for you.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Property”
Reviews.Author: jdsFlanders
Reviews.Content: This property is absolutely gorgeous; we had a one-bedroom suite, beautiful view of mountains, 1-1/2 baths which came in hand travelling with kids; bathroom in bedroom was just beautiful - marble everywhere; beds very comfy; suite was huge, beautiful pool, waterfall, dining by pool, etc. If you're looking for quiet away from the Strip, this is the place. Our only drawback is that we didn't find it very kid friendly - no arcade or anything to do for kids if you want to go to casino in hotel. About 20 minute drive to strip. Other than that, no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Glad we stayed here and not on the Strip!”
Reviews.Author: WorkingParentsof5
Reviews.Content: My wife and I choose this destination for our second honeymoon. We wanted a location that offered good weather, great restaurants, and lots to do. Las Vegas fit the bill nicely. We researched the hotels and felt that the JW would be our best choice. We are confident we made the right choice. If you see some negative reviews of the JW, posted here, they are almost certainly written by people who did not do their homework. If you are looking for round-the-clock, hot-time, Las Vegas excitment; stay on the Strip. That is NOT what you stay at the JW for! We wanted our hotel to be away from all of the noise, congestion, and mobs that you find at the mega-hotels on the Strip. The JW proved to be a beautiful, clean, and serene place to unwind and releax. We visited the Strip three times during our five day stay in Vegas; and it was great being able to escape the madness when we were through with the Strip for the day. In looking at the other reviews posted here, I would have to say that I agree with the overall opinions on the JW's restaurants and food. Basically, not bad, not spectacular. The on-site restaurant, Ceres, did a respectable job with the breakfast buffet. We had our last night's dinner in the JW's Italian-themed restaurant, Spiedini. It was a little underwhelming when compared to some of the the dinners we had outside the JW, but no serious complaints. FYI, if you stay at the JW, be sure to have a "special occasion" dinner at Rosemary's Restaurant, which is nearby. It is the highest Zagat-rated restaurant in the Las Vegas area, and was featured by Rachel Ray on one of the Travel Channel programs, but definitely not "$40 a day"! Our room, a Junior Suite, was large, beautiful and always kept clean by the staff. The bed was very comfortable, with high quality sheets. My only complaint was that it was difficult to get a consistent, comfortable temperature in the room (I like it chilly for sleeping). The staff was always courteous and helpful. The Spa was terrific. The Casino seems geared to the casual gamer. There are a lot of video poker and slot machines that are penny and nickel types. And most of the black jack tables are five or ten dollar minimums (on the weekday anyway). All in all, I highly recommend the JW and would gladly return.

Reviews.Title: “Peace and Quiet”
Reviews.Author: SavvyViewer
Reviews.Content: The hotel is huge. The place is very very clean. I have a bedroom with the double French door with the view of the mountain. The location of the hotel is near restaurants, gas station, and other convenience stores. The hotel is 10 minutes driving distance away from the LV Strip. The mattress and bed linen are so comfortable. It makes me wanted to buy the same mattress that the hotel is using. The bathroom is so big that it has a whirlpool bath, separate shower, separate toilet room, and a double sink. The toiletry is excellent. The free form swimming pool is very big and it has few swimming laps that are 25 meters long. The hotel appearance is well kept. The garden is pleasant to walk through. There are many lounge chairs by the pool. The hotel provides free valet parking. The buffet lunch in the hotel was about $ 9.00, good food and good price. Other time, I ate out. Do not go to the Las Vegas Chinatown, the food is terrible and expensive comparing to New York, Los Angeles, or Toronto. The LV Strip is crowded with people. The exhaust from the cars and hotel’s air conditioner make the place extremely hot. I go into the hotels to cool off. The hotel’s architectural structures and its interior are nice, I took many photographs of Bellagio, Caesar Palace, and Venetian.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Elegance”
Reviews.Author: lvtrvl13
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed at the JW multiple times in the past. This time we decided to stay for an entire week of relaxation. We stayed in a one-bedroom suite and it was wonderful. The service was impeccable as always. We rented a car and traveled to the strip for some shows and dining -- always returning to the quiet elegance of the JW.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: In the countryside, west of London, England
Reviews.Title: “Lovely, comfortable hotel away from the glitz”
Reviews.Author: Lynn of Berkshire
Reviews.Content: It is a pleasure to stay at the JW Marriott Las Vegas Resort. It is an oasis of calm and taste in the nice suburb of Summerlin, yet provides a free shuttle service to the Fashion Show Mall on the Strip when you feel like a little more excitement. The service is efficient, friendly and helpful: they provided a refrigerator for our room at no extra charge (my partner is diabetic and needs to keep his insulin chilled) and a faulty lightbulb in the walk-in wardrobe was changed immediately. The chamber maids are excellent and even let us use their vacuum cleaner to suck the air out of the vacuum bags we used to carry some king sized pillows home to the UK. Our spa-tower bedroom for our four night stay was lovely and large with a balcony, luxurious bathroom and walk-in wardrobe. The selection of restaurants was OK, but not wonderful and they close early in the evening - the choice is very limited unless you eat before 9pm. The Cafe was about the best but, as usual in the USA, the helpings are very large and really need to be shared by two. We ate in the Irish pub on our last night and the food there was quite good. There is a small Starbucks, which is a very good idea, but their croissants and pastries are an utter disappointment for a European when compared with French ones. The pool was disappointing. It is too shallow to swim properly and the poolside cafe was not well stocked and closed early. Apparently there are very few pools deeper than 3 or 4 feet in Las Vegas - except in older hotels - due to insurance company restrictions, which seems silly, since people can drown in a few inches of water in some circumstances. It takes the pleasure out of swimming. Despite large signs everywhere with pool rules prominently saying no diving, at least six people did so during my 45 minute swim one late afternoon - the lifeguard was looking the other way every time, though he must have heard the splashes. The pool did not have a good atmosphere and was a longish walk from the hotel. The cabanas were very basic. The waterfall was nice, though. The shopping centre nearby was huge and comprehensive and had many stores that weren't found on the Strip, including a good supermarket. However, the shuttle bus to the Fashion Show Mall on the Strip was very quick and convenient and the driver even handed out free bottles of chilled water, which was essential in the August heat. Summerlin is a lovely area and the hotel was relaxed and pleasant. It is not as exciting or vibrant as staying on the Strip, but fun nevertheless.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Change of Pace”
Reviews.Author: NVNative
Reviews.Content: I stayed for three nights in late June. As a native of Las Vegas, I don't need the neon hassles of the Strip. My preference is a well maintained hotel with great service. I especially appreciated NOT having to walk through a wall of cigarette smoke to get to my room. The grounds are beautiful and well maintained, the rooms are clean, modern and in good repair (I was amazed at the "worn" comment). The bathrooms are luxurious, the beds comfortable, the couch and chairs worthy of sinking into for a good chat with friends of a late evening. Finally - the staff. Stellar. From the moment I arrived tired, hot and ready to collapse (delayed flights, car rental mix-ups, and a late evening drive through the awful Las Vegas traffic) it was just wonderful. The valet were helpful and courteous, the front desk staff cheerful and professional. The cleaning staff always gave a cheerful "good morning" as I left, and I was greeted by the desk staff when I returned. A minor hiccup upon leaving was quickly and professionally resolved. I was so satisfied I even sent a compliment to Marriott directly. To those who say only "over-50" would stay there, surprise - I'm not and will not only stay there again but will highly recommend it for anyone looking for a great oasis of calm and refinement in Las Vegas. Sure, if all you want is pink neon, this is not your place.

Reviews.Title: “WOW, Vegas family vacation with small kids”
Reviews.Author: internationalokie
Reviews.Content: I actually registered so I could comment on this outstanding stay. I live and die by the reviews of trip advisor because they are always right on. Just got back from the JW for the second time this year and can't say enough about this place. We booked our stay using points in that my husband is a platinum member. We have stayed at literally hundreds of Marriott’s and this place is right on par with some of the top places out there. I would compare it to the JW in Hawaii or the Marriott in Maui-of course minus the ocean. I love the idea that it is off the strip. We came to reconnect as a family and relax, relax, relax. by the pool. I must stay we are usually very low key guests, but honestly this stay we were nothing short of a nightmare and every time we asked for something random they came through. First of all, Danielle a manager was so completely friendly and hooked us up with the most incredible 2-bedroom suite you have ever seen. I sound like an ambassador but honestly this place was unreal. I was something like 2200 square feet. We were traveling with our 2 young and very dirtily kids (1 & 3). We asked for a high chair and it was done. We asked for a microwave and it was done. Extra blankets-done, pack and play-done. Last minute babysitter-done. Be sure to use around the clock childcare and ask for Rose. She is simply the sweetest grandmother I have ever met. My daughter still prays for her every night. Diane the concierge was outstanding with her resourcefulness and seasoned so she is very up front about what she can get done-which is everything I asked of her. She even ordered room service for us to be delivered because we were at the pool and needed dinner ready when we got up to the room. The girls that get drinks at the pool were everywhere and very attentive. They offer buckets of water by the pool as well. They have a big shallow area of kids to place and steps to the deep end. All the parents congregated here and it was very fun. They have a very large waterfall that gives you a great sound. I heard they are building a water slide too. The housekeeping was outstanding and spoke English-which is not the norm elsewhere. They vacuumed up my diamond earring and actually took the time to take their vac apart and try to find it, which they did. I was so surprised and completely relieved. The bathroom tub was so nice and so big. Big enough for my whole family. I love the idea that they have fans in the bedrooms in that no place ever has these because they get unbalanced and are hard to service. The air rocked. We ordered room service most of the time and it was great. We ordered mac and cheese 4-5 times and they made it fresh and gourmet like for the kids. My husband went downstairs and ordered food from the fancy restaurants and brought it up for us to eat. We loved, loved loved the Spianni (sp?)Restaurant downstairs. I really thought it was a great deal for the quality and quantity of the food. We had take out from there 3 times and every time it was very flavorful and fresh. The chicken parm is very good and very Italian. There appetizers are sooo good. The bread is to die for. We had fish and chips at the Irish pub once and they were okay-the batter was bland. The sushi place downstairs had outstanding sushi. I heard the rest of the menu was not good at all. Starbucks pastries were incredible. I am usually not a fan of there pastries but these were super fresh and very unstarbuckies. The restaurant by the casino is outstanding for a cafe type place. Honestly, this was some of the best food in the hotel believe it or not. The service was incredible and the food even better. The food at the pool was not so great. The hamburger is pool quality meat. We gambled over at the Redrock, which is a very swanky hotel, and very fun to visit for a more Vegas feel. I love that they have a bowling alley and a movie theater. Plus the coolest thing is they have check in childcare so you can gamble or have a nice dinner. You must send in your kid’s shots records 3 weeks in advance so they can make sure everyone is covered since it is such an international clientele. There are tons of restaurants and shopping around the JW as well. I have been on tons of vacations and the amount of space this place provides with the quality of the service makes it a much go back to family vacation place in Vegas. Doing Vegas with kids would not be a good idea on the strip, but if you are okay with getting a sitter (ROSE with around the clock) then your time in Vegas can include both partyng and family time-Which is super rare! We did the Red rock drive to see the rocks and I hate to say it but it was a bunch of different colored rocks. The management of this place is on top of everything and made our stay very boutique like even though this place is very big. I say this in that everytime we turned around we were taken care of even without knowing we were platnium members and in the swanky suite that my daughter referred to as the "castle"

Reviews.Title: “Gotta Love It!”
Reviews.Author: Crheli
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the JW Marriot in August and had a great time. The one bedroom suite was huge and well decorated. We loved the bathroom that had a large jetted tub and the enclosed shower with a rain head. All the ammenities we used like the day spa were excellent. All the staff were pleaseant and professional and we're looking forward to coming back. I would 100% recommend this hotel to anybody who wants to relax away from the strip!

Reviews.Title: “Not the best place if you're looking for an awesome stay in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Love2Travel247
Reviews.Content: Rooms are very roomy and the bathroom is impressive. I stayed on the 3rd floor with a balcony and patio furniture..the only positives about this hotel. Location is too far from everything nice. You have to take a taxi everywhere. The restaurants were sub-par. The hotel only provides shuttle to the strip every 2 hours and it fills up very quickly. You have to be in line about an hour to guarantee a shot on the shuttle. They never mentioned on the phone or disclosed on their website that there's a $50 incidental charge per night of stay when you use your debit card at check-in. They also failed to disclose a $25 charge per person for the shuttle to the airport. This is my second visit to Vegas. I'm glad it wasn't my first, because based on this hotel, I wouldn't come back. I stayed at Green Valley Ranch in 2005. It far exceeded my expectations. I recommend GVR if you are looking for a wonderful stay, being close to the strip and more bang for the buck. Don't waste your time at the JW Marriott Las Vegas...

Reviews.Title: “not very exciting”
Reviews.Author: noel75
Reviews.Content: I was disappointed resort does not live up to number 2 rank hotel in Las Vegas. I've been to many hotels on the strip that are far better . Rooms in Spa Tower have worn out feeling . Good for families AND conventions . Pool area OK but pool service inexistent . Little action at the casino . Certainly not for people looking for " fun" in Las Vegas , deserves 3 stars not more . I will not return . FO

Reviews.Title: “Oasis in torrid Vegas”
Reviews.Author: GlobeVagabond
Reviews.Content: Stayed there twice in July 2007. Room was vast and stuffed with amenities, even a personal jacuzzi. Outdoor pool and gardens have the ambiance of a lifelike oasis. Unfortunately pool hours are restraint. Staff is rather stiff and unhelpful, courtesy isn't corresponding to the generosity of the hotel's architecture. So called business center is mini and hardly usable. Restaurant row in the Casino part of the Resort closes too early on Sunday evenings. The Starbucks is the only remedy there. All in all a good alternative for people seeking for an alternative to the Strip's frenzy. Located on the outskirts of Northwestern Las Vegas, the J.W.Marriott is to be considered even if it clearly lacks a five star hotel service.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, but not for anyone under 50”
Reviews.Author: Indy J
Reviews.Content: This resort property is very large, but it doesn't really feel like Vegas because it is so far away from the Strip. You could have a similar experience in Palm Springs at a resort with a golf course. The rooms were beautiful, new and very large. It just didn't feel like Vegas, most everyone at the hotel was over 50, it is not the plae to go if you are in your 20s and looking for a "Vegas, baby, Vegas" weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Make sure to get a room with a balcony”
Reviews.Author: travelchick19
Reviews.Content: I originally made the reservation with the hotel and was told we would get a room with a balcony. When we arrived I was told that those rooms were sold out way in advance. Although disappointed we were shown to an alternate room and were told to check with the concierge later in the week for availability. It wasn't until we had unpacked and went downstairs to scope out the property that we ran into the concierge for our tower. I told her to keep us in mind for a balcony room. She immediately checked out the availability in our tower and gave us the keys to a balcony room. Happily, we switched rooms out. If you care about not feeling claustrophobic then request a room with a balcony. Our room was small for the rate we paid. We usually stay at the Venetian for the same rate. But I must say the bed is the best bed I have ever slept on. The room had the usual amenities, great walk in closet, nice size jacuzzi tub and the waterfall shower head. We never had a problem with the hot water running out and it was nice to go into a hot jacuzzi after spending time playing tennis all day. Now for the balcony...It's nice to relax on the balcony as long as you don't have any neighbors doing the same thing on either side of you. In a five night stay we only ran into our neighbors twice. As far as the breakfast is concerned, we booked a rate which included breakfast for two in the cafe. The view from the restaurant outside was gorgeous. It was nice to look at the ponds and waterfalls. The best thing at the cafe are the belgian waffles. They melt in your mouth and you can't help but eat more than one serving. There's a great omelette bar, fruit, and your usual baked goodies. The only thing that kind of bothered us was when you went to the omelette bar a separate tip jar sat on the counter. Without our breakfast vouchers, breakfast would of easily been at least $30. Being pressured into tipping even more so early in the morning for someone to make your omelettes was annoying. Now if you don't get a room with breakfast, the Starbucks inside the casino has good pastries. I found out that the hotel makes them fresh for Starbucks. It's also open 24 hours in case you have the munchies. I think the best part of the hotel is not the outdor pool but the Gym/Spa. It's worth the $25 bucks to work out in it every day. Equipped with your above average machines you won't have to wait for a cardio machine or fight over free weights. It's beautiful, spacious yet private. The women's lockerroom/spa area is clothing optional so when you walk to use the sauna, steam room and jacuzzi, there's a state of undress which I would prefer to reserve for the privacy of my own home. In addition, they give you flip flops, a robe and a locker key for your $25 so you can use the facilities after working out. If you forgot a hairdryer, hair brush, lotion, shampoo they got it all, including a nice water and fruit bar for your convenience. The grounds are lovely and very green. You certainly don't feel like your in Las Vegas. It was our first time to stay away from the Strip and I think it's a nice hotel if you have a family and want to stay away from the hustle and bustle. As far as variety of restaurants they weren't lacking. A short drive to the nearby SunCoast and strip malls offer your usual chain varieties...PF Chang's, etc.. By the way, we ate at the pool since it was recommended by one of the reviews. We had a lame burger, a tuna tartare salad and two drinks. It was a $40 waste of time. You're better off hopping into the car and finding something else. All in all it was a nice hotel but for the same hotel rate I'd prefer a suite at the Ritz or the Four Seasons.

Reviews.Title: “Great, peaceful place off the strip!”
Reviews.Author: blondiegrl05
Reviews.Content: We picked the resort because it was where our conference was located, and we were not disappointed! The property is definitely above average. Really nice, well kept. Our room: We had a regular king room, but it had great high celings, tastefully decorated, HUGE walk-in-closet, and a huge bathroom with a huge jacuzzi tub. It was not crammed at all! We loved the tub, as it was one of those that was big enough for both my husband and I to stretch out completely in the tub and still have plenty of room. The shower had the regular showerhead, but it also had the option of the rain down shower head from above - which was cool too. And I always sleep well on Marriott beds. Restaurants: We had dinner at the Japanese place, lunch at the restaurant right next to the casino, and breakfast at the Ceres restaurant. The Japanese place was decent. Not amazing, but I would say it was pretty good for an in-resort type restaurant. We had sushi which was tasty. At the lunch place, we split a Mediterranean salad that was really delicious and pretty cheap if I remember correctly. And for the breakfast at Ceres, we both did the buffet, which was really good and had lots of variety, but it was a little pricey for a breakfast buffet - $15/person. Casino: Didn't spend any time there. It was smoky, which I hate, and had lots of old people. Again, we were here for a conference, not gambling. Landscaping/Property: The whole resort is covered in these beautiful lush plants, and they do a great job of curving pathways all throughout the large property. Many waterfalls too. The pool was also very nice and had lots of families enjoying the weather. All in all, enjoyed our stay. It was really peaceful and a nice change from the hustling, bustling hotel/casinos on the strip. Although we loved our stay, I would say that if you are planning on doing everything on and around the strip, you might not be as interested in staying here as it is 20-25 minutes off of the strip. But if you came to relax when you're not touring the sights, this might be a good place for you!

Reviews.Title: “A first class stay!”
Reviews.Author: PandK07
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here several times over the past few years and we both enjoy being away from the hustle and bustle of the strip. The spa, grounds and pool are great. We rented a cabana and enjoyed it with our family. The rooms are large and very comfortable. We have stayed in the standard rooms up to a suite and all are great. The Rampart casino's size is perfect for the hotel plus we found that many locals play there also (always a good sign). We have been luckier there than at any of the strip casinos. Our recommendation is to rent a car and make the drive to the strip if you want to pick up a show (we saw Phantom of the Opera) or walk through the casinos and then drive back to the peacefulness of the JW Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “A Fantastic Stay”
Reviews.Author: Dayne33
Reviews.Content: We generally stay at the Nugget, but wanted to stay somewhere new this trip. We loved the J.W. - rooms were fantastic, pool was beautiful and service was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Nice for a break from the strip ”
Reviews.Author: furiousgeorge
Reviews.Content: My husband & I have just got back from 12 nights in Las Vegas. We spent the first 6 on the Strip, then 3 nights at the JW Marriott before heading back to the Strip for the last 3. The taxi there took about 20 minutes, and cost about $35. We arrived at 12, but as our room wasn't ready we were given a temporary pass so that we could use the pool while we waited. The pool area is lovely, with very comfy sunbeds, and plenty of them. The parasols are limited though so if you want one you probably need to be down quite early. There's a poolside cafe too, which has a nice selection of food - salads/wraps/burgers/ice creams. Our room was ready at about 3, and was in the Spa Tower on the 6th (top) floor. The room was a really good size, with a very comfy bed and a balcony which looked onto the golf course (we could also see the Strip to our left). The bathroom was huge and gorgeous, with a whirlpool bath and separate walk-in rain shower. The was a cooler in the room, and every day bottles of water were left for us. For dining, we went to the Irish Pub, Speidinis, and The Carmel Room, all of which were very nice. The casino (Rampart's) was good, we were luckier here than at any of the hotels on the Strip as I won at Blackjack and my husband won $400 on a 1cent slot machine! We didn't realise until we got there, but there's a free shuttle that runs to and from the Strip which we used when we went back. It stops at the Fashion Show Mall (opposite the Wynn), but the driver kindly dropped us off at our last hotel (caeser's palace). There's also a shuttle to Mcarran airport, but I think you have to pre-book this and there's a $25 charge each. Overall this was a really nice hotel if you want a quiter break away from the Strip. It's also not as huge, and is a nice size to walk around without getting lost!

Reviews.Title: “Oasis away from The Strip”
Reviews.Author: SE-Explorer
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the JW Marriott, just to try it out. It’s about ½ hour drive through harrowing construction on the highway. The hotel is lovely, quiet oasis and definitely a change of pace from The Strip. Bedrooms are as large & nice, luxurious bathrooms and great pool area. We stumbled into a separate pool area that was very quiet without the hoards of screaming kids. We didn’t realize it but this was part of the spa and there is a separate charge of $25 – which we thought was outrageous & petty, especially for this level of hotel. We were directed to the “normal” workout room that was essentially a hotel room, low ceilings, stripped, with a few machines – very unappealing. For this reason alone, we would not return here this was more of a self-contained hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Gigantic rooms, bathrooms for a great price”
Reviews.Author: eyehearttravel
Reviews.Content: I attended a conference in this hotel. Was worried about its off strip status though I shouldn't have been. The room was gigantic, well appointed with a walk in closet and couch. The bathroom had a walk in, rain shower and a spa tub. Service was great and room service was tasty. The pool was great. The trip to the strip in the rented car only took about 15 minutes. I parked at TI, which is always free, and went on from there. It was a different las vegas experience but a good one in that it was quiet, relaxing and a bargain for the service you get compared to the prices on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place away from strip”
Reviews.Author: Wolverine22
Reviews.Content: Hotel has some nice amenties and service was good. Rooms are very nice except the TV's are old. Pool area was nice. Drive to strip is about 20 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: RachelKansasCity
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the JW at the beginning of June for a family wedding. The resort is gorgeous, but, very large and it is very easy to mixed up between the two towers when you are searching for your room. Best thing is to get a map of the grounds from the desk and keep it with you. We stayed in a one bedroom suite and it was fabulous. I can't say enough nice things about the resort and the grounds. It is perfection. The 24 hour Starbucks is a nice feature. Ate dinner at Spiedinis-the food and service was very good. I think if it was cooler ( 103 ) we could have eaten on the patio, which looked lovely. Had lunch at the Irish pub-food was very good, waitresses were from Ireland for a nice touch. Room service was prompt and as ordered. For a hotel, the food was amazingly good. The negatives- Check in was a hassle. We were told we could check in early-we had a block of rooms reserved. Only one room was ready early and the rest of us had to cool our heels in the lobby for 2 hours, until the normal check in time. Which would have been ok, but, we arranged flight arrivals for early check in as we were guaranteed that the rooms would be ready early. There was not a lot of love from the check in desk. But, we had such a marvelous time-that snafu was soon forgotten. We had been to The Strip many times previously, so we were not in a rush to go to the casinos there. Which was a good thing-as traffic ,especially returning to the hotel in Summerlin, was horrible. Road construction was to blame. I would recommend the JW for those who want a wonderful resort experience , with an occasional foray to The Strip.

Reviews.Title: “Solid and Impressive, but not a "Vegas" Hotel/Resort”
Reviews.Author: Siameseowner
Reviews.Content: I just returned from the JW Marriott Las Vegas, having spent four nights for a company meeting. This place has a lot to offer. They definitely have their act together when it comes to service. Long business meetings can be stressful and this hotel's staff made the experience much better. The resort is lush. First, it's beautiful and the grounds/pool are equally impressive. No problems on aesthetics . . . . rooms are up to date with marble foyer, patterned sisal carpet, pretty furnishings, etc. The bedroom area is outfitted with something comparable to a "heavenly bed" -very cloud like - - layered fresh, white sheets/duvet and the most comfortable collection of starched, clean pillows. This hotel feels a little like a Ritz. The marble bathroom has a wow factor. . . entirely marble (walls, floor, etc) w/ a soothing "rain shower" in a separate enclosure with bench, etc. giant jacuzzi tub in the corner that sits below mirrored walls - granite countertops -- luxurious. The Room Service was smooth and seamless and reasonably priced. I enjoyed breakfast three mornings and dinner one evening. In the interest of space, I won't describe every crouton, but suffice to say, you get precisely what you order and it's timely. It bears mentioning that the room service dinner I had was as good as some of the meals I've eaten at restaurants in Wynn ! - JW Mar. offers a Pan Roasted Halibut dinner w/ braised leeks and fingerling potatoes w/ a watercress, lemon sauce - - outstanding - - dessert was sinfully delicious (apple tart - baked just before it arrived) - mixed greens salad was large and fresh with thin slices of green apple and apple cider viniagrette. Three olive rolls and one whole wheat roll was on the cart w/butter. I was in heaven. One morning, I threw a curve to the guy taking the phone orders for breakfast, asking for a few substitutions. I was skeptical that it would arrive with the correct changes. It did. Nice! The lady who takes the room service orders needs to familiarize herself with the menu. My only complaint is that she was totally unaware of the specials they offer with regard to a free half bottle of wine when you order a three course dinner. She didn't know what the "Good Start" breakfast included - - a little annoying. One evening ( stayed on 5th floor) Vegas had high winds and it sounded like the french doors in my room were going to bust open. Imagine the way a tea pot sounds when it's "going off" only much more angry. I called the front desk and within minutes an engineer arrived and he stayed for over twenty minutes, attaching additional weather stripping until the doors were silent. I'm not going to "ding" the hotel for this because I valued the prompt response and attention that was offered to me. These folks are masters of service and it shows. Everyone had a smile and was eager to help in any way they could. I forgot my toothbrush and within a few minutes one was delivered to me with a sample of toothpaste. There's a 24 hour Starbucks near the Casino. What's nice about this hotel is that it's a hotel/resort with a casino - not the other way around. I find that most places in Vegas are smoke filled casinos with hotels attached. Now, as for my PITA (Pain in the [--] ) Factor: The tub was gorgeous but I didn't have time to use it and I'm glad because there were two stray, "ahem" pubic or some type of hairs on the side. I didn't call housekeeping, but I bet that if I did, they would have immediately sent someone to clean it. Also, the one drinking glass in my bathroom had a residue in the bottom (let's hope it was soap) - the other glasses were clean as a whistle. The worst, however, was the smell in the corridor of our meeting rooms. We spent four days in the Conference Center and certain areas had a sewage smell. Not all of our meeting areas were plagued with this odor, but it was very strong where they had our snack/break tables set up. It was bad. Back to the room: The toiletries are high end and displayed in a nice little wooden crate w/ wash cloths - - - Overall, this is a really nice place - I'd definitely stay there again. Still, it's not a "Vegas" hotel - it's a good twenty minute drive from the Strip. For that reason, I'd probably stay somewhere else on a personal trip to Vegas. For business, this place is upscale and delivers. Tasteful, elegant, solid.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the entire place”
Reviews.Author: slotlvr
Reviews.Content: Hubby and I went to JW courtesy of points with friends. We had the best time. Have been to LV many a time and this was a great get away from the Strip! The casino was enough to get your fill and the pool was awesome. The pool has a quite and luxurous atmoshpere! Palm trees, cabanas, sand volleyball and horseshoes is you want! The restaurants on the other hand could be more. The cafe, was good and cheap, but if your duration is longer you will want to venture out for that. The rooms are fab! The bathrooms and shower was great-two sinks too! This hotel had the BEST pillows I have ever put my tired head on-pacific coast! Very important while sleeping away from home! Would definitely go back, quite, luxurous and nice prices!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Room - Beautiful Grounds - Very Nice Area”
Reviews.Author: belltown
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 2 night getaway to Las Vegas and loved the JW Marriott! It is a beautiful hotel with gorgeous grounds and lovely views of the surrounding mountains. We have been to Las Vegas twice before and enjoyed Mandalay Bay but this was a more relaxing hotel. No walking a mile just to get to the pool here. The pool was a nice size and not too crowded - arrive early to get a chair near the pool. The waterfall was not working the weekend I was there. They had 2 guys and a steel drum performing on the weekend - nice atmosphere when you are on a vacation. We would not hesitate to bring our children here next time. The rooms are some of the largest I've seen. We had a regular room in the Palms Tower and it was huge. Our friends were next door in a suite that had a very large balcony and a very spacious living room as well as a large bedroom. Definately worth the extra money if you would like a place to meet up with friends/family before hitting the strip. The 1 bedroom had a small fridge and a wet bar. We had a view of the grounds and could see the strip as well. We rented a car and drove to the strip - about 20 minutes - parking at the strip resorts was easy and the way to go. No walking our feet off on this trip. We would highly recommend this type of Vegas experience if you don't have to be in the middle of all the action the whole time.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, but eat elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: uteParkCityUtah
Reviews.Content: Our family (2 adults and 2 children under 7) were in Vegas for a wedding and we stayed at the Summerlin JW Marriott due to its proximity to reception venue. The rooms were great for the price of $289 for the Jr. Suites. As described the other posts the rooms were well apponted with the exception of the TVs. Housekeeping and engineering were extremely responsive. A fact that is a big deal when you are traveling with kids. I would not recomend eating on the property at all. The service is surly at best if you happen to be unlucky enough to actually interact with a food and beverage emlpoyee. And once the food eventually arrives you are treated to a very poor dinng experience. The pool is a let down after you see the pictures on the website, the water fall was not operational. Similar to the F & B people the pool staff seem to be more interested in catching up on their social life than actually working the crowd. Summary: great value on the rooms, great house keeping, engineering and valet staff. A good value for a very nice and quiet stay off of the Strip. Just drive down Rampart or go to the Strip to eat.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel (VERY QUIET)”
Reviews.Author: beachartist
Reviews.Content: Just got back. Very beautiful hotel and lovely pool with plenty of lounge chairs. Too bad the waterfall was not working. Apparently it has been broken for sometime now. Old 50's music is played by the pool. I grew up with that stuff and I am tired of hearing it. Wanted to hear some recent music, we are in Vegas! The hotel was very clean and neat with beautiful views of Red Rock. The bathroom was spacious with separate toilet room, whirlpool tub and a shower with a rainhead and a regular shower nozzel. Not much water pressure. Double sinks and extras. The refrigerator is a large cooler, it states that is not a refrigerator but a cooler, OK. The bed was comfortable with very soft sheets. Small TV that did not work well. The iron was broken and a new one was brought up quickly with friendly service. The cafe next to the casino inside was cheap and good. There is also a Starbucks located in the hotel next to the casino. The restaurant/cafe inside the hotel was expensive. The casino was sparse with people and the people that were in there were probably not a day younger than 60 and had walkers, oxygen tanks and lots of cigerettes. This is NOT your hotel if you are looking for action. Go to the strip. This hotel is VERY QUIET except for maybe the pool where the kids suddenly come out of the woodwork. You also have to pay for in-room internet access, $10.00 for 24hrs. Most hotels have free wireless. If you want to go to the strip and you have no car they have a shuttle service with a $25 per person fee. If you just want rest, relaxation, peace and quiet with some gambling and golf this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Not the real Vegas Experience”
Reviews.Author: OzTourist26
Reviews.Content: Don't get me wrong, you will get luxury at this resort. However, to get the real Vegas experience I would recommend one of the luxury resorts on or near to the Strip. Coming from Australia, we stayed 2 nights in a cheap motel just off the strip (obviously you don't go to America's Best Value Inn if looking for luxury!!). However, we wanted 1 night of luxury so chose the JW based on the cheaper price for a suite and great reviews on this site (was a Friday night so anywhere on the strip was too pricey). We had a junior suite, which was huge and absolutely luxurious. The resort pool and whirlpool also nice. We ate at a quiet italian restaurant within the resort complex and tried our luck on the pokies (failed with the luck). But really when in Vegas you want to be amongst the action and variety of the Strip!

Reviews.Title: “Much better than Ritz Carlton”
Reviews.Author: Travellingcloudy
Reviews.Content: The night before we stayed at the RItz Carlton which wasn't very good at all. The follwing night we switched to the JW Marriott Resort in Summerlin. SUmmerlin is a ver nice area and the Marriott was excellent, a much bigger room than the Ritz Carlton and everythign worked. Although they could do with flat screens tv and throw out their old fashioned tv sets! Otherwise no complaints at all. The swimming pool area is great. The atmosphere is very relaxed compared to a hotel on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “An Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DRU2C
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a holiday in Phoenix via Las Vegas and stayed in the J W Marriott on our first and last nights. We have been to Las Vegas several times but have always previously stayed in a hotel on the strip but this time we decided on somewhere a bit quieter. On reading the reviews of this hotel we decided to give it a try and were not disappointed. The hotel and surrounding grounds were lovely and the staff very friendly, helpful and courteous. We only had time to try Ceres restaurant and that was excellent. Our room was very large, extremely clean and the bathroom was the biggest we have found in any hotel that we have stayed in. Our room had a balcony which overlooked the golf course and we could see the strip lit-up in the evenings. This is a superb hotel and we would certainly return again. Thoroughly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: jddssc121
Reviews.Content: off the strip (20 min or so) but if you're willing to make the drive, it is a outstanding hotel. tad pricey, but worth it. if you want the best on the strip, check out the Signature at the MGM Grand.

Reviews.Title: “Nice change from the usual Strip experience”
Reviews.Author: kek
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the JW Marriott for 3 nights in the middle of April 2007 for a work related trip. The hotel is about 40 minutes from the airport, far enough to be away from the crazy traffic and non-stop frenzied Strip activity. All in all a good stay, couple detailed thoughts below: Check in - NOT the highlight of my visit. When booked, there was no mention of the different "towers" that the rooms are in. There are several and they are spread out quite far apart. The desk rep cheerfully stated that it was only a 5-10 minute walk and that there was plenty of signage to direct you to the right tower. Yeah right! Most of the sign swere pointing at Palm trees or the small water ponds. I have to say though, the walkways were pretty and well maintained. Even though the aformentioned 5-10 minute walk was more like 20-30 it was pretty. Restaurants - Ate at Spiedini's on property. Decent food and service in the restaurant, great staff and service in the bar. Had room service one evening, not an extensive choice off the menu but everything was good and came very quickly. Rooms - Spotless, and even the standard room was huge compared to most hotels. The bathroom was GREAT, I want that shower in my house! Separate jacuzzi tub as well. If you choose not to rent a car, try having the concierge reserve a car for you to the airport, it was cheaper than the cab. All in all a nice trip, lot less noise and drama that you usually see in Vegas. Would certainly go back again! Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: MICTTX
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during the first week of April and was just truly amazed at how nice the property was. The service at the front desk, restaurants, parking attendants was top notch. The restaurants were really good and the grounds were very well maintained. Rooms were spacious and we had a great view of the mountains. Will absolutely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “overall loved the JW Marriott”
Reviews.Author: kellybristow
Reviews.Content: Overall we had a great stay. I would recommend exploring the company's website to get the most out of your stay...forget the strip everything you need is here!!! If you need to go on the strip you will definitely be reminded that you got the better place to stay!!! Our only complait was the valet service. IT was complimentary but we all know to tip. That notwithstanding, they dont open doors for you (as a female standing while my husband loaded our own luggage into the truck-waiting for my door to be unlocked)....that aspect they could improve. Just park your own car and enjoy your stay. Great food and loved the Irish pub (a bit pricey but great nonetheless).

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: Jeanette87
Reviews.Content: This hotel is so fabolus, i loved it! The hotel itself is very beautiful, the service is great, the rooms were big, the hotel has 6 retstaurants, spa, boutiques, large pools, casino and everything you can ask for. Our room had to large queenbeds, gardenview and a jacuzzi:) If you go to Las Vegas, you should defentely stay at this hotel. OK, it's expensive but its worth it! And the location is grest as well, 5-10 min from downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Romancing the Wife”
Reviews.Author: noodle28
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just finished a Thursday-Monday romantic retreat to the JW in Summerlin. What a wonderful suprise!! The hotel sits adjacent to two golf courses and a mile away from TPC Canyons course(a nice walk). We both felt as if we weren't even in Vegas. No crowds, No rush, No loud casino noise as you get off the elevator. The casino was quaint and very freindly. It's about a 100 yd walk down the hallway. The restuarants were excellent. A great Irish Pub to watch some March Madness Basketball, an excellent Japanese spot with a fresh Sushi Bar. We also ate at the Carmel Room in the casino for dress-up night and they put us at a table with curtains for privacy. Our room was great. It had two french doors opening in with a view of the Strip Hotels at night. It had a huge bathroom with jaccuzzi tub and walk-in shower that had a normal shower head and a waterfall shower head which was comforting after a late and successful Craps session. My wife used the spa three days, myself once. She had a swedish(great!), stone(even better!!) and foot massage(so-so). Each for around $100-150 apiece w/tip. The pool was not crowded and very nice, towels, cabanas, food, great service and their famous Rosemary bushes. We also went to to Red Rock casino for lunch and wow! What an Architectural dream, very nice. We did however, opt to get back to our place to avoid the noise and crowds after about 3 hrs. We are already thinking about when to return.

Reviews.Title: “A Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PatKBoston
Reviews.Content: This was an absolutely lovely hotel. Our room was large and beautifully appointed. The casino was on the small size but big enough for us. The grounds were extensive and pleasant to roam around in. The food was very good. We ate at the 24/7 cafe, the Japanese restaurant, the Irish Pub and the buffet breakfast. It was very nice to be away from the strip but you will need a car to get around. We would stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury tucked away in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: orp
Reviews.Content: This hotel (resort) is a bit "out of the way" from central Vegas and the strip, but there is an excellent shuttle service and for us it was just perfect to be in Vegas and still have the added benefit of a tranquil setting in the usual JW luxury. Service is excellent, everything is clean and well kept and the pool area is awesome. There is a Starbuck on site and numerous restaurants. We had dinner one evening in the "cafeteria" by the gambling hall, it is OK for a quick bite, but overpriced and not really any good. I guess some of the other restaurants are better. The food at the pool bar is actually great value for money. Breakfast is the usual game, but we ordered from the menu and it was a pleasant surprise. Comming from europe, we are still amazed by the size of the portions, so order with caution :-)) All in all a very nice property in a good location with the usual smooth and pampering service from Marriott. A small tip: if the temperature is in the red area, book one of the pool cabanas with cooling mist, nice shade and good service.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay at the JW Marriott”
Reviews.Author: kadelia
Reviews.Content: Just completed a three night stay in the Spa Tower of the Jw Marriott in Summerlin...17 miles from the Strip (which was exactly how we liked it...but be aware you are a $35 taxi ride away!) The rooms are huge and spacious (almost felt like they needed more furniture) and the bathrooms have in room jacuzzi's or soaking tubs (make sure you request what you prefer at check-in...I would have preferred the opposite of what we got). The bathrooms are huge, with a wonderful dual showerhead and a very unique vent system...no foggy mirrors and yet it was whisper quiet...very impressive. Large walk in closets with an ironing board, special water for the irons, all the little extras. One stupid thing (and yes, its a stupid thing) is that the in room "refrigerator" at the mini bar is not a refrigerator! It's a cooler. There is a note on it stating if you need a refrigerator to call housekeeping and they'll bring one in. Let's save a few pennies on electricity, hmmm? As we stayed in the winter, we did not take advantage of the outdoor pools...although while walking the grounds I must say it was impressive. The entire outdoor property had winding paths, pools and waterfalls with palm trees and lots of rock--breathtaking. The views from the Spa Tower restaurant were stunning...floor to ceiling windows with waterfalls everywhere. Dining options in the resort were limited, but we found the Japanese restaurant to be exceptional ( the sushi was very, very good!) The casino is basically full of locals, who all love the Rampart Buffet (cheap food for cheap). The resort is a huge convention hotel, so you also have to deal with conventioners...we got the Catastrophe Leadership seminar (these people looked down right depressed at the end of each day!) The spa services were very nice; the work out room with the spa cost $25 a day (waived if you had a spa service). The free workout room alternative was a joke. I highly recommend the salon; Andrea gave the nicest manicure and pedicure I've ever had (I even drug my husband in for a pedicure I was so impressed by her!) If you son't like staying on the Strip and its not the reason you come to Vegas, the JW is very nice. If you love the Strip, this is not the place for you!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort”
Reviews.Author: krnCalifornia
