Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel and grounds. We loved the layout and the fact that it had all the amenities you want when your on vacation. The staff were very nice - everyone said hello and made eye contact. The gift shop staff were more than nice. I forgot a rubber band for my hair and instead of making me buy an entire pack they gave me a free one! The room was fantastic and especially loved the bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Needs more upgrades”
Reviews.Author: aurrora98
Reviews.Content: I stayed here Jan 3-5, 2007. They were almost finished with a complete lobby renovation, and it will be fantastic. Too bad the rest of the property is not getting the same attention. The rooms are OK, but at $299-$314 per night, not a good value. The hallways and door frames are very tired, and the elevator in the back, looked like a freight elevator - as it was so beat up. I don't think its worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: EmiliaBerksUK
Reviews.Content: stayed here for our 1st night in vegas, well worth the money and we found it much more relaxing than our next hotel bellagio in vegas. Rooms very spacious and staff very friendly, breakfast was a good selection and staff there also good. Wish we had another night so we could enjoy the facilites!! Definatley well worth it but is a tiny bit far from the strip so a car is needed

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a weekend getaway!”
Reviews.Author: superfly111
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at this property for the Las Vegas Marathon weekend, and we were impressed from start to finish. From giving us directions when we got lost trying to find the property to offering us bottled water when we returned from a training run to giving us a late checkout (2pm!) to better accomodate our marathon schedule, the staff was nothing but polite, helpful and genuinely interested in our comfort. Even the housekeeping staff was friendly and pleasant! The property in general is very well-kept (as you'd expect from a JW Marriott property) and the oversize rooms are well-appointed (luxurious linens, great pillows, marble floors, rainfall showerheads) and meticulously clean. We had a junior suite in the Palms Tower and it was absolutely enormous! My friend and I both made appointments at the Aquae Sulis Spa and despite the steep prices (way higher than even Chicago or Orange County where we are from, respectively), we were pleasantly surprised to learn that each booking included complimentary all-day use of all the spa's other facilities, including yoga classes, the steam room, the lounge, etc. We didn't spend any time in the hotel's casino but it looked to have the basic requirements. Food in the restaurants was solid (we ate in Ceres and another one, the name escapes me) -- nothing award-winning but definitely good and the serving staff, once again, was very attentive. If you stay at this property, it would be wise to rent a car as it's about 20 mins. outside of town and cab fare to and from the Strip would be pricey (the drive, however, is very straightforward.) If you're looking for a quieter, more peaceful Las Vegas experience, this resort ranks high on my list.

Reviews.Title: “Superb accommodations!”
Reviews.Author: ZiCam
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this location just after Thanksgiving and loved it!!! Location away from the strip was a definite plus for peace, quiet, and restful night sleeps. 24 hour Starbucks located within hotel was a pleasant added bonus for me personally and the option to have the breakfast buffet EVERY morning (not just on weekends), was another added bonus to my stay! Front desk staff was friendly and very accommodating and saw to each and every need I may have had. Moreover, did I mention the wonderful snuggly, comfortable bed I slept in each night, what a great way to end each exhausting day. Linens were clean, plush and felt and looked brand new; added amenities also included nice plush area rugs at each bathroom sink and even the luxury of a telephone in the bathroom to prevent one from any interruption from mother nature's calling!!!!! A jewel of a treat whenever visiting Las Vegas; a MUST stay!

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Bag”
Reviews.Author: JohnsonProf
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a two night stay in a 2 BR suite. The good: huge room - two big BRs, 2 1/2 baths with huge master and jacuzzi tubs, dining table for 6, wrap around patio, bar. The bad: Furniture looked like it had been dragged in - scratched and scrapes everywhere. The ugly: generally bad service (45 mins for toothpaste to be delivered) and mediocre food. Far from the strip. I would recommend for families who do not want to be on the strip, need space, and want to be able to get in and out without walking through a casino. Otherwise there are much, much better hotels in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel & Nice Shower”
Reviews.Author: hawkmanva
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for business but could have easily stayed here for pleasure. My room had a ceiling fan (which is odd for hotels), a huge bathroom with a wirlpool tub, separate shower with this awesome shower head than rains down from the ceiling, and a volume control to hear the tv from the other room. Free in-room safe. Beds were awesome as well, really comfortable. The hotel also sounded quiet which is nice when you are trying to sleep (I know you aren't suppose to sleep in Vegas).

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: TrvlDva
Reviews.Content: We only stayed at this hotel for one night in August, but we throughly enjoyed our stay. Had an incredibly large room, and an even more impressive bathroom (jacuzzi tub with a separate shower). The beds were a big plus - very comfortable and plush. Also, there was no charge for overnight valet parking, which was nice. I will definitely stay at this hotel when I go back to Vegas for business.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice!”
Reviews.Author: marin29
Reviews.Content: We had a really enjoyable stay. The room was very fresh & clean. The jacuzzi tub and shower (with enormous, powerful showerhead) were wonderful. The room was very quiet. At first I thought that perhaps the other rooms around us were vacant because it was so quiet, but they were in fact occupied. I have stayed in several luxury hotels, but this was the nicest experience I ever had. We were traveling with our 4 yr old, and after visiting some of the crowded & smoky hotels on the strip, we were very happy with our decision to stay off the strip. Our 4 year old loved the pool and waterfall.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Las Vegas Resort without the Strip Congestion”
Reviews.Author: LakersFan
Reviews.Content: October 15 to 17, 2006 – I had the opportunity to spend two nights at the JW Marriott Las Vegas Resort at Summerlin to attend a business meeting. I arrived about noon, hours before normal check-in, and was able to receive a room in about thirty minutes. The first room I had was #1518. From what I could tell it was a standard guest room on the 3rd floor of the Spa Tower. The room was quite large and had an outstanding bathroom. Until October 1st it had been a smoking room and there was a slight smell of smoke which bothered me. I went back to the front desk and the after the associate apologized and made a note for housekeeping she offered me an upgraded room; a parlor suite on the first floor #1115. It was smoke free and an awesome room! Besides being happy receiving an upgraded room, I was even more pleased at how my complaint was handled. There was no hesitation to offer an apology and correct the problem immediately. About ten minutes after I checked into my replacement room the front desk associate called to make sure that I was completely satisfied; great service! Getting to see both a standard room and a parlor suite was nice. Both of the rooms had huge and beautiful bathrooms. Both had whirlpool tubs large enough for two and both had huge showers with regular and rainfall shower heads. Neither room had a proper desk or office-style chair. Both offered wired high-speed internet service for $9.95 for 24 hours. The service worked well and connected with our corporate VPN, but did not work as smoothly as I-Bahn (STSN) which most Marriott properties offer. A minor annoyance was that electrical outlets were hidden and hard to get to. The rooms seem better designed for the leisure traveler instead of a business traveler. Both rooms were immaculate and during my short stay housekeeping was excellent. The bath amenities were generous sized and of very good quality. The bath linens were plentiful, fresh and thick. There were two thick resort robes in the walk-in closets which both rooms had. There was an electronic-locking safe in the closets as well as iron, ironing board, and a bottle of water to refill the steam iron! Room 1518 had a window but no balcony. Suite 1115, on the ground floor, had a huge patio. It made me feel like having a party! Both rooms offered large TV’s with a large variety of cable channels and pay-per-view movies. The Murphy-style bed in my parlor suite was very comfortable; more comfortable than my bed at home! The resort has two towers, the Spa Tower, where my room was, and the Palms Tower. The two are connected by long concourses which connect through the Rampart Casino. The Aquae Sulis full service Spa at the resort and resort shop are located on the Spa Tower concourse. A food court located on the Palms Tower concourse and is home to: Starbucks, the Rampart Buffet, Shizen (Japanese) and several other restaurants. To get to the conference center requires either going outdoors or going through the casino. While the hotel is now 100% smoke free, the casino and the food court are not. The casino seemed fairly large and had lots of slots and all the table games for those interested in gambling. The hotel has a very small exercise room located on the 2nd floor of the Palms Tower that is complimentary. A much larger and much better equipped exercise area is located within the Aquae Sulis Spa, but there is a charge of $25.00 per day to use it and the other spa facilities. I walked through the pool area after meetings one day. The pool is huge and looked very inviting. There appeared to be plenty of lounges and pool towels. There are a number of cabanas around the pool each with a TV, table and chairs, and lounges. On the Palms Tower end is both a large waterfall and an outdoor hydrotherapy pool. Food and drink are available at the pool from the Waterside Café. Behind the pool café is a sand volleyball court, horseshoe pit, bocce ball area and croquet lawn. Besides all this, the hotel sits between two golf courses. All of my meals were in conjunction with the meeting that I was attending so I did not have the opportunity to try any of the hotel’s restaurants or room service except for Starbucks. I can recommend the JW Marriott for those who want to be in ‘Vegas, but not be in the congestion of the Strip. Service was excellent and the accommodations were very good.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay.”
Reviews.Author: pokerman
Reviews.Content: I am a 37 year old male who took his mother, brother and sister-in-law to visit Las Vegas, the Grand Canyon, and Red Rock Canyon. We stayed at the J.W. Marriott from October 4 through the 9th. I have high standards for comfort and service and have stayed at similar resorts before all over the world. Paid for 2 junior suites (about 900 sq. ft. each) at $309 (plus fees and taxes) each per day. Pool: excellent. Excellent service/food, excellent size of pool and pool area, excellent background music, excellent landscaping. Lots of thyme has been planted throughout the beautifully landscaped property and you catch the faint fragrance when you're lying by the pool. Anecdote: I came to the pool bar to order food 5 minutes before closing and the chef was in the process of closing down his station. I asked if I could still order and he said: "no problem" and whipped us up a great BBQ chicken sandwich and cashew chicken eggrolls. Great service! Cerres: the resort restaurant. Excellent breakfasts (didn't try their lunch or dinners). Worth the $14 per person (plus tip) to start the day of right. Fresh and ripe fruits, delicious mozzarella/tomato salad, various cheeses/breads, freshly made omelets and scrambled eggs among other, heavier breakfast items such as potato and sausage. Great view of lush landscaping and waterfalls outside through 14 foot floor to ceiling windows. Overall wonderful service by people who obviously enjoyed serving guests. Anecdote: I came down one morning for breakfast with my party of 4 and was accosted by one of the breakfast floor managers (who will remain unnamed but is now known to the hotel manager after I wrote him about the incident) who stated, in front of my entire party, that I hadn't paid for my party the previous morning. I had indeed paid, including my usual 20% tip for any service I received at the resort. After checking with another floor manager she found out she was wrong but didn't have the decency to come tell me. I had to ask. I hope it happened because she had a bad day because she has no business being in the service industry if this is her normal behavior. Putting aside this weird incident, I can highly recommend eating breakfast at Cerres. Rooms: spacious, clean, cleaned fast and in an unobtrusive manner (you leave for just a moment and when you come back it's all done). I made small requests of the housekeeping staff once in a while (more bottled water, more hangers) and was always promptly satisfied. Spacious bathrooms, great features such a whirlpool bath, rain shower head, natural stone tiles, french doors that open (no balcony) to let fresh air in and give great views of Red Rock mountains on one side and downtown Vegas on the other. Excellent all. Hotel: is beautiful. Inside and out. Nothing spectacular (aside from the enormous and ubiquitous palm trees, I guess), just done right and very calming. Valet service was efficient. Best way to get to (and from) the Vegas strip is by taking Sahara if you want to end up at the North end of the strip and taking Tropicana if you want to end up at the South end of the strip. Don't take any other road as I must have tried them all to find the best ones. Either takes 30 minutes, less if all the lights are in your favor. Must see: "O" by Cirque de Soleil. Some people in the audience were actually so overcome with emotion they were weeping. Worth the $150 ticket. Don't get "wet seat tickets" if you are wearing something that you can't afford to get wet. Try the #1 rated Bellagio buffet before the show or the Olives restaurant. Take in the Bellagio fountains (every 15 minutes after dark) after the show. Grand Canyon by helicopter. We used Maverick Helicopter Tours and can't say enough good things about that outfit. Their modern office is conveniently located on the Vegas strip. Their helicopters are comfortable. Despite the rough weather conditions while getting to the Grand Canyon, the pilot was calm, cool and collected and a genuinely nice guy who gave just the right amount of commentary. There is no flying low for miles through the canyon which I guess I had anticipated from watching shows on television. Instead the pilot landed us on a cliff edge which gave us a great view of the majestic Grand Canyon and the river running through it. Great photo opportunities. Legends in Concert. I thought this would be cheesy but wanted to see it anyway. Glad I did because it was a great time. Live music, the impersonators' real voices, spot on impersonations of Britney Spears, Sting, Elvis, Garth Brooks, Four Tops (rocked the house!) and Bobby Darrin. Enthusiastic showgirls made it complete. The Forum Shops at Ceasar's Palace. Fantastic shops (hundreds of them) in a classy environment. Convenient valet parking in front. Fancy and casual restaurants througout. Simply the best shopping area on the Strip. Red Rock Canyon which is located just 15 minutes from the resort going West on Charleston Avenue. Beautiful vistas and great hiking/biking trials. When I return, I'll probably give the Bellagio or the Wynn hotel a try but I have a feeling I'll regret not staying at the J.W. Marriott again.

Reviews.Title: “Tranquil stay...a real resort feeling!”
Reviews.Author: mizkikay05
Reviews.Content: My family and I were there on Sept.'06 to attend a wedding. JW is one of the best resorts that we have ever experienced! It's lovely both inside and out..with luscious landscaping and peaceful setting. If you want to be near the strip..this is not the place to be. JW is about 25 minutes( no traffic ) from the strip, but for those who want a resort like feeling near Sin City..go here! It's very family friendly, super clean, ( we are very meticulous people so this place was great! ) Great service , although one valet guy was not too friendly,but nonetheless everyone else was very hospitable during our stay. Room service was excellent and delicious too! My kids loved the pool and the spa and actually didn't want to leave! I had the same feeling when I enjoyed the whirlpool tub in our huge bathroom. Everything about the hotel was superb!

Reviews.Title: “OK but Not Great”
Reviews.Author: myakkalady
Reviews.Content: Booked back in Feb. 2006 for Sept. anniversary and husband's birthday. Wish I had kept Strip hotel reservation. JW is a beautiful hotel with great rooms and grounds but it ends there. This is strictly convention hotel; they don't appreciate reg. paying guests. Not once were we addressed by our names - 7 days - No acknowledgement ( Ritz does) for our special occasions. Food miserable at pool and inside breakfast was same buffet for 7 days. Shuttle to/from Strip is limited to 5 times a day each way. As others have mentioned, cabs to/from strip and TRAFFIC tieups would break your wallet so you use the shuttle. Room housekeeping obliging after you brought many things to their attention. No visible management as other chains have. Many of the service folks were wonderful reps of this hotel. Casino is nice. Capital Grille at Fashion Show Mall is a treat; Phantom of Opera worth every penny and if you have a spare evening - The Sopranos Last Supper is worth interacting with "The Family".....great fun. Guess we're spoiled by the Ritz..it always is "my pleasure" with them.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place away from Strip”
Reviews.Author: cajas1
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights at the resort. It is not 15 minutes to the strip. More like 20-25 depending on traffic, minimum. Nice rooms. Rooms are large. Bathrooms are very nice. Breakfast was good. Everyone very friendly. Check to make sure all golf courses are playable before you reserve a room. Nice place to stay if you want to be way off the strip. We are used to staying at Four Seasons. No minibars.

Reviews.Title: “Good location great hotel would definately return to this hotel”
Reviews.Author: PC2
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the JW for 10 nights with a break for 1 night to stay at The Hotel at Mandalay Bay, what a mistake, it would have been better to stay at the JW for the whole trip. See my review of The Hotel for further details We had a room on the 6th floor of the Palm Tower (Odd number)facing into the resort. The room was huge with opening french doors and a well appointed bathroom and we never waited for an elevator. The pool is fantastic and even over the labor day holiday we still got sunbeds and towels. The location is 15 to 20mins drive from the Strip so I would recommend a car for anyone staying there, if you get a taxi from the airport its around $45 at rush hour. Hertz have a desk at the hotel. Starbuck on site for coffee. The only downsides of the hotel were, 1) the pool bar closed too early, 6pm and 2) the hotel casino seemed to cater to the more mature [60 plus] group, but as we spent most of time by the pool this wasn't really a problem. At night if you want a break from the Strip and Hotel, turn right as you get onto Rampart Blvd and there are a couple of decent bars etc 5 minutes drive from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: Teeter21
Reviews.Content: We used our Marriott points for 2 nights and paid for the 3rd night before checking out and going to Caesar's Palace for husband's conference. We loved the JW! The room was very large as was the walk-in closet and the bathroom! The bed was the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in at a hotel. The shower with the rainfall shower head was amazing! The grounds were beautiful and had a tropical feel. We enjoyed the pool daily. We were on the 3rd floor and our room really did not have much of a view, but other than that the room was excellent! We did have a rental car and one day went to the Red Rock Canyon National Park which we both enjoyed. We also ventured to the strip one night for dinner at the Cheesecake Factory and then discovered there was one right around the corner from the JW. We had lunch at the poolside cafe and it was good as was the cafe next to the casino. Didn't really gamble that much so can't say much about the casino. It was a bit smokey but aren't they all? I hated the leave the JW and would definitely go back one day.

Reviews.Title: “unforgettable rendezvous”
Reviews.Author: obar
Reviews.Content: Marriott's Grand Chateau delivers what it promises - we stayed in a 2 bedroom lockout unit on the 20th floor and we had the most comfortable and unforgettable vacation experience ever. Marriott's Grand Chateau has competed with the well known 5 star destinations in Vegas with it's amenities - but even more so than the traditional 5 star hotels we used to stay. It's like vacationing in the comfort of a home like atmosphere so much so that you forget that you are actually on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Far enough away.”
Reviews.Author: Salinaspete
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great, we loved it form when we arrived to check out. The pool was nice and big with great service. The buffet was excellent and the service was great. The rooms are nice and big where you can spred out. I think every room has a big soaking tub and a seperate shower. Parking is a 2 minute walk. The staff was one of the best . Now listen to this, the strip is 15 minutes away so don't stay here if you want the glam and glitz of the strip. The Suncoast is right next door if you want a mega casino. There is shopping 2 minutes away. The new Red Rock is 8 minutes away and Red Rock Park is 20 minutes away, Far enough away but close enough to the Strip. Enjoy and relax. PSC

Reviews.Title: “Tempted to stay off the strip from now on..”
Reviews.Author: saturine
Reviews.Content: This facility is beautiful. My room was gorgeous I felt like I was on a tropical isle somewhere (until I hit the strip malls down the street!) Everything was pretty much perfect in this hotel. I spent 2 hours in the jacuzzi tub every day I was there and took 5 showers with the rainfall shower head. It was typical desert heat when I stayed and I just loved this location. I would totally stay here again. Food was good. Service was excellent, they have every amenity imaginable Valet is free, parking is free - is this vegas? Car rentals are cheap in vegas (full size car was like $40 for the weekend!), when you go to the strip just valet it at one of the hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific! Best of the Best!”
Reviews.Author: njnetsfan
Reviews.Content: Folks! I stay in hotels approximately 75 to 100 nights a year and last month took my family to Las Vegas and stayed at the JW for 3 nights. If you want to go to Paradise main land USA) this is the place. The rooms, grounds and staff of this hotel are first rate. A little history of the hotel will tell you why. This property started off as a Regent Hotel and for those world travelers who have stayed at Regent Properties you know they are Super Deluxe. When the Room occupancy % was below forecast the property owners brought Marriott in to manage the resort and Marriott has kept the standard set by the previous managment company. Yes there is a casino (Rampart) in the middle of the hotel (not owned or managed by Marriott) and it is a 50,000 sq ft intimate place to try your luck. In addition to the Marriott Restaurant Cerres there are a Casino Buffet, Casino Cafe, Irish Pub, Japanese Restaurant and a 24 hr Starbucks. I had previously read that this was Trip Advisor #1 Hotel in Las Vegas and it absolutely is. The LV strip is only 15 minutes away (visible from the grounds of the hotel) as is red Rock Canyon and the Red Rock Hotel and Casino. My advice is Stay at this Hotel!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Decent value for off-strip hotel, but that's all”
Reviews.Author: catmom37
Reviews.Content: In comparison to the other Vegas hotels I've stayed at (Four Seasons, Mandalay Bay, MGM, New York New York, Treasure Island, Mirage, Monte Carlo, Tropicana, Flamingo, Hard Rock), this hotel is just average and I don't know why it's ranked #1 in Vegas on this site or considered a 5 star hotel. If you're looking for a good value off the strip, then I agree you can't go wrong with the JW (but only if you're not paying more than $125/night). The rooms are nice and the spa has great treatments/staff, but the pool is nothing special. Plus, if you want to check out the strip, then you either have to deal with limited shuttle service, pay for cabs (which can get pricey, especially during rush hour), or get a rental car. Definitely would not recommend this hotel for those looking for the true Vegas experience.

Reviews.Title: “Such a Bargain”
Reviews.Author: Fishlover888
Reviews.Content: This hotel is such a bargain. Beautiful facilities, nice rooms, unusual huge marble bath with jetted tub, comfortable bed. Free bottle water. Staffs are great. $170/night on a labor day weekend with this kind of qualify is unheard of. It's not far away from the strip. I highly recommanded.

Reviews.Title: “Oh so beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: 1Venus
Reviews.Content: No wonder this property is #1 in Vegas. The grounds are beautiful and make you forget you're visiting a desert. The room was large with a huge walk-in closet (just like home.) I loved the bathroom rainfall shower and the big bathtub. I loved the little balcony overlooking a flowing stream. And I loved the big comfy bed. I only stayed in this hotel for 3 nights, but I could live there. We didn't gamble in the casino because it was smoke filled and uncomfortable. We did, however, eat at the pub and it was good food. We also ventured out to explore the immediate area. The hotel is in an upscale area with some nice shops and restaurants closeby. I have to say that we were concerned about staying here as we normally stay in moderately priced hotels. But the people working there were warm and inviting, not at all snooty. I felt comfortable and like I belonged. I recommend this hotel for a quiet retreat from Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “7-7-7 ... it's a winner”
Reviews.Author: JRCaesar
Reviews.Content: I love Mandalay Bay, I think the rooms and restaurants and The Venetian are great, and have always found the Monte Carlo to be a steal with its clean rooms and atmosphere. You’re not going to get the “Vegas” experience at the JW Marriott … and that’s a great thing! This resort is one that you’ll want to tell your friends about. Great spot for a family stay. Oversized rooms with walk-in closets, oversized bathrooms with spa tubs and rainfall showerheads – and those are the standard rooms. Nice pool – salt-water, I think – with a lap-swimming straight section and a larger, free-form area. There’s a lifeguard on hand to keep an eye on the little ones. (We even hired one to babysit for us that evening so we could sneak down to the casino for a couple of hours.) Good locals-oriented casino on the property, with lots of small demonination machines. Few blackjack and gaming tables; however, many of them offered single-deck 21, if that’s your thing. The casino 24-hour restaurant is pretty good, but their restaurant row still had some vacancies. We got a great deal on the Marriott Web site -- a package that included 1 pizza and 1 in-room movie a night and a room rate of about $160. Nice.

Reviews.Title: “Worthy of Rave Reviews”
Reviews.Author: Tgreen
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 5 nights at the JW. We stayed there because of the reviews on TA and have to tell you we were not disappointed-by anything. It is a beautiful property and a great place to go to relax. We laid around the pool, drank daquiris, slept, ate and, on two occasions, drove to the strip for shows (Menopause, the Musical is hilarious). My wife does not really like Vegas because of the crowds, the noise and the smoke. With the JW, we may have found the perfect compromise. Also, I highly recommed the Italian restaraunt, Spiendi (I think). Great service, great food and we sat out on the patio with the Koi and ducks. One caution, if this is your first trip to Vegas, stay on the strip. The JW is not the typical Vegas experience. Everyone should have that experience-at least once. It will make you appreciate the JW all the more.

Reviews.Title: “Better than staying on The Strip”
Reviews.Author: RDH72
Reviews.Content: Moved to the JW after 4 nights at the Venetian. Have to say this place is fantastic - whole staff seem really focused on delivering great service. Rooms are huge, new and really well equipped. Public areas are also great - airly, clean and well maintained. Spa/Gym was also great and good value at $25/day. Food in all the restaurants tried was alsoo good. If you have a car - distance from the Strip is not a problem. Would definitely stay here again ! Just avoid the timeshare sell in the lobby, the free gift isn't worth it !

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel I have ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: fishboy007
Reviews.Content: Originally, we were going to be there only for a Harry Potter symposium, but since we were going to be in Vegas anyway, we extended our stay for the maximum time allowed for the conference rate. This hotel was very nice. The pool and grounds were spectacular, the food was very good in every restaurant were tried in the hotel. Yes, it is very far off the strip, but since we had a car, this was no real hardship. The hotel also has shuttle bus service to the strip. Friendly staff too.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: LeeJB
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the JW Marriott Las Vegas for 4 nights. Managed to get a 560 sq ft double room (they call this "standard"!) for $179/nt thanks to a leisure promotion on the company's website. Let me tell you, I've stayed in MANY hotels around the world, and this is one of the very best. Excellent room-- so many amenities and little touches (like a double sink, whirlpool spa, amazing shower.. and the ability to turn up the TV volume in the bathroom!) and one of the most comfortable beds I've ever slept in (and I have "memory foam" and egyptian cotton at home, so I don't say that lightly!). Awesome staff-- check-in was a breeze, complimentary waters every time we visited the desk, completely professional and very attentive to our needs. Arranging a late check-out wasn't a problem... they made everything so easy. Great food-- I wasn't expecting much from casino restaurants, but the food at the Promenade cafe (24 hr, downstairs) was excellent, and very reasonably priced. $10 buys a very nice meal. The buffet, although slightly limited in choice, was of very good quality and in the opinion of myself and my 2 guests, was FAR better quality than the Bellagio at twice the price. The pool outdoors was amazing. 11,000 sq. ft., with mini waterfalls and a convenient bar and cabanas. Great. The location for us was perfect. It was out of the way of the strip but near local restaurants and a gym (there are 2 gyms in the hotel, but we have a 24 hour fitness membership). They have a complimentary shuttle bus to the strip... but we drove there in 15 minutes. Not a problem at all. I much prefer the location rather than a busy strip hotel. This hotel is a gem and at $179/nt, was a bargain. Very highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Loved The JW”
Reviews.Author: Aussie08
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriott for three nights in early august. We had an 1100 sq ft suite. It was total luxury with a powder room, sitting room,wet bar with fridge, dining room (with table for 6), enormous bedroom and luxury bathroom. We are not gamblers and have been to Vegas before so we decided to stay off the strip. It was the best decision we made. It was peaceful and relaxing and because we had our own car we were able to go to the strip as it suited us. As they are doing road works on the 95 we used Spring Mountain Rd and Flamingo, much quicker. We parked at the Wynn free, had the buffet lunch there one day (excellent). There are a number of new shops nearby, with plenty of eating places down Rampart Blvd.There is free valet parking with tips only when you need your car.There is a shuttle to Fashion Show Mall. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kmora
Reviews.Content: Hotel was beautiful. Very clean and friendly staff. Extremely comfortable bed! Loved eating at J.W. Wooloughans...especially loved the Fried Pickles. My one suggestion if you plan to stay at this hotel is to rent a car. Taxi ran about $40 plus tip from airport. Also, even though the hotel does provide a free shuttle to the strip, I would recommend taking a rental car, so you don't have to watch your time. Last shuttle leaves at 11:30 pm. Overall, an excellent hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Terrific stay at JW Marriott Las Vegas - Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: john3489
Reviews.Content: We visited the JW Marriott Resort in Las Vegas recently for two nights to attend the wedding of our friends' daughter and also to visit cousins in Summerlin, the community within which the property is located. We found all the positive comments on this site to be true. The service was outstanding, everyone was very friendly - many hearty "good mornings" by the staff in the hallways. The valet parkers were cordial, fast and efficient. Our room in the Spa Tower was quite big, and the bed was one of the most comfortable you are going to find, with plenty of pillows and a beautiful duvet. All the furniture was fresh and in fine shape. Another nice feature was two bathrobes in the lighted walk-in closet (with safe) that were ready and waiting. There was also a convenient refrigerator that had free spring water, a rarity these days. It was clear that tremendous thought went into the design of even the smallest of things, such as the matching wicker trash cans, ice bucket and hamper in the bathroom. The bathroom was huge and featured a jacuzzi type soaking tub along with a separate shower enclosure offering a choice of a standard shower nozzle or a "rainfall" setting from above, which was great. The nozzles were both powerful and worked well. The rainfall was particularly enjoyable. For the person who wrote there were no washcloths, they are actually there on the bathroom counter, rolled up tastefully in the wood tray behind the complementary shampoo, conditioner, lotion, mouthwash, etc. While it took me a few moments to spot them, they are indeed there! The grounds are superb with water features everywhere, winding paths through the gardens, a great pool, palm trees - everything very well maintained. The wedding was held outdoors in a gorgeous lawn setting with gazebo type structure. We were impressed by the way the staff kept the event private, and then ushered us all into the beautiful Ceres restaurant overlooking waterfalls. All was taken care of professionally and in great taste. The service at the reception was impeccable, the wait staff was very friendly, and the food was delicious. The bride was beautiful, too! The surrounding community of Summerlin is booming and there are many new shops and restaurants very close to the hotel for off premises enjoyment. Boca Park is an example, just down the road. While US-95 (main access to downtown and the Strip) is being widened, it still worked fine for us and actually we enjoyed taking Charleston Blvd into the downtown area one morning to get a feel for the growth going on in the area. It took us less than 15 minutes to drive down to Bellagio on Saturday morning, and about the same time to return. This was our first time staying "off the Strip" and we found it a nice change of pace - very green, the JW is definitely a great place for relaxation. There is also the Aquae Sulis Spa that features about every kind of massage or treatment you can imagine, and had we the time, we might have given it a shot. All in all, this is a superb place to stay. One suggestion is to ask for a room with a balcony. While our room didn't have one, it didn't make a huge difference to us, I simply think it would be a nice touch and would allow even more light into the beautiful guest room. We would definitely return to the JW Marriott in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Wow! What else can I say”
Reviews.Author: johnnyvegas12
Reviews.Content: AWESOME! Large rooms, upscale amenities, and large bathroom. Jacuzzi too! But it's not Vegas! It's not on the strip, it's not in the same hemisphere. If you like vacationing in the desert go! It's great. Like Palm Springs!!! If you like Vegas, stay elsewhere!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Marriott”
Reviews.Author: Taughy
Reviews.Content: Wonderful, wonderful hotel. An oasis of calm in Vegas! Everything was perfect from check in until check out. Great choice if you have children as there is a super pool (only gripe was that it closed at 8pm) and it actually has a casino where children can walk through without being frowned at (unlike others we encountered in Vegas). Also a great choice if you are a golfer - two wonderful courses on the doorstep.

Reviews.Title: “It's true! JW Marriott is fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: MelissaDinSD
Reviews.Content: I love Vegas and one of the reasons why is the JW Marriott in Summerlin. Always one to stay on the Strip, I heard that the Spa at the JW Marriott was excellent (and I heard this while I was at Spa Mandalay, which I think is also an excellent Spa.) So my friends and I decided to stay at the JW Marriott to check it out. Both the Spa and the Resort itself were incredible. Spa first: excellent fitness facilties, fitness classes, treatments and lounge area. I had a body scrub and a clarifying facial and both were wonderful. Hotel and rooms: Who needs the Spa when the hotel room's bathroom has a large whirlpool jet tub in it, as well as a rainfall showerhead in the separately enclosed shower!!! FABULOUS!!! Bedding was soft and comfortable; room was nicely appointed, and yes...the bathroom is DIVINE! The hotel staff were always friendly, always professional, and always "At Your Service" when you needed extra anything (towels, robes, etc.) I was quite impressed when I received a follow-up call in my hotel room to make sure that my requests were met. There is also a casino so you really don't need to go anywhere else! AND, if you enjoy golf, there are plenty of beautiful, world-class golf courses surrounding the JW Marriott. Top-notch customer service will always win out, when you have so many comparable, hotels and resorts in one area. That's why the JW Marriott in Summerlin stands out as a class act from others. I stayed at THEHotel at Mandalay Bay the following day after the JW Marriott. Although the suite hotel is swank, the service at THEHotel was sub-par to the JW Marriott...no comparison! Give the JW Marriott a try...you will be glad you did.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort - away from the Vegas Strip!”
Reviews.Author: loveSoCal
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our way to Brian Head (UT). This is a great resort. We have stayed at many Marriott hotels, but this was even better than the "usual" Marriott themed hotels. The rooms are spacious (we had two queen beds) and the beds were very comfortable (down cover, really comfy pillows). We stayed in the "Deluxe Guest Room" which is the least expensive of all the rooms. We really liked the spacious bathrooms, and the whirlpool bath is separate from the shower. The pool area is nice - decent size pool and there are cabanas for rent. The resort is very quiet, since it's located in Summerlin, a bit west of the Vegas strip. It was perfect for us, but if you are looking for the "Vegas strip" experience, then you might not enjoy this place. We did not use the casinos, but we walked through it in the morning to go get breakfast. We are not really the "gambling" type so I did not notice much about the casinos. One thing to note: Since the resort is far from the strip, there are not too many restaurants located nearby, so we ended eating at the resort. We had purchased a "family" package which included a pizza/soda meal and a free movie selection, so the only meal we had to purchase was breakfast. The staff seemed very friendly. We would highly recommend this place to travelers, and we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous resort”
Reviews.Author: ilovecheesecake
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 wonderful nights in July. The room was beautiful. Customer service was great. The pool is beautiful with water falls. I definately recommend this hotel. Quick drive to the strip or take the hotels free shuttle. I spent last part of the trip at the Venetian. Will definately stay at the JW if I have a chance again.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Resort But...”
Reviews.Author: SonOfBruin2
Reviews.Content: ...I do have a few minor complaints, which I will proceed to list before elaborating upon all the good qualities of the JW. First, where were the washcloths? None in the room, none at the spa. I could've used one to scrub away the stench of smoke from the adjacent Rampart Casino (REALLY smokey, even for a casino). Second, in the gym at the spa, there are no mirrors in the workout area, which makes weight-lifting a little more difficult. Also, the spa facilities, which are nice enough, don't compare with the spas at Mandalay Bay or the Bellagio. The room at the JW was great. It was more than large enough to accomodate the rollaway we requested which was delivered promptly and politely. The queen beds were very comfortable - some of the best hotel beds, comparable to Westin's heavenly bed, and better than the beds at The Bellagio, Venetian, MGM, et al. The mattress was the perfect firmness and the duvet and pillows were fluffy and comfortable. The bathroom was out of this world. In a city with numerous hotels boasting grand bathrooms, this one trumps them all. The jacuzzi tub easily accommodated two people, and the rainfall shower was very relaxing. Double-sinks and a separate room for the toilet made sharing the bathroom with four other people a little easier. Also, the faux balcony was a nice added bonus to an already terrific room. The whole room felt newly refurbished and showed no signs of wear, and the decor was understated and inviting. The pool area was easily accessed from the Spa Tower (where our room was located), and we were not forced to walk through the casino or a shopping promenade in our bathing suits. There were enough lounges for anyone who wanted one, and poolside food and drink service was friendly (not prompt, though our waitness apologized numerous times for the kitchen being backed up, and she did not get flustered when it took us a long time to order because some of us were on the other side of the pool). The pool water was unusually salty, but was cool and refreshing nonetheless. All in all, it was a very nice trip. The hotel is VERY calm and quiet - seemingly the antithesis of Las Vegas. We utilized the shuttle service a few times, but it would've been better if they had one later shuttle returning to the hotel, at least on weekends (11:30pm is the latest returning shuttle). Getting to and from the strip was not a problem, though a bit more action and better people-watching within walking distance (much better eye-candy at Mandalay, Bellagio, Hard Rock) would've been nice. Still, for the service, room, and pool, I highly recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “J.W. Marriott is Top Flight Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lancelarue
Reviews.Content: We just stayed one night at the J.W. Marriott on the tail end of a trip to Europe. Our idea was to find somewhere that we could fly direct from London and relax while we overcame jet lag before traveling home the next day. We chose the J.W. Marriott based on experience with other Marriott properties and reviews on this site. We were not disappointed. We got at the hotel at 4:30 p.m. and found that our Junior Suite was not yet ready. The guest relations supervisor immediately booked us into an estate suite at the same rate ($229) that we had booked for the Junior Suite. The room was amazing - about 1,000 square feet, great whirlpool tub large enough for 2-3, great shower, etc. It had very high level finish and fit, including recessed lighting, crown molding, chair rail, great carpet, etc. The bed was spectacularly comfortable too. The best thing I can say about this hotel, as good as everything was, was the service. The immediate efforts of staff to ensure our comfort and convenience with no hassle was refreshing. This place is self-contained, with a great pool, spa, several restaurants, a 24-hour Starbucks, and a casino. This place delivered on all promises and was a great way to return to the U.S. in style. I would recommend this to anyone coming to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous spot for a wedding!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: llutzen
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough about the JW Marriott in Las Vegas - as loyale Marriott clients we have stayed at so many and this one is absolutely the BEST!!! I had concerns planning my wedding from across the country but they were fantastic. We had the golf, spa, and everything else taken care of with the utmost professionalism. Ken McCabe and his staff went above and beyond to make our stay perfect!!!

Reviews.Title: “Truly, Truly, Loved It!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: As per the TripAdvisor rating (Best hotel in Las Vegas), we stayed at the JW Marriot from July 4th to July 7th. What a remarkable place! My best friend and I went away for a girlfriend getaway. It was just what we needed. The hotel was glorious. The grounds are lush, rooms magnificent and the service impeccable. We loved the 'at your service' call button and used it for just about everything. We rented a car and the commute to the strip was only about 15 minutes. We went almost every night but couldn’t wait to return to our oasis. We highly recommend this place and can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the JW”
Reviews.Author: nan831
Reviews.Content: My family of 5 just returned from a 3 night stay here and we thought it was excellent. We wanted something off the strip that was still nice, and we got it. Check-in was quick and smooth, and the employees were very friendly. We had a room on the 6th floor w/ a balcony and 2 queens. The room was very clean, the beds comfortable, and the bathroom huge! My 6yr. old loved the big jacuzzi tub. We had a package that gave the kids pizza, soda, and a movie nightly and they loved it. We ordered room service 2 nights for all of us and the last night for the kids only. My husband and I ate at the Cheesecake Factory around the corner from the hotel. The food from room service was very good. We used the concierge service and found Mimi to be extremely helpful. She got us into Bobby Flay's Mesa Grill w/ no problem. We did some day trips from Vegas and yes, the traffic was a pain, but no worse than any other large city. The hotel itself is close to restaurants and some shopping. The resort is beautiful and we loved the pool. We were pleasantly surprised to see lifeguards there. We would definitely return with or without the kids.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the JW Marriott Las Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: irvoc_78
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the JW Marriott Las Vegas as the first part of an extended vacation around the Southwest that started around Memorial Day weekend. I knew the moment I checked in that this would be a hard act to follow! The resort was well appointed and the free parking was a nice touch. The room, however, was the best part of the place. It was huge! It had one of the nicest bathrooms I have ever seen at a hotel, with a huge rainbath shower that could probably fit four people and a large jacuzzi tub that fits two people comfortably. The room was also nicely appointed with a large, comfortable bed and tasteful furnishings (not as gaudy as The Venetian). The pool area is decent and was not crowded, although I believed the resort probably wasn't sold out based on the parking situation and their willingness to give a later check-out time. The main gym ($25/day) has a pretty nice spread of cardio machines and free weights but the real reason to spend that kind of money is to use the Spa attached to it which has a waterfall showers, steam room, sauna, cool plunge, and jacuzzi. Well worth the money. Also know that there is another smaller gym that is free in the case that you just want to work out but not pay the daily fee of the larger facility. Also ate at Spiedini (an italian restaurant in the resort) that was decent, especially when compared to the high prices for similar fare on the Strip. Yes, this resort is very spread out and it is pretty inconvienient to the Strip (on the map it looks close to the strip but the 95 Freeway is a BIG MESS at just about any hour and the surface streets aren't much better). However, for those that want a change of pace from the Strip and want to stay at a resort with great rooms and a slower pace, this is a great option. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “great price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: nice hotel. Excellent beds and bedding. pretty nice room. crappy valet service. good food. Average cafe service. of course smokey casino. friendly front desk. Overall, excellent price for what you get. would stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Cramped rooms”
Reviews.Author: JuicyLuicy3691
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the JW Marriot Resort on Sunday 28th May 2006 at about 1pm. We had no problems with check in and we were given our room immediatley. We stayed for one night. The room was a king size with one bed, but as we were travelling with two children, we checked beforehand that there was a sofabed available. The room wasn't very big, which we found was a problem with two children and four suitcases. The room was spotlessley clean and the bathroom came with some very nice toiletries. The only compaints I would make are: 1. Before we left to go explore the strip, we phoned the lobby and asked them to come and make up the sofa bed, when we returned six hours later, it was still not done, and we had to ring again for someone to finally come. 2. There isn't much space in the front car park, and the one behind the resort shuts at 9pm, so when we arrived back there wasn't very many spaces to park our rental car. Overall it was a pleasant stay and we would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great"local" resort.”
Reviews.Author: vegasmike
Reviews.Content: We have spent several weekends at this "local" resort. By local I mean it is off the strip in Nortwest Las Vegas. Perfect for getting away from the rush of the strip, this resort offers golf packages and a fantastic spa! Aquasules Spa offers fantastic massages in a beautiful setting. Rooms are all suites and very spacious. The casino is small but friendly. The slot machines offer the best odds of any casinos around. A great little getaway

Reviews.Title: “Nice but be prepared to walk... a lot”
Reviews.Author: pattayainsider
Reviews.Content: All the great things about this hotel have already been said, so the only thing I want to add is that due to the layout of the property, a lot of walking is involved... really A LOT. For those that can't walk too far, this is not a great choice. Some large hotels, like the Venitian would be more suitable, because you can take the elevator down to the lobby, and just steps away are restaurants, the reception, the taxis, the casino, shops, etc. Not the case at this JW Marriott. It was sort of designed in a large circle, so it's just not that close between all the places. Otherwise, nice place, good value for what it is.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gr8drmrs
Reviews.Content: This was the best place we had ever stayed. It was quiet and grandeur, I loved the casino which is actually not part of the Merriott, but it was a blast. We were treated with great kindness and I felt like a VIP there. The rooms were incredible, spacey and clean and the bathroom had a jacuzzi tub and a seperate shower with a rain type shower head. We got a really good price at the time and have not been able to find that price again or we would stay there every year. The only drawback is that it is very far from the strip and you have to take the freeway to get to the strip, as far as I know the Marriott does not offer a shuttle. I just loved the place and can't say enough about it. I would stay again in a heartbeat if I can afford it.

Reviews.Title: “vacation from the strip experience”
Reviews.Author: zz44
Reviews.Content: when the crowds and the glitz of the strip get a bit too much, go to this beautiful hotel in what seems like a suburban community, the rooms are large and well equipped, the grounds which include world class golf are beautiful and the service great. the casino is used by locals as well as guests and is quite pleasant. the marriott- two for brakfast- gets a good morning buffet. the pool is not crowded and very nice. travel time to the strip is 12 minutes by freeway ( not rush hour) or 25 minutes by surface street. enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: Paris_2004
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a stay at the JW Marriott April 6-9, and we loved everything about it! We had a first floor room just off the lobby that had double french doors leading to a private patio with a small table and four chairs. It was so nice to sit out there in the morning and enjoy our coffee. The bathroom was huge, and beautiful, as mentioned by others. My husband loved the jacuzzi tub, and it was quiet enough that he could soak in it without even waking me up. The king sized bed was very comfortable. And there were two easy chairs as well as a desk with chair. My only minor complaint was the "cooler" fridge. For such a luxury hotel you would think they could put in a real fridge. I have never seen a cooler in a hotel room before. You had to stick an ice bucket in there to get any degree of coolness. The free water bottles were nice though. One of the best things about this hotel is the pool and the grounds. They are so lush and beautiful. You would think you were in Hawaii, not the desert. It was so nice to sit by the pool and let all your cares & worries drain away. They have waitresses that come around often and you can order food or drinks. Ceres restaurant is very nice too, and is landscaped with waterfalls and palm trees outside. We had their breakfast buffet each day, and their made to order omelets and fresh waffles were very good. On our last day it was warm enough to eat breakfast out on the terrace and gaze at the waterfall. Priceless. We can hardly wait to go back next year, hopefully for longer.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience at the JW”
Reviews.Author: Nash_Andrew
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at the JW Marriott from March 30 - April 2, 2006. Overall the experience was excellent and we will be returning. Upon our check in Thursday morning we were pleased to find that our room was already available. The front desk staff was excellent, very friendly and explained everything about the property. Robin, our bellhop, was extremely friendly and gracious and took us to a standard king non-smoking room (as requested) on the top floor. The view was good, with some rooftops of the casino and shops, but also could see the gardens and all of the nearby mountain ranges as well. But forget the view -- the room was absolutely incredible! First, the bathroom is easily the largest and nicest hotel bathroom I have ever experienced without staying in a suite. Two vanities, a 2 person whirlpool tub, all marble standup shower with a seat and rainfall showerhead, laundry bin, separate toilet room with telephone and even a ceiling speaker connected to the TV. The bathroom alone is about the size of many regular hotel rooms and is, in short, out of this world. Once you pass the bathroom, there is a walk in closet with digital safe and bathrobes, then a bar with glasses, ice bin and mini-fridge. After you pass the mini bar you will walk into the main bedroom area. The entire bedroom is stunning. Way oversized and decorated very tastefully in subdued gold tones with gold and black accessories. The carpet was a plush burbour and the room was big enough to have a couch and chair with coffee table as well as an oversized desk with two chairs, internet connection, and a TV that is much larger than most hotel TVs (not flatscreen, though). The bed was probably the most comfortable hotel bed I've ever slept in. Finally, there were the french doors. Forget the usual sealed off hotel windows, these were two oversized french doors that opened all the way onto a tiny balcony. Every night while getting ready we would open these up and enjoy the breeze. There were a couple minor annoyances: the paint in the hallway was scuffed in a few places, there was a spot on one part of the carpet, and it also turns out the fridge is actually a cooler, which was annoying. Overall these are minor issues since we felt like royalty in that room. We never wanted to leave. As for the rest of the hotel: First, the grounds are excellent. The pool situation is very nice. It is quite large, with two oversized 24-hour hot tubs, a poolside bar and restaurant, an adjacent sand volleyball court, and frequent cocktail service. It was not overrun with kids by any means and seemed to have plenty of lawn chairs for the taking. We never had a problem getting a seat and the hotel was full all weekend. We walked all around the hotel and were very impressed by how manicured the gardens were. The spa was also excellent. We had a couples massage, one hour long, for $236 including tip. The massage was excellent. The spa facility is very fancy but not stuffy, heavily staffed, and has like four pools in each locker room along with your standard sauna and steam. There is also an outdoor pool with special jets for your back to lay down in. Very nice. The workout room faces out onto the aerobics classroom and the private pool area and has really nice equipment with flat screen TVs. Highly reccommend the spa to anyone interested in that sort of thing. One drawback: if you don't have a treatment scheduled, it's 25 bucks per day to use it. The one big issue with this hotel is that it is 15-30 miunutes from the strip depending on traffic. The hotel offers a free shuttle every couple hours, but the last one leaves the strip around midnight -- so plan on taking a cab back ($40) if you want to stay out late with the rest of Vegas. But honestly, this could be the best thing about the hotel: you get the best of both worlds. We loved coming home to our amazing room at the JW away from the hustle and bustle of the strip. As for the casino and some of the restaurants surrounding it, this part of the facility was not up to par with the rest of the property. I learned that that part of the hotel is managed separately from the JW which explains its less-classy feel. It was certainly more of a locals casino and the food wasn't that great. Overall though, we will definitely be returning to this hotel. The hotel is not truly a five-star property, as it does not have some of the finer touches, especially in terms of incredible service, that one would expect from the Ritz or the Four Seasons. But it is certainly 4+ stars. The facility is excellent and the standard rooms are simply out of this world. Come to the JW Marriott and feel like a king. Hightly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Simply WOW!”
Reviews.Author: economyclass
Reviews.Content: My Partner and I decided at the last minute to vacation in Las Vegas for a few days. Based on a review at tripadvisor we stayed at the JW Marriott. The room was incredible, the service perfect and the food great. We fell in love with the rain shower in the bathrom and the bed was the kind that makes you want to never leave. Our room was large and the bathroom giant. In addition it was great to visit Las Vegas and be somewhat removed from the strip. The hotel provides service to the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the JW Marriott on March 10 thru March 12, and I must say I was extremely impressed with the overall appearance, service, and value I received from the JW Marriott. I usually stay on The Strip when visiting Las Vegas (usually either at Ceasars Palace, or the Mirage), but had heard many wonderful things about the Marriott. The rooms were very large, with soft, warm down comforters and about five pillows on the bed. The bathrooms included two vanity sinks, extra large bath with whirlpool jets, and a wonderful rainfall shower. The hotel is located about 15 minutes from the strip, but offers a complementary shuttle to and from the strip that runs about 5-6 times over the course of the afternoon and evening. The casino is located away from the guest rooms, which is nice. There are several dining choices located with in the hotel. I ate at the Irish pub a couple of times and the food was great. Anyone who is looking for a great hotel located away from the hustle and bustle of the strip would be wise to give the J.W. Marriott a try.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for Different Vegas Experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed for family vacation. We rented 3 rooms. The hotel is great. Clean, well manicured, comfortable. The rooms are huge. The beds were better than any hotel beds I have slept in (and I've slept in a lot). Bathroom is huge with double vanity sinks and rain shower with separate jacuzzi tubs. All accessories are present. The rooms all have coolers but really could be replaced with fridges. Hotel Restaurant--Ceres--has an excellent brunch and is a great value. Also drank their one afternoon which was also great value. On the down side, the casino restaurants are not as good--especially the cafe. There are no tennis courts on the property (something that is very misleading if you look at the website). There is tons of golf around including TPC Canyons right across the street. Great location to Red Rock Canyon which has great hiking. Views of the golf course are the best. The courtyard views suck and the hotel doesn't acknowledge that. Also, the hotel chintzes out on really basic stuff. There is a nice gym in the spa but it costs $25. The hotel exercise room has one treadmill, one universal weight machine and one bike. The casino attached is not as big as the Vegas casinos, but is nice and accessible. No poker but most other table games.

Reviews.Title: “What a hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed Feb 17 to the 19th. The bed was very comfortable. The room, 3227, was clean and neat. Hotel staff were,5 star, friendly. Didn't have chance to use any of the amenties, golf, sauna,etc it was to cold. The grounds were kept clean. There wasn't even trash or cigg butts any where inside or outside of the hotel. They even have a 24 hour Starbuck's in the hotel,which my wife visited often. If you stay Monday it's steak night. The Sunday breakfast buffet was good. They had crab, omellettes, fruit, Champagne and much more for 14.00 a person. The only problem with the room was that the French doors looking out over the grounds leaked in cold air. Would I stay there again? Yes we are.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: Neekeesha
Reviews.Content: Sorry it took me so long to write this review. I'm going to make this one very simple. This hotel is excellent. Me my husband and mother n law stayed here one night b/c our hotel at the strip wanted to much money for the night we wanted to originally arrive. This hotel is was a breath of fresh air. I loved the views and the just the whole vibe. The attendants at check-in were very courteous and quick. I don't think we spent more than 5 minutes at the counter. We were given a map of the hotel to advise where everything was. We ate at a resturant on site and the prices were very reasonable. We order bacon wrapped prawns and let me tell you it's worth every penny. Oh and there is a Starbucks on site. So if you want that latte, go for it. The pool was an nice size. There's a little water fall that you can stand under. It's real cute. The beds are very comfy. Also the bathroom has a marble shower and jacuzzi tub. All in all, this was a great experience. The JW Marriott is worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and cosy..”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have traveled to more than 200 cities all over the world. As I remember, this resort has the best bathroom I have ever had. I do not know why it is rated 4 star hotel at all. Simply deserves 5 star and more! I had high expectations as I read all reviews on this hotel and my expectation was happily met. I stayed four different hotels in Vegas: JW Marriot resort, TI, Luxor, and Aladdin. so I might be able to give an unbiased review. 1. Bathroom: Jacuzzi for two. huge. clean. 2. Bed: Very nice bed for those who love soft bed. I prefer Heavenly bed in Westin though. (I even ordered the bed from Westin for my own place.) But still nothing to be desired. a lot better bedding than normal 4 or 5 star hotel bed. 3. view: very nice mountain view. 4. Food: every restaurant is cheaper than those in Strip. for example, $9 here for breakfast vs. $13 in Strip. 5. Service: no complaint. front desk staffs were professional although I wish they would be more genuinely friendly like those in Aladdin. 6. Casino: I am not a big gambler - that is why I stayed at the hotel. But the dealers at the Casino kindly taught me how to play. I really appreciate their kindness. very nice to talk to. 7. Transportation: $35 by Taxi. complimentary shuttle. last one from Strip is 11:30 pm which is way too early. The hotel needs to extend the shuttle time. Overall, I would love to stay if I visit Vegas with my boyfriend. Lovely bed and bathroom. Once I learned how to gamble, I probably will stay on Strip if I go myself. I already plan another trip to Vegas in Jan and made a reservation at Venetian this time.

Reviews.Title: “Had Greater Expectations”
Reviews.Author: DoctorRetired
Reviews.Content: Even though we had multiple communications with the hotel property prior to arrival, problems existed at check-in. We were given rooms above the parking lot, and after some aggressive discussion we tried another location. We eventually were given rooms consistent with what we had expected, except that the rooms were connected by a storage room in which plumbing pipes sounded off all night. The front desk did offer us a suite, but could not supply three proper beds, which we had reserved and requested, so we put up with the plumbing noises, which the desk staff refused to admit, while the maintenace people confirmed the consistent problem. The property is spacious and beautiful, but we were not told in advance that the pool area was closed, as well as the adjoning restaurants and bars, and parts of the outside were undergoing construction. Perhaps at another time of the year when the hotel is fully booked, this property will live up to the expectations expressed by other travelers. Even if you speak up, there is an intrinsic resistance for the staff to understand, let alone acquiese to reasonable requests. The restaurants are adequate, but the service is spotty, since most of the restaurants are independently operated at the adjoining casino. We also suspect that this property has a bias against hotel room consolidators and online travel agencies.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for a relaxing trip to Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: PattieB
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 4 nights, based on other trip advisor reviews. We loved the resort! Everyone was friendly, the room was perfect & quiet, and the food was excellent. We stayed on a high floor in the palm tower, expecting a beautiful view - the mountains were pretty, but the closest view was of the roof of the other buildings. Room service breakfast was fabulous but we didn't get our free paper every morning. We enjoyed breakfast and lunch in the restaurant - they brought me a free dessert when they learned it was my birthday. All the waitstaff were very friendly. This hotel is inconvenient to the Strip, so not the place to stay if you want to spend most of your time in Vegas, but it's perfect if you just want to 'visit' Vegas. We took the shuttle in every evening (which only picks up every 2 hours and stops at 11:30 pm - way too early in my opinion). The taxis back to the hotel cost about $35 with tip. The hotel casino is small but sufficient for a few hours - the dealers weren't as professional and made a couple payout mistakes, but had no problem correcting them.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Getaway”
Reviews.Author: kebpitt
Reviews.Content: The JW Marriott exceeded our expectations! The room was very big, ultra-clean and nicely decorated. The bathrooms are huge, with a wonderful rainfall showerhead and seperate jacuzzi tub (for 2!). The staff was friendly and helpful. We even got free cookies delivered to the room (it was Xmas Eve). The 24-hour Starbucks is a nice plus. Note, you most likely will need a car to enjoy the location. It is about 10 miles off the strip (a 20-minute drive w/o traffic). For us, this was perfect. The proximity to Red Rocks Canyon meant that our days were spent hiking, we'd come back to the hotel to relax, and evenings were spent on the Strip. Safe travels everyone!

Reviews.Title: “On and Off the Strip”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed off the stip this time...at the JW Marriott in Summerlin. The hotel was BEAUTIFUL and the room was spacious and clean. The pools were lovely and service was great. We enjoyed the Celine Dion concert and time off the strip as well. Las Vegas is a great place no matter your age, mood, or financial situation.

Reviews.Title: “Thanksgiving Holiday Review”
Reviews.Author: contactjody
Reviews.Content: This is a review of the Thanksgiving Holiday -reviewing both Las Vegas and the JW Marriott. FYI, I am a travel agent in my early 40’s and my boyfriend is an executive in his early 50’s. We have stayed just about everywhere in Las Vegas. Wednesday, November 23rd Taxi ride from Bellagio was approx. $32.00. We arrived at 1:30pm and were given a room right away. Easy, quick check-in. The staff was friendly and helpful. Rooms were very nice and large. The best things about the room were 1) you could open the French doors to a walk out balcony therefore letting you have fresh air (unlike strip hotels) and 2) the very large bathroom with a real nice Jacuzzi tub for two and a large shower big enough for two. The hotel is done in a California craftsman/mission style with nice wood touches all over the place. Casino was adequate and large enough. Dining choices were varied and seemed adequate as well. Beds were very comfortable and it was nice to have free bottled water and robes in the room. We had lunch at their Irish pub restaurant which was good and inexpensive. We also had breakfast there on Friday and it was about ½ the price as room service and less expensive then their 24 hour restaurant. Service was good too. A 24 hour Starbucks was next door. We took advantage of their complimentary shuttle (several times a day) at 5pm and reached Macy’s - their drop off point at 5:20pm. We walked to Paris to see their We Will Rock You Broadway style show which was very good at 90 minutes long. Note: buy the cheapest tickets as all seats seemed great. We got the most expensive which in hindsight would not have opted for. After that, a little gambling at MGM then back to Macy’s for the Marriott’s last pick up at 11:30pm. Each time we took the shuttle it was on time, precisely. Thursday, November 24th After sleeping in and having in-room coffee (bad coffee though) we ventured out to the pool to have lunch. The weather was nice and the pool and Jacuzzi were both working and of perfect temperature. There was no towel Nazi’s to check your towels out and there were plenty of loungers around the pool. The only disappointment is that for that level of Marriott (JW status) the pool chaises should have cushions on them for comfort. Trying to obtain service at the pool was difficult at first but perhaps they did not plan on having such nice weather on Thanksgiving and were short staffed. We both had enormous Bloody Mary’s and split a chicken sandwich at the pool. Beware you are paying room service prices at the pool which add $2 per order fee plus, I believe, an 18% service charge added on too. We took the 5pm shuttle again and were dropped off at the pitch black Macy’s parking lot. We picked up a cab right away and went to THEhotel at Mandalay Bay for some “perfect” view cocktails at their indoor/outdoor lounge high up overlooking Las Vegas. There was a very nice crowd there. We sat outside on their couches, heat lamps and all and enjoyed some pre-Thanksgiving dinner cocktails. Drinks ran about $12.00 each. We had the Thanksgiving Special dinner at MIX, THEhotel. It was sticker shock as my travel mate did not ask the price when he made reservations. $105.00 per person plus beverages and gratuities. Lots of green for a free range four course turkey dinner. Had I known that I would have opted for the less traditional lobster dinner. Wine list was nice and dinner was good but service was a bit much - way overdone! View was nice and we ate in a “pod”. You must see the pods for yourself! Full, we took a taxi back to hotel instead of their shuttle. Once we got back we ventured into the casino and lost. Back to bed! Friday, November 25th We requested late check out as we had a 3pm flight out. They granted it and then we secured their shuttle at $20/per person back to the airport. The tower representative was kind enough to take care of that and then she went on line for us to print out our boarding passes. Check out was easy as well and the airport showed up right on the minute. Hotel Summary I would recommend this hotel to those who want to get away from the hectic strip and those not minding to take the shuttle at Marriott’s appointed time. If you are late nighter - stay on the strip. The hotel is great for families and couples but not for those who like their in-house entertainment. Service was good, rooms were great!

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: 4happycampers
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the JW Marriott Las Vegas for the Thanksgiving holiday from Nov.23-26th. We are a family of 4 with 2 toddlers. We've stayed all over Las Vegas and continue to return to the JW because the rooms are spacious, the pool is one of the best in Vegas, we feel welcome with our kids in tow, and the service is spectacular! THE ROOM: We were lucky enough to get a complimentary stay in a 2 bedroom suite in the Palm Tower this trip due to the kindness of one of the Guest Relations Managers. This room was absolutely amazing!!!! It was over 2000 Sq. feet, with a huge master bedroom with king bed, desk and walk in closet, a master bath with seperate rain show and double sinks. There was a second bedroom also with a king bed, it's own bathroom with seperate tub and rain shower too. The entry included a nice bench and led to the bar area with mini fridge, sink area and barstools. There was a dining area with table & chairs for 6, a living area with 2 sofas, a few chairs and a chaise. There are also entertainment centers in each of the rooms, each with a nice TV. There is a small powder room just off of the entry, so you have a total of 3 bathrooms. These rooms are at the far ends of the hallways and they take up the entire length of the hotel end, there is a large verandah that stretches all the way around the room, it has 2 chaises and a table and 4 chairs for lounging or having meals outside. Each room also had it's own seperate thermostat and temperature controls and ceiling fans too. This was the most amazing room we've ever stayed in. The pictures don't do it justice, it was too big to photograph! THE POOL: This pool is huge and heated, it's one of the best pools in Vegas, surrounded by palm trees, waterfalls, cabanas, and plenty of lounge chairs. There are also life guards on duty. You will also find 2 jaccuzis at either end of the pool. The poolside bar is closed at this time of year, but when we've come in the summer they serve great drinks and food at very reasonable prices. THE FOOD: We were given complimentary breakfast buffet at Cerces each morning of our stay. They also have a menu for those of you who don't enjoy a buffet. The buffet includes, pancakes, waffles, omlettes, eggs, sausage, bacon, crepes, blintzs, potatoes, cereals - hot & cold, fruit, lox & bages, pastries, I probably forgot a few things, but it's a really great buffet. We also did room service Thanksgiving morning and had a nice meal out on the verandah. The room service menu is ok, but slightly limited. They do have a nice children't menu and prices are average. We also ventured to the onsite Starbucks several times for hot chocolate, pastries, sandwiches, and chips. There is also an Irish pub onsite, and Japanese, and Italian restaurants. All are located in the Palm Tower except for Cerces which is in the Spa Tower. THE CASINO: We aren't big gamblers, we didn't even venture into the casino this stay. It's small compared to others in Vegas and very smoky, but if you're staying on site it's a nice alternative to the 20 minute drive to the strip. THE SERVICE: Everyone here is so nice, from the valets to housekeeping. This is our favorite place to stay in Vegas, it's nice to be away from the strip and really enjoy your vacation away from the crowds! Give it a try, you won't be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Simply Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The rave reviews are all true-> what a wonderful resort! Just returned from a three night stay, and the hotel was everything my wife and I had hoped for. Beautiful property with a great staff. Can't see us staying at any other hotel for our future trips to Vegas...

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing Environment”
Reviews.Author: CoTravelsalot
Reviews.Content: Spent last weekend at the JW Marriott Las Vegas and had a great time. The rooms are large and have fantastic bathrooms with seperate showers. The pool area is beautiful and well maintained. The Spa/gym are both nice. It is a great place to stay in Vegas and be out of the Strip Scene.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay (and wedding!) at the JW Marriott”
Reviews.Author: bp3
Reviews.Content: We were married at the JW Marriott a few weeks ago and had an absolutely incredible experience. The hotel is beautiful, the pool is very tranquil and it was perfect in terms of being able to relax with family and friends who were also staying at the hotel. The staff was very accomodating and went out of their way to make sure everything went smoothly. The wedding coordinator was so helpful and made planning a long-distance wedding easy. She was great!
