We would definitely recommend the resort for a wedding or for a vacation. It only took us 15 min. to get to the strip and the resort is also very close to the red rock canyon, which is beautiful! We loved staying at the JW b/c we had the best of both worlds. Close to all the fun on the strip and far enough that you feel like you are really on a vacation. We did not eat in all of the restaurants, but had the breakfast buffet at Ceres (which was great and worth the money). We also had the wedding reception in Ceres which is beautiful at night and the food was delicious. We had our rehearsal dinner at Speidini and the food there was very good as well. If you are into golf, there are about 5 courses in very close proximity to the JW and they are great courses!! We would also highly recommend the spa. They did a great job with hair and the spa pedicure is soooooo relaxing!!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely unbelievable place! Perfect in every way!!!”
Reviews.Author: Angeleve76
Reviews.Content: Check in was a breeze, they cater to your every need. Breakfast buffet was amazing. Omelet station and waffle station....chefs went out of their way to get to know you and ask how you were and if there were any recommendations they could make for sightseeing. Rooms were amazing, jacuzzi tub with separate rain shower and down comforters on the bed....600 square feet in the room! Ate at the Irish place, good food. Ate at the Italian place Speidini, excellent!!! Cigar bar was nice for an after dinner drink. Pool was beautiful. Resort was just far enough away from the madness of the strip. I won this trip through work and could have stayed anywhere and looked at many hotels on the strip...none were comparable to the JW!!!! You will not be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel --”
Reviews.Author: mcneelj
Reviews.Content: Had a concern when we arrived and they gave us a room without a view. Yes, we are one of those who stay at Marriott's often and expect the elite membership to mean something. After going back down to the front desk and talking to the manager, all was worked out. We had a message at the spa and it was wonderful. Highly recommend going at least and hour earlier. The pools, sauna, steam room were so relaxing. They even have an outdoor pool for spa guests...could actually spend the whole afternoon in such a tranquil environment. The casino is small, but we did well on craps and slots. The crap table is quiet...not like LV casinos. Ate with gradkids at the pub, good food and fine for children.

Reviews.Title: “Agree with everyone else, excellent”
Reviews.Author: Paul_East_Wittering
Reviews.Content: I can't really add much to what's already been said, warm, friendly staff. I only have one criticism - the Sushi bar was awful. but the Ceris restaurant, whilst not cheap, was first class.

Reviews.Title: “JW Marriott is heaven on earth”
Reviews.Author: hwt.
Reviews.Content: Wow, what a place. Check-in took 2 minutes and I stayed on the 7th floor...beautiful views. Used priceline and scored the room for $95 dollars, unbelievable deal. I was traveling with my wife and our 7 year old. This is a great spot for kids. Pool has waterfalls and all the amenities. My only complaint is that the pool closes each night at 8 PM, seems a little early....The hot tubs are open all night, very clean and nice. The rooms are immaculate. Bathroom is extra large, and a nice big desk to work from. Beds were very comfortable. The casino was excellent. I stayed on the strip for the rest of the week, but really missed the Rampart. Small and not smokey. Dealers were very friendly and I walked with over $700 in my pocket. Only casino that I won at all week. Next time I will consider staying here all week. The buffet was excellent, comparable to anything on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the JW Marriott”
Reviews.Author: jacksuncle
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife stayed at the JW Marriott from Oct 7th to the 9th, for 2 nights. It was our first trip there, and we were very pleased. The resort is located in Summerlin, right next to Angel Park golf course, and is about 20 minutes from the strip with no traffic. You might hit some traffic, so depending on the time of day you are driving, be prepared. We had a car, so it was fine, but it might take a while by cab from the airport. Checkin was quick and easy, and we self parked, although valet is free, just tip the guys. The hotel is very nicely decorated, and the grounds are nice. The room was pretty large, and everything was clean and tidy. The bathroom was a good size, with separate shower and jacuzzi bath tub big enough for 2. We ate at the Italian restaurant(forget the name, sorry), which was not too expensive, and tasted good, and the Irish Pub and also the cafe. The Irish Pub had a great chicken pot pie. We paid $20 each to use the fitness and spa facilities on Saturday, which is very much worth the money. We worked out for almost an hour in a fitness center that had hardly anyone in it, and then swam in a private pool just outside the fitness center. This pool is for spa users only, and was a perfectly warm temperature. As a matter of fact, the regular pool was also nice and warm, perfect for a swim(FYI). We then used the spa hot tub, steam room, showers, and lounge. They have cold water and juice for you.. wow it was relaxing. The casino was smallish, but still had plenty of games, and some $5 blackjack, which is what I would play if I had played blackjack. I didn't gamble since all the football games were on, but the casino is nice enough, and you still get the Vegas feel. All in all, a great trip, and I would recommmend this place to anyone. Oh, and although this place was listed as a resort, there wasn't that $10 or $14 resort fee that some places like the Hyatts charge, although since they don't have that fee, they do charge for the fitness/spa usage.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Gorgeous”
Reviews.Author: daroge
Reviews.Content: This is one fabulous hotel. Believe ALL the reviews that say it is topshelf luxury. Rooms were lovely, bathrooms were huge, public areas and pool absolutely spectacular. The restaurants were just average. The drive time to The Strip is about 25 minutes. You will be REAL GLAD to have this oasis to return to.

Reviews.Title: “the fourth stay”
Reviews.Author: grossepointeflash
Reviews.Content: we went back to the beautiful JW and this was the best trip to date. I asked for the ground floor room with large patio and got it. Staff was friendlier this time, no problems. I didn't like the trick of "you won a prize, on my door to later find out they were promoting Marriott properties, but that is business. I wish there were more choices for food, either just ok and slow at the Promade and Irish Pub, to expensive. If you don't rent a car, transportation is also a problem from the airport. I rented a town car through the hotel, but $60$ one way. The JW should help, run a shuttle. Rooms are large and quiet. Pool was greats under the 100 temps. Like all casinos, it is hard to find old but true video poker or red, white, blue machines that offer a chance. If you like to be away from the crowds and noise of the strip, the Marriott is for you. Probably not kid set up, but great for relaxing and a leisure pace.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Hotel Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: silversource22
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel is terrific...and is a nice change from staying at The Strip. Rooms and grounds are well maintained, staff is wonderful and the restaurants in the hotel are excellent and quite inexpensive. Also appreciated is the location of the casino...away from the hotel itself. The grassy area around the pool is great on hot days. There is also a 24 hr Starbucks. The adjacent golf course is excellent. Contrary to the reviewer on Sept 6...this is as nice as any of the other JW's that we have stayed at both in the US and internationally and is among our top 2 or 3 choices for a stay in Las Vegas. A car is needed to enjoy the location...lots of shopping and restaurants nearby. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “We Love JW Marriott!”
Reviews.Author: vintagegirl
Reviews.Content: Now this is a great hotel....When we arrived It was 3am because our flight was delayed and we had problems getting our rental car at the airport...Damn Hertz Luxury Car!! But when we got there ...they upgraded us to Penthouse Suite..WOW.....this place was bigger than my house...views for miles...and great beds...big tub in bathroom...and Downstairs...At the Casino...forget the strip..They will rob you..We won almost 1500.00 bucks there...and lost 1/2 of the on the strip..Stay here and play downstairs...You will have a blast...!!!! We are going back for sure...Forget the Strip ....That is for tourists..This is a great place to relax and enjoy the West...Also take a ride out to the caynons..That was amazing..:)

Reviews.Title: “A very nice hotel . . .”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the JW Las Vegas several times. We have enjoyed it very much each time, and this trip was no exception. The grounds are lovely, yet convenient to shopping and restaurants. There are several restaurants on the property. The only one we ate at this trip was the Japanese restaurant and it was very good. We had a lovely suite. It was clean and luxurious, although not exceptional (hence the 4 stars rather than 5). Nevertheless, the room was lovely and comfortable, and the bathroom was exceptional with a large jacuzzi tub and a rain shower. The attached Ramparts Casino is not huge, but there are several tables as well as a wide variety of slots and video poker. It's seldom crowded or smokey. The much larger Suncoast Casino is right next door. If you are new to Las Vegas or love the lights and crowds, I would definitely not recommed the JW. If you have been to Vegas several times, however, you may enjoy the JW as a change of pace. It's easy to get to the strip as long as you are wise about when you travel. Non-rush hour travel to the strip takes about 15 minutes. Rush hour travel would take SIGNIFICANTLY longer.

Reviews.Title: “Forget the strip”
Reviews.Author: blot57
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, casino not the largest but enough. Incredible pool, qulaity food. free shuttle to the strip lots of times daily. Rooms huge and very clean

Reviews.Title: “An Oasis off the Strip!!”
Reviews.Author: Islandgil2
Reviews.Content: I did not stay at this hotel but my boyfriend was there for a conference while we stayed at the MGM. Since he was busy with meetings all day I decided to come with him and use the pool facilities. The management had no trouble what so ever and was nice enough to add my name to the list so no one would hassle me. When I arrived at the pool area and hotel my breathe was taken. It was gorgeous. Full of palm trees and tropical covered walkways. The pool had enough lounges and cabanas to use. When I asked for a towel I had explained I am not staying there and no questions were asked and I was told to enjoy my visit. In the background was wonderful Hawaaiin music sung by authentic muscisians. The pool is huge and has a great waterfall that you can walk under. Also the casino is a bit smaller but if your willing to travel off the strip the tables are lower and the dealers are willing to explain any card game if they're not busy. Theres tons of evidence that shows how this hotel is rated #1 in Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Very refreshing & deserving of #1 rating!”
Reviews.Author: bodyforlife
Reviews.Content: First off, if you're looking for the hustle and bustle of the strip, this is not the hotel for you. On the other hand, if you want a nice relaxing experience then this is the hotel for you. I stayed at "The Hotel" at the Mandalay Bay earlier this summer and found out what a joke that place was (doesn't surprise me it's now down to the #3 rating as their service is a joke). I would suggest the employees there take some notes from the Marriott on how 5 Star service should really be. Let's start with the valet. I used it throughout my stay and I think the longest wait was 2 minutes. Upon check-in we were greeted nicely and someone even called up to our room in the first 10 minutes to make sure everything was to our liking. The pool was quite nice and there were cabanas that were reasonably price ($50 for a half day on the weekdays). If you needed an umbrella, you just asked one of the staff and they would put it up for you right over your lounge chair. Ironically, it's nestled in the suburbs and there are tons of stores in the vicinity and some excellent restaurants. We went to Rosemary's (about a ten minute drive) and had one of the best dinners ever. As for the drive to the strip, someone quoted here it took them 4 hours?! I'm not sure what that was about. Unless some tanker flipped over, realistically you're talking about 25 minutes. You simply hop on to Summerlin Pkwy and then over to I95 and you're pretty much on the freeway the entire drive. I think what's happening with some of the posters here is they are taking the surface roads and that's why it's taking so long. Anyway, had a marvelous time and will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved This Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: hops4
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fantastic. Great way to end a week in Vegas. We spent the week on the strip and moved over to the Marriott for the weekend. We had a car, so getting around was easy. This property is located in a beautiful area of Vegas, with great restaurants and shopping close by, and the strip is only approximately 15 miles away. The staff is wonderful, the rooms are great, and the pool is the best. No crowds to deal with, very relaxing. We truly enjoyed ourselves at the J.W. Marriott, and would definetly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to relax after the strip”
Reviews.Author: rhizome1844
Reviews.Content: After three nights in Ballys on the strip the JW Marriott was a revelation. Although there was no room available when we arrived at 3PM my wife and I were offered free passes to the spa for the duration of our stay - excellent facilities. The rooms are absolutely massive and luxurious. Wonderful view of the mountains and nice choice of air conditioning or fan. Was nice to turn air conditioning off for once. The bathrooms are amazing, including the rain room and jacuzzi. Try the bathrobes - very nice. Most people seemed to agree as they were walking around the pool in them. The pool is fantastic. Good service, plenty of space to relax. You couldn't actually swim in the pool - too shallow/busy but was ideal to cool off. Water coolers available around the pool. The restaurants/bars on site are good. We enjoyed nice food at the Italian restaurant and Irish pub. The buffet is huge but we hated it but not because of the food but theconcept. We have never seen people waste so much food - horrific. The only downside is the cost of transfers. Expect to pay 40 dollars from the strip in a taxi. The hotel did offer to pick us up from the Fashion Mall for free but we did not fancy taking our bags up the strip mid afternoon. One complaint was airport transfers. We were happy to see that the hotel provides a shuttle to the aiport hourly from 5am. However this does cost 20 dollars per person. We thought this was a little unnecessary given the fact that they provide a free shuttle to the strip!!! Overall excellent.

Reviews.Title: “An oasis in the wild world of Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: traveluser
Reviews.Content: After 2 frantic days on the strip at New York, New York, it was a pleasure to spend 5 nights at the J.W. Marriott. This resort is an oasis in the wild world of Las Vegas. The pool area was excellent, the staff was pleasant and our room was large and well-appointed, with a great bathroom and super shower. The Italian restaurant served terrific food, and the Irish pub was great fun. The casino is low key, but there are plenty of machines and table games to keep players occupied. Obviously, my experience differed from that of other recent reviewers, but this is our third visit, and we have always had positive experiences. It is important for prospective guests to understand that this is a relatively quiet and elegant resort, located 20 minutes west of the Strip. A car is necessary to enjoy being in this location. (Check out Red Rock Canyon for a great day outdoors.) If this is the type of vacation environment that you are looking for, the J.W. Marriott is the right choice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place.”
Reviews.Author: tedandlisa90
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice resort outside of Las vegas. We enjoyed our stay here very much. Not a good place to stay if you want to go to the strip, but if you want something more quiet this is the place. The property is HUGE. And we found it best and easier to just stay at the resort. The rooms are very large and elegant, and the bathroom is enormous! We had a Junior suite that is 840 sqft large enough for a small family. My only gripes with the room was the weird air conditioning system that automatically turns off when you open the front door which we had a hard time with and had to call the front desk about. Also if you are traveling with kids make sure to order up rollaway beds its free. We tried the pub downstairs near the casino and also the cafe. we enjoyed both,the food was good and very reasonably priced. (try the HUGE hamburger at the cafe and share,its the biggest hamburger you'll ever see it was great for $8!) The hotel right next door,The Suncoast,is a great place to catch a movie. There is also a great safe child play area for little kids that charges by the hour to entertain your kids while you enjoy the casino or a movie. We didn't try this since our kids are older. But its worth looking into. We didn't have time to try the spa but next time my husband and I travel without the kids we'll be sure to try it.

Reviews.Title: “Justified ranking”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights (thur & fri) in August. Rooms: Large and clean w/comfortable beds, nice view of the golf course, large bath area with jacuzzi tub, shower w/rainfall head and separate toilet closet. Staff: friendly front desk people, very nice car valets, honest housekeeping (I left a tip on the desk, but she wasn't sure it was a tip so she left it with a note). Resort: very nice pool/waterfall area, casino area was not overly smokey (good ventilation?), buffet was avg, Italian place was below avg (pork and chicken dishes were dry), cafe food was avg/grumpy waitress was below avg. I would stay here again, but I would probably go to outside restaurants I discovered after departing (Cheesecake Fac, Kona Grill, PF Changs, Claim Jumper, Buca di Beppo, Macaroni Grill, Joe's Crab Shack...)

Reviews.Title: “quiet place, not much for kids”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had a standard 2 queen room for 4 nights. The room was large but not very impressive. (Have stayed at many 5 star resorts) Furnishings: 2 queen beds with what appeared to be faded orange bedspreads a nite stand between the beds one work desk with a chair on each side a TV cabinet with drawers a dorm size white fridge in the corner of the room (not a nice decorative touch) Lots of floor space The room appeared clean except for a light amount of dust on the lamp base. functional french doors (with a past guests kiss marks on the glass, ewww) opening to a railing arched entrance from hallway /bathroom/ closet area, to the bedroom walkin closet with safe and iron/board storage and 2 robes built in bar area for coffee maker and cooler stocked with bottled purified drinking water The bathroom was large and nice a corner jetted tub and separate shower (no matter what we did to prevent it, we wound up with a huge puddle on the floor after showering) long counter with 2 sinks and storage underneath toilet in its own closet TV speaker in bathroom plenty of lighting no fan and no soundproofing good towels Common areas could use more housekeeping attention lots of splatters and fingerprints in the elevator, carpets need vacuuming room service used once, good service and food , standard resort room service pricing went once to buffet , good deal complimentary valet parking was worth the tipping grounds were nicely landscaped, lots of walkways and water features pool was large with waterfalls and a shallow area for smaller kids cabana rental was good (neccesary to keep our crabby 13 year old from driving us insane with her complaints about the heat and boredom) pool side food/drink service was fine poolside entertainment was a very talanted singer and funny too, hawaiian cowboy, as I recall. Made an afternoon at the pool into an event. Unless you have things to do to fill the days, if you have kids along, this probably isn't the place for you. Good to relax and be quiet ....but nothing, except the pool (which closes fairly early), for kids. Had an incident on our first full day which, in our opinion, was a theft. The item was the only thing left out when we weren't in the room. (I am a neat freak.) The item had to be intentionally unplugged and removed, it wasn't little or light weight. We wanted to believe that it was an accident but after investigating we were convinced it was a theft by someone with access to our room, a hotel employee. Not good. We have never experienced that before. Staff was ok..standard resort people. all in all, and average resort.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property”
Reviews.Author: nessnesskitty
Reviews.Content: Big rooms with nice details, the bathroom is huge and the Jacuzzi was great. This is a nice place to get away although the area it's in is quite busy but you can get lost at the resort. We ordered up a refrigerator for drinks - nice way to save some money.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Looking, Poor Attitudes, too uptight for Vegas”
Reviews.Author: sunnybeach
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during fourth of July weekend, we went because of Tripadvisors reviews and wanted to be away from the madness on the fourth of July down by the strip. First of all, the hotels appearance is all that they say it is, beautiful, fresh and clean. The attitudes, however, were very stiff and cold. We brought our two kids along, another reason we chose to stay here, seemed more family oriented and Vegas is running out of "nice" places for families to stay. It did not feel family oriented at all. We were stared at because our youngest is three. staff acted as if they couldnt believe children were there with us? There are a large number of older patrons, who frown on kiddies as well, we felt it all over, very uptight atmosphere. My husband is African and I am white, the racist glares from this place were hard to take at times. Usually, in Vegas, it's a place for everyone. The only place overrun by kiddies was the pool area. Beautiful pool, however, as a parent, beware of the cabanas, there are seedy individuals who rent them out (they are completly covered) and very adult activites going on in front of kids, as the doors sway open at times and you can see in. I did also complain about this to the managemnt, who responded promptly to me, said it happens all the time, but thanks for reporting it, but it was nearing the end of the day and the pool was going to close anyways, so I'm not sure what was actually done about it? We went to the hotels restaurant to have breakfast and we were the only ones there in line, place was nearly empty (we arrived late on purpose to get good seating) There were three workers there, ignored us for about ten minutes, as if we were invisible, then finally took the time to seat us. The waitress was rude and edgy. We ate and left feeling very uncomfortable. I couldnt believe all this, such a nice place with great reviews. I decided to reserve judgement and go to the casino, which you pretty much have to if you want to gamble, as it is far from the strip. It got worse. The dealer in front of me was openly arguing with her floor manager, YELLING in a foreign language, she was rude and angry, threw cards at me and had the worst of attitudes. then, when she saw I wasnt tipping her, She had the nerve of accusing me of handling the cards roughly?? Me? THats a first for me in ALL of Vegas! I know she was mad because I didnt tip her, who would? I got up to leave her table after I couldn't take it anymore. I complained to the hotel manager later, she claimed that the casino is contracted out to the Marriott and is not owned by the Marriott. Okay, but it's still in your hotel? She claimed she would give my entire room service tab to the casino to pay since they didnt know how to treat a guest properly. I was relieved and felt better over this. Until I got the bill, only one snack room service order had been removed, all else remained. Also, We felt it would okay to stay away from the strip, we had a vehicle, we drove in from L.A., so we figured we could just drive ourselves to the strip! Wrong! Traffic on the strip is unconceivably deadlocked, especially on holidays. We drove into town, took over two hours due to dead stop traffic, we got fed up and tired, so we turned back, all in all it took us roughly 4 HOURS to get to the strip and back to the hotel, and we didn't even get out of the car! Never again. Don't drive, use a taxi and be prepared to pay big bucks from this Marriott out ot the strip and back. They have a shuttle, goes to designated areas, it's timed and numbered, so with two kids in 125 degree heat, that wasn't an option. On the plus side, The bathroom rainshowers are great, the large in room T.V's are nice too. Also, I have to say the Irish pub is the nicest place in the hotel, classy yet very laid back, nice service, fantastic food, if only the entire place could be that way!

Reviews.Title: “6 night stay”
Reviews.Author: scottylass
Reviews.Content: I stayed at JW for 6 nights with my husband and 2 kids. We had already stayed at the Wynn on the strip before we arrived here. We upgraded to a one bedroom suite for extra $60 on arrival and it was super, large balcony massive bathroom with double bath and huge shower, 2 tv's. I had no compaints about the room at all. The grounds are lovely with a nice pool. I found the hotel to be very quiet, hardly anyone around in the evenings and no entertainment especially for kids. The pool area is completely shaded before 6pm so we were looking for somthing to do in the evenings. We took the shuttle to the strip on one occasion and although the service is quick and free it only takes 20 people on a first come basis, so to make sure we would get on we turned up really early, the problem is that the line is outside and not comfortable having to wait when it is so hot, I think they should organise this a little better, maybe handing out a pass when you arrive so you could then sit inside in the cool. It is the same on the way back, the pick up point is outside Macy's (fashion show mall) which closes at 9pm so you must wait outside again. I am not sure that I would stay at this hotel again, yes it is lovely but there are fantastic hotels on the strip at the same room rate, the Venetian also has huge rooms. If you plan to go to Lake Mead or Hoover Dam it is better to stay at Lake Las Vegas, much closer and a really stunning area. No complaints about the hotel or service, I suppose it is just a matter of preference and if you are like me and spent 10 hours flying to Las Vegas then I would ratter stay on a classy hotel on the strip, you can always hire a car from there to see some other parts of Nevada.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room Great Pool Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Babymakes3
Reviews.Content: Hubby, 2 year old and myself stayed 6/18 - 6/23. A family get away to relax and have some fun. The pool was our favorite... The pool was VERY kid friendly our daughter loved the it. There was a large shallow knee high area that spills into the main pool. There was drink and food service, you could get umbrellas and rafts at the pool house. Waterside Coolers are awesome they some kind of lemonde vodka drink. Yummy. The Grounds were very nice the baby saw a bunny she was so excited. There are lots of flowers and koi ponds. The best food we had there was from room service/hotel restaurant. It was quick and not too expensive. The menu is a bit limited though. No club sanwiches which seemed wierd. The Irish pub was BAD for burgers. The buffet was not so good BUT we only went once for lunch. The coffee shop was closed most of the time for renovations when we were there so we never tried it. The room was so pretty. We most likely had a basic king room. We checked in late and I did not even try for an upgrade. The french doors opened and we had a pretty view of the mountains just over the entrance. The bathrooms are great plenty of room to put all of your stuff. I felt like a princess when I was getting ready to go out at night. I tipped the maid on the first day so we had plenty of everything. Our room was kept up nicely. Bed was super comfy. I asked for extra pillows. After a bit of "we are running low" they delivered them. I only wish they had a mini bar instead of a little empty fridge that never worked. If I stay here again I would ask for the tower closer to the pool. Not the tower one you check in at. We had a great babysitter from "Nannies and Grannies" (recommended by the hotel) she liked to play with my daughter. She came back a few more times and my daughter was always happy to see her. If you want to stay here rent a car. It is nesteled in a residential area. Nice shopping and grocery stores near by. The strip is 20-30 mins away. After seeing some of the crowded strip hotels I was so glad we stayed at this beautiful hotel. We were traveling with a little one and wanted to relax. If you were coming in for a night or something this is not the place. You need a little time to ejoy your surroundings. I asked for a late check out on the last day because I was a Marriott Rewards member we did not have to check out until 3pm. Worst part of our trip was the flight. I will never fly Jet Blue again. It is not worth the discounted fare for that long of a flight (from NY).

Reviews.Title: “cannot believe this hotel is rated #1 on Tripadvisor”
Reviews.Author: Tess23
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed at the JW Marriott this week when we were in Las Vegas (we first stayed at TheHotel at Mandalay Bay for one night--wonderful stay!). I'm a huge Tripadvisor fan and was excited by all of the positive reviews of this hotel. Wow, I wonder if we stayed at a different hotel. I expected way more from a JW Marriott--have stayed at 'regular' Marriotts that were far nicer. We're also no strangers to Las Vegas and visit there once or twice a year. Since we had our two teenagers with us this trip, we thought staying off the strip would be a good idea--not. We used Marriott Rewards points for our two night stay--I'd be very interested in knowing if this had anything to do with our less than stellar room. FYI--We were in room #5217 in the Palms Tower--far from everything--I would suggest requesting the Spa Tower. Here's my take: No one was friendly in the least (and we're pretty friendly folks), except for one bellman as we were checking out; our room was large but had exactly three pieces of furniture floating around in all of the space--2 hard back desk chairs and an ottman; the carpet had numerous large and dark stains (UGH); bathroom was large and the showerhead was absolutely marvelous; no turn-down service; one of the bedspreads had a 6-8 inch rip in it; pool was nice; hotel itself was in suburbia (not special in any way, shape or form). The hotel seemed empty of life and excitement and no one appeared to be in charge--sounds strange to say but we all had odd vibes from this place. The most disgusting thing about this hotel was the sharp stench of mold/mildew in our room. When I asked someone at the front desk to please send someone up to take care of the smell, she totally blew me off and quickly said she'd 'tell housekeeping.' Okie-dokie but nothing ever came of it. When we gave the valet our car ticket one night, it took them forever to find the car--then they admitted that it was 'temporarily misplaced.' WHAT?? Not to worry, though, and the valet soon came wheeling up in our car while EATING AN ICE CREAM BAR. I kid you not--my family and I were laughing at this point--we were totally missing TheHotel, though. All in all, I was very disappointed in this hotel and plan on writing Marriott to tell them. I would NOT recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic - stay away from the strip”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Wr stayed here for 4 days in March. Booked through expedia and got a great deal at under $140 a night. This was the end of our 3 week touring holiday and wanted to relax before heading back to the UK. When we arrived in Las Vegas 3 weeks prior we stayed on the strip for 2 nights. Now that we have experience the Marriot we will never stay on the strip again. You are close enough to visit all the sites but it is nice to get back to a relaxed, quiet and far more tasteful hotel at the end of the day. The pool is fantastic, especially if you are with children, the staff are all, without exception, professional and really do mean it when they say "hope you enjoy your stay". The rooms are large (which can't be said of hotels on the strip) with bath as well as shower and most have lovely views over the grounds. If you are travelling to Las Vegas you will want to stay on the strip as we did when we arrived. All I can say is that once you have tried the marriot you will be converted. The strip is seedy, the hotels are noisy, and the --- touts have no regard for the fact that you are with your wife and children.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at the J.W.”
Reviews.Author: Allison1967
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the J.W. for three nights (July 22nd - 25th). The resort is beautiful - the rooms are large and the bathrooms are awesome, especially the tub and shower. The dining choices aren't wonderful, i.e. expensive, and there isn't a fast food court like many strip hotels, nor is there a kids camp, game room or an arcade for children. The casino is thick with smoke. The pool is nice, big and never crowded, however, it's salty. Valet parking is free and quick. We always received what we requested, i.e. extra towels, etc. from the front desk. It's a few minutes away from the hustle and bustle of the strip, which we love. However, I don't think the hotel is up to par with Four Seasons or Ritz Carlton - especially when it comes to kids. Luckily, we got a great deal.

Reviews.Title: “The Pool is Worth Mentioning”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the perfect alternative to the Strip Hotels. I am a former resident, so I'm not really interested in the flash and trash of the Strip anymore. This is an excellent place to relax, but still be close to fine dining, golf, and sightseeing. I'm surprised very little has been said about the pool. It is big and beautiful, with lots of palms, and two little waterfalls to play in. There are 2 whirlpools nearby, and the cabana rental is very reasonable, $50 for half day $100 full day. We did have one very odd problem. Our room was near the elevator, and our privacy sign kept getting stolen! The housekeeping staff was very gracious, but still we were disturbed early in the morning when all we wanted to do was sleep in. We had Sunday brunch in Ceres restaurant, and the food, ambiance, and service were execllent. We checked out the menus for the other restaurants, and the prices seemed very reasonable. If you want to gamble, there is the Rampart Casino in the hotel. It seemed very smoky compared to the Strip, and even the local Station casinos. They have the newest slots, and the table limit is only $5. I would highly recommend this hotel for a relaxation weekend, or a romantic getaway.

Reviews.Title: “deserves to be number one!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel a year ago based on the reviews. Originally, I thought it was too far from the strip but after reading the reviews and seeing the web page felt confident. As the time neared for our stay at the JW I told my husband "I have a feeling we may not want to leave this hotel". I was right and we extended our stay 2 extra nights. The last night of our trip we stayed at Caesar's and were really let down. Everything about this property was great and you really never needed to leave. Irish Pub, Starbucks, Wonderful restaurants especially the premiere steak house...etc The Spa is also worth the extra fee. It was just extremely relaxing and fun.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: At the end of a busy day in Vegas, this is hotel to relax at. I've stayed here time and time again and I always get the same great service and the rooms are immaculate. Most importantly, when I ask for a NON smoking room, I actually get a non smoking room. The rooms are clean and spacious and I love that you can open the french doors and breathe fresh air. I absolutely love the rain shower and jacuzzi in the bathroom, which is also spacious. There is a make up mirror and great lighting in the bathroom for us girls who want to doll up for a night on the town. I've stayed at plenty of hotels in Vegas and this is the one I keep coming back to. The hotel's lobby is not packed with people and it doesn't take a hour for you to catch an elevator.

Reviews.Title: “Not a fan of Vegas, but loved the JW Marriott!!”
Reviews.Author: jtmcclay
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a Vegas trip during Memorial Day weekend and it was a wonderful experience! Our check in was smooth, the staff very helpful and welcoming. We were in town for business which happen to be on our 15th wedding anniversary! The management promptly brought champagne and strawberries to our room which was wonderful! The rooms are quite large as are the marble bathrooms with double sinks, over sized jacuzzi tub and full walk-in shower. I felt like I was in the Four Seasons Hotel! The bed was very comfortable and we even had a ceiling fan (not ususally seen in hotels)and a large walk-in closet. We did not have a great view, mostly the parking lot, but with some mountains in the background. Our first full day at the hotel, we had to track the cleaning/maid service down to make up our room (at 4pm!) but it was never a problem again. WE never ordered Room Service but we ate lunch at the small cafe by the lovely pool. It has great sandwiches and such and was reasonably priced. The Pool was absolutely beautiful and even though it was a holiday weekend, it never felt over crowded! A big plus for families...the pool staff has LIFEGUARDs on duty who responded promptly, professionally and quickly when a 3 year old slipped under the water out of view of his mother. No harm done, child was fine! As for the food, we did not visit any of the restaurants on site, some of which we heard are quite good. We did visit and loved that there was a Starbuck's Coffee on the property. The spa/fitness area is very nice. The equipment needs some updating, however.It is about a 15 min ride by cab or complimentary shuttle to the strip. Please note, however, that the hotel shuttle picks you up at Macy's on the strip. So if you are at MGM, you have to take a cab the 2+ miles to get the shuttle back to the hotel. They shuttle was always on time and the driver very friendly with complimentary COLD water for everyone on board! I would stay here again and I would bring my young daughters to enjoy this lovely resort-style hotel!

Reviews.Title: “A Real Vacation”
Reviews.Author: BillC4
Reviews.Content: After a few stays on the strip you'll find this hotel a totally relaxing place where you can have a real vacation. The location is in the beautiful and upscale planned community of Summerlin. If you want to go other places rent a car for $20. a day. Downtown is only a few miles. The strip is further, but it's all freeway getting there. The best part of my trip was playing in the Rampart Casino. It's a cozy place with great paying machines, good cash back, easy comps and good food. You won't find any place like this on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel but too far from the Strip”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is very nice, but the major problem is that it is too far from the strip. If you stay here, you end up spending approximately $80 daily on cabs. The complimentary shuttle is not practical since it is available only every two hours, you have to stand in line early since it fits only 20 people (if your number is 21 you are out of luck), and the latest shuttle leaves the strip at 11:30 pm (which is too early to go to sleep if you are on vacation).

Reviews.Title: “Very, Very Enjoyable Stay”
Reviews.Author: grandriverrapids
Reviews.Content: We just returned after a 4 day stay at the JW Marriott for business and pleasure. We loved our room--the beds were VERY comfortable--the best hotel bed I ever slept on, with cozy bedding. The carpets and wallpaper showed some wear in our room, however. The bathrooms were large; the water pressure under the rain-shower and the whirlpool were wonderful. Very enjoyable to use. Amenities in the bathroom were nice. Overall, it was very quiet and relaxing. The hotel was clean, well vacuumed, and smelled fresh. The pool was also refreshing; the water temperature just right. The poolside restaurant offered great sandwiches and drinks. Walkways outside were enjoyable, with palm trees, flowers, and water areas with small waterfalls. Almost all staff were attentive and hospitable. The restaurants and casino were great! Because the resort is so large, I think it needed more directional signs, even though a resort map is provided.

Reviews.Title: “far from the frenzy but close enough to the action”
Reviews.Author: rocdoc304
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel choice if you don't mind being 20 minutes away from the strip. It is an easy expressway drive to the strip and just minutes away from Red Rock Canyon. The rooms are fantastic with amazing whirlpool bathrooms and oversized rooms overlooking beautiful grounds. The casino was uncrowded and the dealers were really friendly unlike many strip casinos.The pit boss even was giving us advise on basic blackjack strategy! The restaurants were very good and the exercise facility was immense with just about every piece of equipment imaginable. My only gripe was that the massage services seemed assembly-line like. I felt rushed out afterwards because the next scheduled client was arriving in several minutes. I was able to utilize the whirlpools and sauna post-massage and that was wonderful. It was too cold to use the pool but it looked very nice. I will definitely be back. A room like this would cost 3 times as much on the strip!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent alternative to strip hotels...”
Reviews.Author: astonmartinv8
Reviews.Content: Having visitied Las Vegas 10 times over the last 7 years, I am pleased to advise we found that the JW Marriot in Summerlin was an excellent alternative to the strip hotels when we stayed for four nights over the memorial day weekend. We stayed in a very spacious junior suite (comfortable bed, wet bar, good view if you pick floors 5/6, rain shower and jacuzzi, good sitting area) and found the service excellent. The gym / spa and pool are all well equipped and the general atmosphere is far more peaceful, whilst still retaining all of the typical Las Vegas amenities and gambling options. They do run a shuttle bus although this can fill up and it only goes to the fashion show mall. Expect to pay between $30 and $40 for a cab from the strip including tip. For an alternative off-strip dining option, I recomend Rosemary's in Summerlin which is about 10 minutes drive away - the valets may even drop you off for a small tip. They have excellent top-end food and a comprehensive wine list - the wine is half-price Sundays and it is accordingly somewhat of an institution. We will stay at the Marriot again.

Reviews.Title: “Stick with the Strip Hotels...”
Reviews.Author: Illinois-Proud-Mom
Reviews.Content: I planned this trip for my husband's speacial birthday as a surprise for him.... Frist to set the record straight, it's not 5 or 10 mins from the strip, it's a least 20 to 30mins... especially on the weekends. When we arrived Friday night, they put us in a double bed room facing a street in the far tower and it looked like there was a building being built across the way from our window. I called down and told them I requested a King bed in the Spa tower, they said there was no room available and this was the best they could do. After calling back again I spoke to a woman who told me I made my reservations on the internet for a discounted rate.... I don't know what she would say that for... whether I booked at the $375 each nite or $275 rate, it should have no bearing on the service she's to provide me or the respect that any customer deserves. She embarrased me and then had someone else call me to tell me they had a king size bed one floor down facing the fountains. We moved and after we finally settled in, I realized we didn't get the champaign and strawberries I requested with a personal concierge planner a month in advance... (not to the personal planner's fault) so once again I needed to call down. I was told they saw the request and will see that they are delivered. No apology. Yes, we did finally get the champaign. After we went to dinner, I called down to ask for the mgr on duty, I was given two names whom were away from the desk or on lunch break. I was told to just call the weekend mgr (he would be in at 7am) and leave a voice mail for him to call me back. I did leave a voice mail msg. On Saturday, we enjoyed our spa appt and service at the spa. I didn't recieve a call from the front desk mgr and did not want to go into it again with anyone else. I wanted this to be a special trip for my husband and I felt I would handle it when I returned home so not to ruin our vacation with the time it took to complain about how I was treated. I feel the night staff needs to be trained in handling situations such as mine. I feel the woman I spoke to needs to be told she can not treat someone rude because they did not pay top dollar to stay at the JW Vegas. We made the decision to check out Saturday afternoon and stay at a hotel on the strip that we always stay when we come to Vegas... they treat us very well! I stayed at the JW in Arizona with my girlfriends last year and we had inpecable service and a wonderful stay. Unfortunitely, I can not say that about the JW vegas. It's very upsetting to be treated terribly when you go out of your way to see that everything is set before you arrive and to be told in so many words, if you would have paid top dollar you'd recieve better service at the JW vegas. RE: Aquae Sulis Spa: We enjoyed our service!! The two ladies who gave us our couple message we're great! I also wanted to mention the spa manager who helped to find my earrings I lost at the SPA on Saturday... she delivered them herself to me after we had checked out and after her shift, to our strip hotel. I feel she went above and beyond! She truely is a great employee!! I know this is an experience I won't forget due to the rude comments. I read the great reviews on Tripadvisor.com about the jw vegas and thought I made the best choice because of my great experience at the JW in arizona, but I was wrong. I will return to the JW Arizona with my family because the rooms, service and staff are top notch. Unfortunitely, I would not recommend the jw vegas to anyone... 1. it's too far from strip 2. the carpet and furniture need to be replaced 3. yes the bathrooms are great but how long are you really in your bathroom? 4. the grounds are beautiful 5. the casino is like being on a river boat in Illinois, not like a VEGAS strip hotel feel at all. 6. night service staff is rude Lesson learned... Stick with the what you know... stay at the strip hotels, they are the BEST!

Reviews.Title: “JW Las Vegas Rocks!”
Reviews.Author: ecjr
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a week stay at JW from 4/23-4/30. The Hotel is magnificent. The grounds are beautiful, especially pool area. Stayed for free using Marriott Rewards Points. Notwithstanding this, we were given a great room on the 6th (top) floor of Spa Tower overlooing the mountains. The room was large, but the bathroom was huge! Marble everywhere. Basic decorations but plenty of room for a family of four. Ate in Ceres Restaurant for breakfast. They have a great and reasonable ($13.95 adults, 7.95 kids) breakfast buffet. Many selections to choose from. Food at Poolside Cafe also quite good and reasonable. Casino was typical. Not too lavish and a little smoky. My husband and I went for a 50 minute massage. ($100 plus $18.00 tip). The Spa is truely lovely. Seperate workout area (must pay $20/day if not receving a treatment). The massages were great and they have a nice area to shower, change, etc. with all of the amenities you could possibly want. Spa also has seperate whirlpools, outdoor pools and relaxing areas. Trip to Strip (went evey day) took 15-20 minutes max. Nice to stay off trip and just "visit". You can valet park at all hotels for free. Just $1 tip for valet. Saw Mystere at TI. Great show for all ages. Also saw Mama Mia at Mirage. Also very good. Highlight of trip was a helicopter tour of the grand canyon (used Look Tours). Trip went from downtown Las Vegas over Hoover Dam and Lake Mead and through entire canyon. Stopped at a ranch for a cowboy breakfast and horseback ride before return trip down the stip. Cannot say enough how great it was! My entire family cannot stop talking about it. Well worth the money. Can't wait to return to Vegas and the JW.

Reviews.Title: “10th Anniversary Trip -- Great time”
Reviews.Author: Chocochef
Reviews.Content: Just got back from our 10th wedding anniversary trip. First time staying the the JW Marriott. Wife doesn't like the smokey Vegas strip hotels and we were looking for more of a spa experience, so went with the JW. Got the AAA package with breakfast included both nights ($238/night rate). Very pleased with the hotel. It's only about 5-10 minutes away from the strip and has a wonderful golf resort feel to it. Very well landscaped, lush grounds, nice architecture. Not too crowded at all, saw some leisure and some business travelers. Hardly any smoke, even in the Rampart casino in the evenings. Stayed in the standard room and it was quite nice. Tons of room, almost looked like it was missing some furniture since there was so much space. Still had a "Marriott" feel, neutral wallpaper and carpet looked a little older. Not quite comparable to the suite at Caesar's Palace tower, but much better than your average Vegas room. Very comfortable king bed, ceiling fan, large walk-in closet with convenient electronic safe and two robes. Bathroom was huge, with whirlpool tub for 2 (sort of a "peanut" shape), shower with rainfall, granite vanity. The "cooler" fridge was useless, but there was free bottled water. Room was in the Palm Tower which was a bit of a walk from the spa and Ceres restaurant for breakfast, but really not too far. Each tower has its own valet parking (free for guests) and check-in desk which was convenient. We stayed on the 6th (top) floor and had a beautiful view from the french doors. No real balcony to step onto, but it looks like the suites might have balconies with chairs. Service overall was very good. Friendly, courteous staff. Greeted us by name when we called for a wake up call (yes, it shows on their computer but it's a nice touch anyway). Spent most of Saturday in the Aquae Solis Spa. Booked massage for me, European facial, manicure and pedicure for my wife. Spa area is very nice, separate facilities for men and women, but a common area in the back between with a private pool and jaccuzzi for spa guests only. Very intimate setting, mostly couples or women. Ordered lunch from the room service menu and had it delivered to the spa pool in back, only took about 30 minutes. The waterfall shower was intense, decent jaccuzzi, cold plunge, steam and dry sauna and lots of lounging area to just relax. Also free juices, citrus water and fruit. Had dinner on the strip at Bobby Flay's Mesa Grill in Caesar's. Wonderful food, excellent service, great atmosphere. Highly recommend the roasted corn tamale with shrimp appetizer and the signature pork tenderloin. Decided to come back to the hotel and play at the Rampart Casino Saturday night since the strip table limits were $15+ everywhere and couldn't find an open table on a Saturday night. Rampart was great, $5 minimums. Took a few minutes to get a seat, but dealers were friendly and the players seemed to be having a good time overall. Not too smoky either compared to the strip. Played till about 2:00 am and noticed a lot fewer people after midnight, must be a lot of locals. Breakfast was included and was the breakfast buffet at Ceres. Excellent food, lots of fresh fruit and pastries, omelettes, eggs and waffles made to order, usual selection of bacon, sausage, potatoes, cereals, lox, cream cheese, bagels, fresh squeezed OJ and good coffee. Good service too. Ours was free, but the bill for two would have been about $30 including tax. Ceres is surrounded by some waterfalls and you can sit outside if you'd like. Overall had a great experience and would definitely stay again. Really liked the resort feel and the lack of smoke. Would be good for couples or families. Saw a lot of weddings going on there also. Main pool area looked very nice, want to go back again to use that. Close enough to pop down to the Strip for shows, sights, dining, etc. but still far enough away to relax. Note: we had a car which I'd strongly recommend if you want to go to the Strip.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at many 3-5 star Hotels since Mar 2004. We have not found anything as nice or as classy as JW Marriotts. We are still talking about that resort. I'd highly recommend it to anyone. We look forward to going back.

Reviews.Title: “The best in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Gadgeteer1066
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Monte Carlo on the strip for 4 nights prior to moving out to the JW Marriott for 5 nights. Picked the Monte Carlo for location and being mid-priced. For us, 4 nights on the Strip is more than plenty and we looked forward to moving to somewhere more relaxed for the second half of our holiday. We booked it based solely on tripadvisor recommendations and were not disappointed. Firstly location. Yes it is about 20 mins from the Strip. So if all your activities centre around there, then this may not be the best spot for you. However, it is not a difficult journey to get down there. You just turn right out of the hotel onto Rampart and then keep going until you turn left on to the road that will deposit you on the right part of Las Vegas Blvd. For us, mostly Sahara (about 4 blocks from memory) then you keep on going until you hit the Strip. Upside is that Summerlin is a world away from the hussle and bussle and great for getting out into the hills. Red Rock Canyon is minutes away and it is well located for the 95 and 215 if you want to go elsewhere outside Vegas. The hotel itself is set in its own, well maintained gardens and grounds. There is no road noise, no sense of air pollution and the views of the hills are just great. Reception We arrived and went to check in at the Spa Tower. there were two receptionists on duty and we were seen within a few minutes. We arrived early at 11.00 but were given a room for immediate occupation. We had a ground floor room in the Palms Tower, looking out across towards the hills. We got back in the car and drove around to the other tower and used the free Valet Parking. Car parked, bags brought to room without any delay. Used the Valet parking all the time we were there. Extremely friendly and helpful with directions and advice. We had hired an open top Mustang and they would put the top up and down for us when we came and went without needing to be asked. The Room. I have noted a couple of people saying the rooms looked tired, or other less than complimentary comments about the rooms. So, I am very happy to report that this was not the case. You enter the room via a marble floored hallway, with the bathroom off to the right. It contains a two seater whirlpool bath and seperate shower unit, with standard wall shower or overhead rain head shower. There is a seperate WC accessed from within the bathroom. Lots of good quality product in the bathroom, although I don't recall it having any special name (but I am a guy). Back into the corridor and you next pass a walk in closet on your right with safe, ironing board and iron and plenty of hanging space for clothes. The corridor then opens out into one of the largest bedrooms I have seen in a hotel. Ahead of you is a standard TV/Drawer unit and beyond that a desk and 2 chairs. To the right is a king size bed (extremely comfortable) and a sofa and an armchair. There is also a round coffee table. the opening double patio doors looked out onto the hills and made the room bright and airy. The room has a modern air con unit with digital display mounted on the wall. It also has a large ceiling fan and over head light, both working on variable slider switches so you can set them just so. Wallpaper, carpets, fittings in first rate condition. No signs of wear and tear at all. Room Service. We had beakfast brought to the room on a couple of days. it is delivered on a wheeled table, with winged sections that are expanded to make a large dining table. We had it placed in front of the patio doors so we could take in the view. What I liked about Room Service was that the prices were reasonable and you did not feel you were being ripped off. Can't remember exact prices in the Monte Carlo, just a feeling that you would NOT want to pay that much. I think Champagne worked out at less than half the price of the Monte Carlo. The public areas inside the hotel. The whole place has a very open, airy and chilled out feel to it. There is plenty of marble in the lobbies and corridors connecting the two towers, with high celings and wide passageways. Maybe the feeling is enhanced because we moved away from the Strip and all the crowds, but it feels tranquil. In fact that's a word that a lot of people there was using to describe it, a sort of oasis in the desert. We ate in the Japanese restaurant one evening. Service was good and attentive. Not had much experience of Japanese food, but everything seemed well prepared and was certainly fresh and tasty. There is also a sushi bar in there and they also do Taipan table preparation. We had a lunch and an evening snack in the Irish pub. Good simple straight forward food with an Irish slant. They also pulled an exceptional pint of Guinness. The evening we went in, there was a live band playing. Mostly good, but one of the singers hit a few bum notes. However this was made up for in enthusiasm and energy. In fact, your typical pub entertainment. Staff friendly and some were actually Irish, coming from an area less than 20 miles away from my wife's parents village over in Ireland. Next door to the Irish pub is a Starbucks, open 24 hours. Your room key gets you a a free size upgrade on your drinks there. We had drinks in the Ceres lounge. Large comfy chairs and sofas and attentive staff. We did not eat there. We had a breakfast in the cafe which faces on to the casino floor on our last morning. (We had come down at a time when the buffet place was closed, probably switching from breakfast to lunch?). They ask if you want to sit smoking or non-smoking, but as the place opens out into the casino, you don't get a lot of choice. We also had a meal in the casino's 'fine dining' restaurant. I can't recall its name and had a very average dining experience. we ate at 8pm and when it came to desserts, got the definate impression they wanted to pack up early and get off home. I believe the casino and this place is under different management than the hotel itself. We also had some drinks and snacks at the pool side bar. Friendly and attentive staff. Never found the time to use the pool, but it looked very inviting. there were also plenty of cabanas dotted about if you wanted to make a day of it. Summary. Oned of the nicest, friendliest and most comfortable places I have stayed. A true oasis but so close to vegas. If you are hiring a car, then getting around will not be a problem. You will be able to dip into Strip as and when you want but more importantly, escape from it!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but don't eat there”
Reviews.Author: Ana María
Reviews.Content: I recently visited Las Vegas this march for 6 nights with my husband and our children. We choose this hotel because it's not in the strip and we wanted a quiet place. This is a pretty hotel with very comfortable and bigger rooms and bigger bathrooms. The shower was the best, it's like being in Niagara. Nice service and very clean. But the food was awful. We ate in three restaurants and the three wasn't good. We ask nuggets for room service and it seemed cooked the day before. Besides this problem, if you want to relax in Vegas (I know it sounds wierd in Vegas) this is a quiet, very nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “J W Marriott Las Vegas was great”
Reviews.Author: sgcaver
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here on Easter Sunday and Monday. Although it is away from the strip, we enjoyed the peace and quiet. We went to the Spa at the resort on Monday for massage, facial and reflexology services and it was wonderful. I would recommend the resort if you want to get away from the crazy strip.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful getaway from the Strip”
Reviews.Author: italian1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this resort for 4 days. It was so nice to get away from the craziness of the Strip. The pool area is beautiful, the spa is clean and restful, the room was huge, especially the bathroom. The best thing about this resort though is the staff! Every single person I interacted with was friendly, knowledgable, accomodating and seemed to be truly interested in making my stay a great one. I wouldn't hesitate to stay there again. If you need some time away from the Strip, this is a great place to stay. If you rent a car, you can drive to many restaurants in the area, there's a great variety. Parking is free, valet complimentary. We also took a drive to the Red Rocks area, beautiful! Don't be afraid to stay at the JW Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “My New Favorite Resort!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: BlueEyedJerseyGirl
Reviews.Content: Wow.....this resort is a sight for sore eyes!! You will be in awe when you pull up to the valet area...the grounds and pool are gorgeous...valet service is wonderful...although this resort is a distance from the strip...we rented a car so this was not a problem for us...Check in was quick and easy...and you wont have to enter a smoky casino to get to your room-pretty sweet, huh? We ate at the Promenade Cafe which overlooks the casino...pretty decent food at reasonable prices.....and there is also a Starbucks coffee...an Irish pub, and a buffet.....The Palms Tower also has Ceres which we didnt try....Also...right down the road is Mimi's Cafe which serves awesome breakfasts....and try Claim Jumper ( across from Mimis) for dinner...you wont be disappointed....the desserts are GIGANTIC! The rooms are more spacious than the Bellagio in my opinion...The bathroom is to die for...marble floors and entryway....jetted whirlpool bath tub ...rain shower and separate water closet. The front desk was very prompt in sending a rollaway bed for my son and I truly can't find any faults with this resort.....paid $102 a night on Priceline and I am extremely satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED it.. will be back again soon!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had an excellent stay! You forget that you're in Las Vegas, but the strip is only a short cab ride away. The rooms were fantastic, loved the bathrooms and all of the personnel were nice and extremely helpful. It was nice to get to the lobby without having to walk through a smoky casino. I had (2) great spa treaments; their entire spa facility is wonderful. I plan on making this an annual trip! If you want the excitement and energy of the strip, this is not the place to stay. If you want a nice relaxing hotel & resort, this should be your first choice. Definitely one of my favorite hotels in the US.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to expectations”
Reviews.Author: Brown-2004
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights in March. I called the hotel the day before our arrival to confirm our reservationand to request an early check in. I was asked what time we might arrive and I told the clerk that it would be between 11 and 12 noon. She said they were not sold out so this would not be a problem I also asked for the Palms Tower as it was our 50th Wedding anniversary and She advised me that this was the quieter of the two towers. When we arrived the next day at 1:30 and went to check in at the Palms Tower we were told that we were too early.After I explained that we had called the day before the clerk told me that I must have been talking to central reservations. Then we stood there at the counter for 37 minutes while the clerk looked for a room BUT in doing so allowed herself to be interupted by others coming up to the counter and asking questions as well as answering the phone and talking to the aaccounting office Finally I gave up and asked for whatever they could give us and we ended up in tne Spa Tower. So our luggage had to be reloaded into the car and off we went back to the other entrance. The room was nice and the bathroom was super ( love that shower!) We had to phone and have an engineer up to repair the A/C system. Then we put a few soft drinks in the refrigerator only to find out that it was not a fridge but a cooler which you had to go and fill the ice bucket and place inside.This was a new one on us inspite of having travelled all over the world and in all 50 states. A little note on the front might have helped! They have a unique way of locking the door to the balconey that belies explanation. The grounds are beautiful and we thoroughly enjoyed the pool Ceres is a waste of time. The breakfast was just so so and not worth the price. The Japanese Restaurant was also just OK but do try the Irish Pub as it has the best food of them all. This being our 50th Anniversary and having told them at both check in desks, we thought they might at least put a card or some acknowlgement in our room as this was a pretty major milestone in our lives but I guess we were expecting too much of Marriott. Back to the strip on our next vegas trip!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place but too far from the strip”
Reviews.Author: borntotravel999
Reviews.Content: Spent a long weekend there in February and really enjoyed the hotel and casino. The hotel was very clean, the rooms are very spacious and the bathrooms are wonderful (loved the very large jacuzzi tub). All the staff was courteous and helpful. Great selection of restaurants. Found that the casino dealers during the day were much more friendlier than the ones at night (spent 50% of our time at the craps tables). Pools are closed this time of year, they are not heated. did not use the free shuttle to the strip, we had a rental car. The complimentary vallet parking was fantastic. We had a wonderful time. The only downfall is that it is too far from the strip, probably 20 minutes and the traffic to get to the strip is horrible. Next time we will probably stay at a resort within 5 minutes of the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: wwwemm
Reviews.Content: This is an exceptionally well-run hotel. The service from everyone is outstanding. This is THE place to stay if you want quiet, sophisticated luxury at a reasonable price. The food is great and there is a nice variety of restaurants. Only one thing was disappointing - the pool (which is huge complete with giant rock-waterfall) is evidently closed during the winter season. Highly recommend this to anyone who wants to be away from the unbelievably overbuilt and frenetic environment of the Strip. The "Junior" Suites are anything but - ours was spacious and elegantly furnished. Look forward to when we can return.

Reviews.Title: “all the other reviews are over rated!”
Reviews.Author: taniabh
Reviews.Content: i picked this hotel from reading the reviews. it was nothing as i expected. the lobby looks good, but the room is empty and nothing special, large bathroom again sort of empty. our room looked nothing like the picture on the internet. the casino is horrible - old and tatty. we paid $249 for room and breakfast,plus $10 for internet. infact i was so disappointed we left the next day for the venetian which was cheaper and much nicer. it is a fair drive from the strip - 20 minutes maybe more depending on traffic. we stayed in jw in mexico city and the standard does not even compare - the mexico city one is 10 times better.

Reviews.Title: “JW Marriott, awesome hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: JW Marriott is a beautiful hotel on a ridiculously nice property. That is what MAKES this hotel. The landscape is gorgeous. Rooms are really sharp, bathrooms are the best I've experienced. Lobby is small, but very nicely appointed. Everything about this place is 5 star. The "Rampart" casino inside is nice, $5 mins/day $10/night. Dealers, some were very rude, others were very nice. Ballrooms are OK, not up to the 5 star standard in my opinion. Nice, but bland. This hotel is a solid 20+ minute drive from the strip (which is great after you've "done" the strip umteen times). Highly recommended. **OMEGA** Fort Wayne, IN

Reviews.Title: “2nd Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We'll never stay anywhere else . . . and why? When the JW has everything, right down to a rain shower! We enjoyed cheap eats from midnight to 6am, and sat back enjoying a beautiful view of the mountains. The staff was at our service . . . we were treated like royalty--REALLY! Spacious, clean accomodations. We will play hookie and come here again and again! Honeymooning from Chicago

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but too far from the strip”
Reviews.Author: worldtripper
Reviews.Content: I am typing this review as I am in my room at the JW Marriot. The room is big, the bathroom very nice and the view of the mountains is nice. I walked around the facility yesterday, nice, everything looks good. BUT, I was trying to save on cash and their shuttle to the strip is a great FREE feature, but the shuttle to take us to the strip was late (due to traffic) and after being dropped off at Fashion show Mall, then I had to get a cab to the restaurant and was almost late for that. After hanging out at a great club last night, I had to get a cab back out to the hotel last night at 12am. This was not fun. This morning I seriously considered checking out, and moving to the strip. It's pretty out here, but that isn't what I came to Vegas for! I am going to stick it out, but wish I was in a mid-strip hotel. If you want convience, stay on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Choice”
Reviews.Author: Annoyingeffort
Reviews.Content: An excellent hotel. We had a really large room with a luxury bath, a reasonable price, and the hotel staff went out of their way to be helpful. The hotel has a quiet casino, a good Italian restaurant and they were able to get discounts at decent nearby golf courses. If the traffic is heavy on the freeway, you can easily get downtown on the local streets. It takes about 15 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - Far from the strip, which could be good or bad.”
Reviews.Author: GoMets
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights Dec 30-Jan 3. Hotel was great, room was huge and new. The rooms were far bigger than similarly priced hotels on the strip (although like most reveiwers I used points). Summerlin is great if you want to be in Vegas but not in the craziness. The drive typically took 30 min to the strip (although it was around New Year's which is not typical traffic). Overall, if you are interested in seeing some of outdoor stuff near vegas (Red Rock Canyon is 5 min away), or golf (right next door to TPC), and/or you want a calmer Vegas experience, this place is great. The Irish pub was good, and the casino was also fairly good (bad rules though). They gave us a partial comp on the hotel bill, so don't be afraid to ask. You'll need to rent a car if you visit the strip/downtown often.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Spot Near the Mountains -- Palm Trees Galore”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Simply delicious! The hotel is lovely, and the facilities fabulous. The service was impeccable. It is rated 5 star, and that it is! Be sure to try the rain shower in the shower stall. Restaurants pricey, we opted for Casino coffee shop -- they have specials all day long. Odd that hotel and casino are private entities, but they do end up working well together. Many ground floor rooms have fabulous patios, with seating for a small gathering.

Reviews.Title: “A cut above”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I've stopped in many of the "big" hotels in Las Vegas over the last ten years. Many of them have the big show, or the big frontage, but few have the shear class that the J.W. does. From the moment we arrived we were greeted by the valet parking staff, who were friendly. This continued throughout the whole stay. The rooms were quiet, very spacious, had a great view, and were comfortable. The Jacuzzi bath and rain shower was a tremendous plus. Some would say the location away from the strip is a downside, but I can only say this is a plus, with a very convenient bus service to the strip. The pool area was excellent the only shame being the pool being closed for a day, due to a kid vomiting in the pool :( The question is, are we going back... YES, and for twice as long in march 2005.

Reviews.Title: “What a weekend !!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Fantastic place to spend some leisure time. Relaxing, Entertaining and what a room! One of the most enjoyable and restful stays my wife and i have had.

Reviews.Title: “Head off the strip to the JW Marriott”
Reviews.Author: HeyMan76
Reviews.Content: Just got back from my 25th trip to Vegas (so you think I like this place?)! Stayed for the second time at the JW and it only gets better! Spent 3 nights in a junior suite and this hotel gets my 5 stars for one of the best hotels in Vegas. It's about a 20 minute ride to the strip so a rental car is a must, but having stayed at just about every major strip hotel it's a nice break from all the hustle and bustle that goes on inside of these hotels. For starters, you don't need to navigate through the casino maze to get to your room. In fact, the JW has 2 front desks. The main one in the Spa tower and another in the Palm tower. Having stayed in both my only suggestion is to ask for an upgrade to a suite in either tower though even the standard rooms rate better than strip counterparts such as The Mirage, Paris, Caesars, MGM, and Mandalay Bay. Big rooms, huge bathrooms with rain showers and the suites add a beautiful living room with wet bar and a hot tub in the bath. And the rooms are just the beginning. The grounds are spread out and beautifully landscaped like a tropical oasis with waterfalls and secluded grottos. Great pool area, never crowded and very few kids. Spa is probably second only to Canyon Ranch in the Venetian. Great food at the buffet (only open for lunch and dinner), along with one of the top Italian restaurants in all of Las Vegas and a nice little casino if you don’t feel like venturing out to the strip. If you’ve travel to Vegas often, you owe it to yourself to stay at least once at the JW Marriott. You’ll have a great time!

Reviews.Title: “So relaxing”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Having spent the first 4 days of our Vegas trip at the Aladdin and doing the strip thing, we were ready for a relaxing next 5 days. We stayed Friday 1st - Wednesday 6th October. Only about 10 minutes drive out of town, pulled up at the Valet and was greeted by a very happy valet guy. He looked after the car while we checked in. The whole place was very quiet and relaxed. There was one person at reception, and tbh that's all it warranted, it was a very unobtrusive feel to the place. Checked in. Caused a nightmare because I have 4 different reservations for the 5 nights. One of the companies had screwed up and booked 2 beds for one night, as opposed to one bed for 2 nights. She said not to worry and was fine about it all. We were over at the other tower, so back to Valet. Guy opened car doors for us and away we went. Pulled up at the other valet and the guy helped u out with our bags and took car of the car. Room was on the 1st floor and was massive. It overlooked the little river/waterfall that seems to run throught the whole complex. Bed was huge. In the UK we have normal double beds, there I dont think I could even reach out and find my other half. Walk in wardrobe and gorgeous bathroom. It was all soo clean and in A1 condition. Even though there were 3 weddings during our time there, there was never any noise. Pool was lovely but not at all crowded. Valets remembered who we were and where we were from. Its a great position to go off to red rock canyon, and to get back on the interstate. PF Chang, Banana republic and Gap just down the road along with the usual Target and 7/11. The hot tub by the pool, well 2 of them, were open 24 hours a day and were a great size. Free USA Today on weekdays outside your room. Only went in the casino once for the toilet!! Now for the food. Having had breakfast at Paris while on the strip, I dont think any buffet can compare to that. There is no breakfast buffet but lunch starts at 11am so thats no problem as we got up late most of the time. Food was a lot cheaper than the strip but wasnt as good, as Paris. However waitresses were very helpful, there was also a bit of a queue. Sunday, they do a champagne brunch with crab and fresh seafood. In the UK 1kg of prawns cost about $30 in supermarkets, so I took full advantage of the food. I think it was about $13 for champagne brunch. Food was really the only let down, if they got the buffet a bit better (its still on par with say the mirage) they would be 100% there I reckon. Also, one thing to note, we were in our mid twenties and the average age eating in the buffet was of retirement age. I dont care but some people may prefer to be with a younger crowd, altho by the pool everyone was about 30-40 age group. My dad cannot wait to go to Vegas now and check out this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful and sincere customer service”
Reviews.Author: Misheller
Reviews.Content: As an adminstrative assistant for my marketing department, I spend alot of time researching and arranging travel, tradeshows, events and meetings. It is very nice to know that a resort has true sincere employees who actually like helping others. Customer service is a true art and is alive and well here. Thank you to Jennifer and the staff for all your help! It is truly appreciated. I would highly recommend the J.W. Marriott Resort, Spa & Golf for any corporate event.

Reviews.Title: “A great experience overall”
