Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A girlfriend and I booked a double queen room internet package here for the weekend of 10/15-17/2004. We had a great stay - the room was spacious, smoke free and nicely laid out, the outdoor pool was huge and the Acqua Sulis spa was a great facility. It had indoor and outdoor waterfall showers, multiple sauna and steam rooms, as well as multiple choices of indoor and outdoor varying temperature soaking pools. The hotel was very un-Vegas like in that it was more like a destination resort. This is a place to relax rather than hang off the rafters. You really didn't know that there was a casino on the property until you ventured away from your rooms to the casino connecting the two hotel towers. However, the Strip is only about 12 minutes away by freeway and Downtown is even closer, so partying is always easily available . . .

Reviews.Title: “Look no further”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was the first trip my girlfriend and I had taking to Vegas, so I decided to make this trip as enjoyable as possible and I have to thank everyone at the JW Marriott Las Vegas and Rampart Casino for helping me succeed. To be honest, short, and to the point, I don't have to worry about where I'm staying ever again when traveling to Vegas, because I'll be staying at JW Marriott Las Vegas Resort, Spa & Golf. Derek West from Dallas gives you a guarantee that you won't be disappointed. I give a special and very big thank you to the Valet service for everything they did. (and it's free).....

Reviews.Title: “Marriott beats the best”
Reviews.Author: stevilsize
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough about how fabulous this resort is. My wife said we may move our annual Hawaii trip to Las Vegas! All the reviews I read were correct--although fully booked, we never saw more than 25 people at the pool--more like 10. And the rooms were the best we've ever been in--you could put a Hampton room in the bathroom! Also, if you like quiet rooms (read the other resort reports--scarry!), this is the place to be. Might as well had the place to ourselves. We'll definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for visiting family in Sun City”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: the JW Marriott Las Vegas is the perfect location in Vegas if you are visiting family members in Sun City or Summerlin. We love the hotel atmosphere in the lobby, a much prefered entrance for families with children because you don't enter the hotel through a casino. The rooms are large, the bathrooms are elegant! Don't miss taking a stroll through the gardens.

Reviews.Title: “Las Vegas’s Best Kept Secret”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Normally I do not disclose to anyone the hotels that I like to stay in for fear that it would become too popular and ruin the atmosphere that drew me to stay there in the first place, but for the JW Marriott Las Vegas I will make an exception because I want the hotel to continue to keep up and continually provide the same quality service, so every time I stay there it would always be like the first time. I just got back from my vacation from the JW Marriott Las Vegas and again I had the best time staying at the hotel. I stayed in an average room with a balcony, but the room was as big as some of the suites I stayed in at other hotels. There is even a walk in closet…not a vanity closet that you get in other hotels. The room has a ceiling fan if you prefer a natural breeze instead of the cold air provided by the air conditioner. The bathroom is the best; it is all marbled with dual vanities, a large Jacuzzi tub, and a rain shower head. Men, this is the bathroom you won’t be fighting for space with your significant other. You can do your manly deeds while she does her feminine treatments. This saves an awful lot of time. The grounds are impeccable with manicured lawns with lush tropical conifers, surrounded by koi ponds. We enjoyed just walking around the grounds admiring the serenity of the hotel. The pool is large and spacious in a semi-tropical setting. It was not crowded with sunbathers like you get at the strip hotels. The JW Marriott Las Vegas is after all a Resort & Spa. So, there is always something to do for those wishing to leave the gambling behind from their quaint casino between the two towers. For golfers, I hear the courses are some of the best. If you’re into a spa and massage, wait until you get a look at the spa facilities it is awesome to say the least. I used the spa exercise facility and I really worked up a sweat after eating all the good food from their buffet. Speaking of food, the buffet was very, very reasonable priced. There was enough diversity to even please the most discriminating pallets. We ate at the waterside café for breakfast and sat outside close to the waterfalls. My girlfriend thoroughly enjoyed the romantic setting. I like staying at the JW Marriott Las Vegas because the lobby and the rooms are far away from the casino and you won’t have to come down from your room hearing the loud noises and smell the smoke filled rooms like the casinos on the strip. I also like the fact it is away from the strip. I don’t particularly like the crowds and the hustle and bustle of the strip. The JW Marriott Las Vegas is not only a great place to get away, but a wonderful place to bring your family.

Reviews.Title: “JW the place to stay in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: WOW! This is the place to stay when visiting Vegas, especially when traveling with children. One evening spent on the strip only confirmed my feelings. The JW has a large pool with a large waterfall, chairs were never a problem and we were traveling with 4 children and 3 adults during our 8/11 - 8/14 trip. We booked two rooms and they were both wonderful. The bathroom and dressing areas are beautiful and oversized. They have several restaurants, gift shops, and of course the casino. They also run a shuttle service back and forth to the strip. Check the times at the front desk for availability. We used it twice during our stay to go to the strip for a couple of daytime shopping trips. If you like constant night life, noise and crowds, then this is not the place for you. But if you want to stay away from that and you don't mind driving into the strip (a 15/20 drive), then this is the resort for you. Book this, kick back and enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “The Way To Go!”
Reviews.Author: caldrmn
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a three day stay with my family at the JW Marriott Las Vegas Resort and I'm glad I took the advise of most of those who recommended this resort. We had a wonderful time! I chose this resort as an alternative to one of the hotels on the strip simply because I believed there must be a nice hotel in Las Vegas that wasn't on the strip. I found it in the JW Marriott Las Vegas. Everyone was friendly and very attentive to our needs. We stayed in the SPA tower section of the resort. The room was fantastic - roomy, large bathroom with spa tub and separate rainfall shower. Yes...this was a standard room. Although we made several trips to the 'strip' for sightseeing and a show, we couldn't wait to get back to the resort away from the crowds and enjoy the layed back atmosphere it afforded. Marriott really did some great pre-planning before building this hotel and it shows. We definitely will be staying at this hotel in the future! As a previous reviewer also stated, the JW Marriott is about 15 minutes out of town off HWY 95 and we did encounter an accident on the HWY, which made one of our trips into the strip a little longer, but we didn't mind. We still believe the hotel is the best value around considering what it offers in return. This is definitely a one of a kind off-Strip hotel that is not to be missed.

Reviews.Title: “JW is my new Boyfriend :)”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Absolutely wonderful. The spa was superb, the Italian restaurant was delicious, the cafe by the pool was fantastic, the staff was amazing, the dealers in the casino were all great, and don't get me started on the room. And if we're talking about the room, we can not not mention the bathroom with the waterfall shower and the spa bathtub for two. We were worried about staying off the strip, but now we find that we may never stay on the strip again. If you do choose to go to the strip for a show or dinner, we found that it was quite easy, just go before rush hour and it's real quick. I can't say enough of this resort. And I can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “A Diamond in the Desert”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a three night stay at the fabulous J.W. Marriott in Summerlin. My wife and I and our two boys, ages 8 and 11, were looking for a quick, relaxing getaway. My wife adamantly refused to take our boys to any hotels on the strip, but I longed for a little gambling in my favorite city. We compromised and decided on the Marriott. It could not have been a better decision. We booked a junior suite, which was both spacious and impressive. We had two bathrooms, which allowed a family of four to peacefully get ready each morning. We had a jacuzzi tub and a separate walk in shower with a "rainfall" type shower head in the ceiling. Our eight-year-old begged us to let him take a shower at least twice a day. The pool was quite big and we were the only ones there to enjoy it. The casino is small but adequate with a decent sports book. The strip and downtown were minutes away by freeway. This is a great choice for both families and couples looking for an ideal spot for relaxation.

Reviews.Title: “An Oasis in the Desert”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: An OASIS in the desert! Our first time "off the strip", and we fell in LOVE with the gorgeous rooms, mountain views, spa-like bathrooms, and stunning grounds. We slept each night with our french doors open to enjoy the sound of the waterfalls. The restaurants (Ceres & Spiedini) were excellent: offering al fresco and in-door dining. We also enjoyed a fun lunch at the Irish Pub. The pool area is exceptional: and we enjoyed NOT fighting for chairs or awaking at 7:00 a.m. to stand in a line. The staff was very professional and exceptionally courteous. We travelled with friends who also loved this place. The men enjoyed TPC golf course and my friend and I adored the spa: classes, amenities and treatments. In the a.m., we enjoyed a quick trip downstairs to the StarBucks (reg. coffee avail. in the rooms) for an awesome (and reasonably priced coffee.) We paid up to $7.50 for 2 coffees at Caesars. If you're looking for a beautiful spot away from the crowds and hubbub, this is IT. It's the first time in years that we've returned from Vegas RELAXED. (p.s. The Sun Coast is fun for gambling!) No doubt, we're planning our return for 2005.

HotelInfo.Name: JW Marriott Las Vegas Resort, Spa & Golf
HotelInfo.Address: 221 N Rampart Blvd, Las Vegas, NV 89145
